story:
The BaseBlocks is a new, revolutionary training device that lets you perform over 50 bodyweight exercises for your upper body, core and lower body. It’s patent pending design has adjustable uprights – allowing you to change the leverage and difficulty based on your fitness level.

 

 

 

 

A new product wasn’t enough. We wanted to make a program that took you from the basics (pushups, rows and planks) to the stuff that looks awesome (levers, pistols and handstands). We knew that people would try and skip the basics and jump straight to the awesome, so we made criteria for doing the harder stuff. 

Our training program categorizes exercises as Level 1, Level 2 or Level 3. Everyone starts as a beginner, and you’ll need to hit a target number of reps on specific exercises to level up. This gamified approach of 'unlocking' exercises makes the BaseBlocks suitable for all fitness levels by making the user perform exercises respective to their fitness level. Are you a beginner looking to do dips? You’ll first need to hit 20 pushups.

 

 

 

 

Our team of talented designers have gone through an extensive prototyping process to make the BaseBlocks easy to transport, store and assemble. The uprights are removable, secured by two holsters attached to the base, making it easy to carry for outdoor workouts, or slide into small spaces for storage. The setup is simple – attach the uprights to the base with a simple click and you’re ready to workout!

*Suitable for users 205lbs. (93kg) and under

 

 

 

 

 

*The uprights are spaced 18" apart  

 

To keep things simple, our program is centred around mastering five main bodyweight movements. Below is the Level 3 goal for each movement. You'll begin with Level 1 exercises and unlock the harder stuff as you get fitter. 

 

 

 

 

 

 *For safety, users are strongly encouraged to follow our exercise progressions.

Our workouts are simple, but tough. Each workout targets your whole-body using four main movements; 
1. An upper body pressing movement (eg - pushups or dips)
2. An upper body pulling movement (eg - rows or hold-ups)
3. A lower body movement (eg - squat jumps or pistols)
4. A core movement (eg - l-sit or knee raises)

Each suit corresponds to one of the above movements. The number on the card indicates the number of repetitions you will need to perform. That's 95 reps per exercise each workout. Develop strength, endurance and cardio, all in the same session.

 

 

"BaseBlocks has helped with improving my functional strength for Brazilian Jiu Jitsu. Between rolling on the mat and coding at work, it's sometimes hard to get to the gym. It's super convenient being able to train wherever and whenever I want." 

" The BaseBlocks look amazing! They’re taking canes to the next level - totally adjustable and can be customized to fit any height you’re feeling playful with that day. BaseBlocks is innovating handstands and arm-balancing. I am so excited to see where this company goes!" 

"I'm always looking for new ways to cross-train for Surfing and MMA. The Blocks have been a great new addition to my training routine - I can squeeze in a full-body workout that improves my strength, balance and body awareness."  

"My name is Jason. I have two passions - fitness and creating stuff. Four years ago, I invented the Combat X Trainer; a device used by grapplers to simulate a training partner. It took me all over the world and allowed me to work closely with some of the best international fighters; like Lyoto Machida and Reubens 'Cobrinha' Charles. It was so fun, I decided I want to keep doing it. I now work closely with a team of designers and manufacturers, bringing new fitness ideas to life. I hope they make you sweat."

story:
I am trying to raise money to help the states with the WWP protests. Since we are entirely a grassroots project, with no backing of a 501C, it has been difficult to come up with funding for basic things such as costs for fliers, electric equipment, t shirts and the basic necessities of these types of events. 

What We Need & What You Get

A couple of the states involved are doing their own fundraising, but this is intended for the states that have not had any fundraising events yet. Here is a list of basic costs some states are having trouble with.

* Equipment Rental Fees (mics and speakers)
* Permit or insurance fees
* Tshirts and bracelets
* Printing out fliers and other materials
* Shipping costs
* Rentals (tables, chairs, parks)
* Light Bulbs and Ribbons 

Note: Some of these items would be willingly donated if we could get a non profit to back us by writing letters for us with their letterhead. (such as light bulbs, Ribbons and poster board from Home Depot)

The Impact

This is the first annual Worldwide Lyme Disease Awareness Protest. This has never been done before. Over twenty countries and over twenty states are involved in this. I would like to have every state represented, even if they can not do a physical event, they can be involved by participating in the Ribbons Across America and Samantha's Project (turn your porch lights green) or the petition signing and letter writing campaigns. This protest is by the people for the people. We have designed this Protest so that there is something each of you  can do even if you are homebound. It is important that each person feel heard in this. 
To read more about what your state is doing click here.

Other Ways You Can Help

* Spread the word! Helps us get the word out!
* Donate items to your state events, such as ribbons, pins, green light bulbs, lyme fliers or brochures, tables, chairs, equipment such as speakers and mics. 
* Show up at your state event! 
* Contact media. Click Here for More Details

If you would lke to contact the state leader in your state and see what kind of help they need Please Click Here

story:
Hi, I am an herbalist and my passion is to see others helped by the use of natural herbal medicines. I' ve been identifying wild medicinal plants and helping to educate others on how to use them safely and effectively for the last fifteen years. After a senior monk asked me in 1997 to learn about the local herbs that were growing here around us and  make them into medicines for people, I took it up seriously until this day. I feel very blessed by God to have been given this service to others and to see how it's helped so many improve the quality of their lives. Now, at an older age, I still desire to keep this herbal service going, but due to economic struggles i can no longer provide them for free and since i work long hrs. at jobs that are very exhausting. I have a plan to start a facility that could help produce a couple of incredible organic herb products; a Cracks and Cuts salve that conditions and rejeuvenates your skin, and a supremely effective massage oil for muscle and joint issues of all kinds that honestly surpasses the effeciveness of most over-the-counter analgesics out there. By launching this small business, we will be able to keep providing Americans one of the things they need most; practical knowledge of how to use herb remedies side by side with their existing allopathic healthcare programs. Why? Herbs are amazingly regenerating, rejeuvenating, rectifying and generally very safe to use without many side effects at all.

First, I must make the product in a GMP-approved facility, following Good Manufacturing Practices. which means that I'll require funding to help me pay my cost of renting  a certified facility, which could be up to as much as $800.00 per month to get started. I'll also need to upgrade my equipment, which includes cookers, scales and such. Lastly, I'll need some legal services to liscence my company which I'm calling AYURVEDIC RELIEF. There are many start-up expenses, and anything you can give will help. 

Who I am:
My name is David Hissey, & I' grew up in Los Angeles, CA. I'm the son of two elementary school teachers from coastal suburbia L.A.  My parents taught me a good bit about the value of natural living, and I kept that with me all my life.  I've been residing in Northern West Virginia as a monk since 1996 and I'm part of an Eco-Intentional Community in Moundsville. I believe strongly that the Lord (and friend of us all) wants us to live less complicated lives, free from excessive stress and anxiety, and that by using His incredible gifts, herbal medicines, we can come closer to that ideal, and live more peaceful, spiritually fufilling lives on earth.

What I Do
Through years of detailed research work (from Northern Canada to our Southern States) of physicians’ materia medicas and other herbalists’ findings, I came to realize how natural herbal-based  remedies were THE medicines that doctors gave people and cured people with up until the early 1900’s. At that point, I made my life work to revive and refine the manufacturing of these local and pure herbal formulas, and get them out on the market. Natural herb formulas are really "SMART MEDICINES", meaning that they can multitask to support and assist many different functions or you body. "Feeling is Believing" and we're sure that you'll be amazed with natural remedies once you try them!  Local residents of the Ohio Valley area who have tried these formulas over the years have urged me to go foward with this production and distribution on a larger scale, so that more can take advantage of them. This is what the campaign is about, ‘Herbs For People'. 

What Your Donations Go For:

Your kind donations will go towards helping get us us legal help and providing us a jumpstart in the production and marketing of these formulas to the public (through EBAY and other physical outlets throughout the United States). The following is an itemization of how the funds will be used:

1.  $3,500.00 :  which provides us the capacity to use an FDA certified facililty  for producing the herbal products and other business marketing support. (We're considering using the Advantage West Company in Asheville, NC area. This company teworks conjointly with the North Carolina dept. of Commerce.)  ( The Cost: $3,000.00 i for six months of production which includes various other misc. fees).

2.$500.00 for Raw Materials such as Organic oils, essential oils, Beeswax, etc.

3. $1,200.00 for bulk bottles & jars which will allow us to purchasein bulk, reducing our costs dramatically.

4. $500.00 for set-up fees and legal advise


TOTAL NEEDED TO BE RAISED:  $5,800.00.

 WHY ARE WE RAISING FUNDS?
We are raising funds to expand our important work of providing 100% natural, locally-produced items to the people of America and elsewhere.. I am determined to keep this work going and be successful at it.I'll have no other realistic choice.  In a time where practically 80-90 % of what you can buy is from China and other foreign places, I feel a need for poeple like you to have access to high-quality, pure herbal products as an addition to your present health care programs. We need our doctors of course, and the present medical system that we have in the U.S.  has developed many wonderful and life-saving procedures. But, we want to  provide these  100%, ALL-NATURAL HERB REMEDIES to people, so that the quality of your health will greatly improve and that your lives will become more pleasent, less stressful and much fufilling.  Thank you  for your support to making this vision a reality!   Sincerely yours,  David Hissey

story:
Short Summary

Narrative Dimensions advances a culture of caring by helping people discover and express their personally unique experience of health and illness.  We promote personal narrative, self awareness, authenticity, and resiliency to enrich the lives of all those touched by illness, including patients, caregivers, and health care professionals. 

We're working to address the more human aspects of chronic illness. We can all agree that for a lot of diseases we've gotten really good at fixing things with medical treatment. But one area where we need improvement is responding to situations where there is no clear road to restoring health.

What we need 

We've had amazing feedback from our workshop participants who tell us that they’ve never before had the chance to tell their whole story to people who get it. Their enthusiasm at the end of the workshop is obvious. But as we gain momentum we need additional resources to reach more people in need.                                                                                 

To really take this to the next level, we need to compensate our team for their time and energy to do this work and to invest in promoting our programs to multiply their impact. We need at least $5,000 to cover travel costs for our facilitators to deliver these workshops in Ann Arbor, Chicago, and Pittsburgh, and to create podcasts and webinars so more people can access our content.

The smallest "yes" combined with many others really adds up. If you're inspired to create a big impact, ask your friends and loved ones if they would love to see this project thrive. Please consider forming a giving circle to raise $1,000 together!

The Impact

Imagine you are seriously ill. Your entire life has been changed drastically because of your condition. Healthcare treatments are becoming more effective and there are more options for treatment than ever, and you rely on these cutting-edge medical technologies to survive.  

There is, however, a gap between provider and patient. The personal relationship, or what we call the culture of caring, has been lost. Now that the relationship between mind and body is irrefutable, the importance of a culture of caring is undeniable.

Our primary program toward addressing this gap is the Living Well with Illness Workshop. The workshop itself is a multi-faceted process consisting of inviting people to tell their story to supportive individuals, reflecting on the impact of illness on various aspects of life, and participating in  expressive activities that involve a combination of  mindfulness, writing, and art.

Engaging in a more active role than patient in treatment, participants are invited to a creative experience to expand their view of the influence of illness on their life and the possibility of a creative response. We seek to inspire people to be true to their individual needs when interacting with their healthcare professionals, friends and family, and community.

People whose lives have been impacted by illness will have the chance to take advantage of time and space to reflect on the meaning of their illness for their lives. This caring reflection could infuse more precision in conversations between doctors and patients. This promotes efficiency for the healing endeavors of health care.  At the end of the day, our vision is a culture of caring where patients, caregivers, and healthcare professionals, together, understand and respond to three big questions:

1. How has illness impacted your life?

2. Which of these impacts has affected you the most?

3. How do you wish to live from here on out?

Risks & Challenges

The biggest obstacle we face is getting the support of healthcare professionals. That said, the depth of understanding we have of this content will help us to develop a comprehensive curriculum to educate professionals about effective ways of communicating with people who have chronic illnesses. This effort will help close the circle in doctor-patient communication. Doctors and patients will speak and understand the same language.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute monetarily but are still excited about our project, please use the Indiegogo share tools and help us get the word out about our initiative.  

Keep in touch. Check out our website and join our mailing list. We'd love to hear from you.

story:
Our Story

The Pill Pouch was invented by Kathi Sitek,the sole caretaker to her elderly parents.  The original Pill Pouch was a repurposed piece of cardboard box with each of Stella's medication scotch taped to the left side and the name, dosage, usage and instructions written to the right.  Kathi and Stella used the tool as a visual reference to set up Stella's weekly medication regimen. Stella used it as a daily reference when taking her medication (referencing the pill's visual and instructions). They also used the Pill Pouch as a consolidated source of information for medical professionals in case of an emergency (e.g. Emergency Room visit) or during routine doctor visits.  Kathi learned how important accurately managing multiple medications was to the health and well being of her mother, Stella. 


This experience inspired Kathi to help empower other individuals and their caregivers to become an expert in their own health through informed medication management reducing confusion and improving overall health.

The Impact

Empowering individuals and their caregivers to have control over their medication regimen by consolidating and organizing information, reducing confusion, and improving overall health and well being.

What We Need & What You Get

$3,850 to raise awareness on the importance of medication management, and present the Pill Pouch as an important tool in taking control of complex medication regimens.  Your investment will help develop material and targeted outreach to individuals taking multiple medications and their caregivers. In addition, TechTown (http://techtownwsu.org/) a non-profit, Detroit, Michigan-based business incubator is willing to match 2:1 the funding we receive from you through our crowd funding campaign to further expand the medication management education material and targeted outreach.

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us get the word out about medication management by Liking our Facebook Page (http://www.facebook.com/PillPouch), Following us on Twitter (http://twitter.com/#!/PillPouch) and checking out our website at http://www.pillpouch.net/ for more information about how to manage your medication and the importance of medication management.  Thank you for your support!

$3,850 to raise awareness on the importance of medication management, and present the Pill Pouch as an important tool in taking control of complex medication regimens.  Your investment will help develop material and targeted outreach to individuals taking multiple medications and their caregivers. In addition, TechTown (http://techtownwsu.org/) a non-profit, Detroit, Michigan-based business incubator is willing to match 2:1 the funding we receive from you through our crowd funding campaign to further expand the medication management education material and targeted outreach.

Other Ways You Can Help
Help us get the word out about medication management by Liking our Facebook Page (http://www.facebook.com/PillPouch), Following us on Twitter (http://twitter.com/#!/PillPouch) and checking out our website at http://www.pillpouch.net/ for more information about how to manage your medication and the importance of medication management.  Thank you for your support!

story:
Hello-

        My name is Cherice Quackenbush and my husband is Tate Quackenbush and we have a sweet little girl who needs a safe bed to sleep in that will last her the rest of her life. We love taking care of our sweet girl but it breaks our heart that she doesn’t have a safe place to sleep. We are on a fixed income and insurance doesn’t cover a bed for her. We are so eager to get her this bed so Stacey can continue to have sweet dreams and stay safe. Stacey is severely disabled and has 3 rare diseases and that also makes her the only her in the world! Helping to fund getting Stacey a bed will greatly impact her life because she won’t have to worry about falling out of bed. Which is a huge danger since Stacey doesn’t have any of her protective reflexes, those are the ones that tell you to catch yourself when you are falling. 

What we need and what you get!

We need approx. $1200 to pay for the bed which is being built by a dear friend of ours who is a master carpenter and is only charging us materials and a fraction of his labor costs. And his son is going to be arranging for someone to airbrush a mural on the inside of the bed for Stacey to look at =) The $1200 is a huge discount compared to how much these beds retail which is between $6,000-$9,000. If we don’t reach our goal of $1200 by Jan 31st then Stacey will have to wait that much longer for her to have a safe bed. We have some perks that you can get for donating certain amounts.

Even if you are not able to donate money you are still able to help by spreading the word and sharing our story. On Facebook, Twitter, and e-mail. You can send money via PayPal too as a 'gift' cakesbyreece [at] gmail dot com

story:
I am totally overwhelmed and excited by the success of the first training!  My name is Megan and I am the owner of a Chichester Yoga in New York.  I teach studio classes and lead teacher trainings globally. I am passionate about education, but even more so, am devoted to helping heal trauma in areas that have suffered great loss.  Leading yoga teacher trainings and life skills classes in Rwanda has allowed me not only to facilitate change in others lives, but to combine my skills in the absolute perfect setting for me.  Some people thrive volunteering closes to home, but I come alive in Musanze and am able to use that energy to inspire and be of service.

Last February I went for just 10 days and taught the basics of teaching yoga.  We also touched on nutrition.  But mostly I focused on teaching the students how to move their bodies on the breath and to begin the process of healing. And in just 10 days, amazing things happened as a result, the biggest being that nearly one year later, they are still teaching and practicing. (which everyone said would last a week, HA!)  Among the other benefits of the training are that my translator got a call from Bennington College saying that they liked her application but that they needed a little more to make a decision. She wrote to them about translating the training and that tipped the balance and she is now here!  And even practiced here in Chichester this past summer. Also worth noting is that one of the trainees visiting from Team Rwanda, the national cycling team had such a positive experience that he came to Chichester this past summer as well to do more training.  And he is now the only Rwandan yoga teacher in Kigali!  One of the project members healed her back pain with her practice and one other credits yoga to a successful birth of her first child.

 

This particular campaign is for translator fees and food and transportation for the trainees.   An money raised beyond that will go towards opening the first yoga studio in Musanze.

 

The impact on the community and Ubushobozi Project is potentially huge.  Ubushobozi is a project that helps head of household teenage girls learn trades, namely making bags and weaving baskets.  Opening a studio would provide them with an additional income stream and will be a much-needed oasis for the locals and the NGO workers in the area.  Our goal is to get the studio open in 2013 and to support the studio by providing year round training and supervision by the graduates of the Chichester Yoga Teacher Training.

story:
UPDATE 12/14/12: Alma has passed away 

Please see Update page for more information.

 

ORIGINAL POSTING:

Short Summary

Alma is my sister-in-law, and she has been diagnosed with stage 4 cancer that doctors believe started in her colon and has since spread to her liver and other parts of her body. She is 38 years old and has two children, ages 8 and 15. Unfortunately, Alma has no health insurance. We want her to get better, but every bit of her treatment has to be paid for with private funds. We could really use the help of the caring community at large to help defray some of those costs.

Treatment Details

The doctors have diagnosed Alma with stage 4 "terminal" cancer. We still hold out hope for her. We have started treating her with a very strict homeopathic regimen, which includes a special diet (green drinks among others), enemas/colonics, saunas, special baths, and much more. I am her brother-in-law and not directly involved in the treatments; we currently have a holistic therapist who is administering the treatments after consulting with others who have experience in this area. This therapist herself had breast cancer and cured herself using holistic treatments.

You'll be helping a young mother try to beat this disease. There are no gifts or rewards to receive, other than knowing you'll be doing a good deed. We will use the money explicitly for these treatments to help Alma get better.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, please help to get the word out about Alma. She is only 38 years old and she could really use your help. Share our IndieGogo link with others:

http://IndieGogo.com/Alma2012

And thank you sincerely for help.

-Mike

story:
You've just found the world's only multi-sport headphones that automatically measure your body and performance during any exercise, providing customized live voice feedback and coaching from some of the world's top coaches, to help you achieve your fitness goals like never before.

 

Without the need of any other device, Kuai gives instant voice feedback about your heart rate, speed, distance, calories and more. All effortlessly delivered to you by audio while listening to your favorite music and practicing any sport, including running, swimming, cycling, gym and more.

 

All other headphones need to be connected to multiple devices and do not provide the information you need to achieve your fitness goals. Kuai will help you keep fitter, lose weight or train for your next race, with the help of its accurate sensor technology and downloadable training plans that automatically adapt to your unique body. 

Kuai removes the guess work and inconvenience, helping you exercise more efficiently. It's like having your personal "wearable" coach!

 

 

 

 

Kuai removes the need to carry multiple devices, as it incorporates all the benefits of carrying a heart-rate strap, a sports watch, a foot pod, an MP3 player, and even having a coach present.

 

 

 

 

*If we reach our first stretch goal there will be one more colour to choose :)

 

 

 

Kuai’s patent pending design offers an unparalleled level of comfort and security, with ergonomic design and proprietary Sport Lock Technology, to secure around your ears for a perfect fit. Kuai comes with 3 types of eartips for use during different sports which provides an extra layer of security, comfort and performance.

 

 

Easily download training plans from the Kuai Platform and upload them to your Kuai Headphones.

  • Created by world champions (such as Dwight Phillips, below), professional coaches and celebrities, for different fitness levels.
  • Training plans for running, swimming, cycling, general fitness, weight loss, relaxation and recovery.
  • Plans guide users (by voice feedback) and adapt to their individual biometric data generated by the headphone's sensors (it's like having a wearable coach).
  • Multiple downloadable options including free samples, individual plans and monthly memberships.
  • Unique software platform that allows the creation, uploading and management of training plans.
Dwight Phillips; 5x World Champ, Olympic Gold, President USATF and Kuai Director

You can also use Kuai to exercise without Training Plans. Simply put your Kuai on, go for a workout and listen to your music. You can keep notifications like heart rate, pace, distance, calories, etc. on or you can switch them off and simply push the sport button on your Kuai at any time during training and receive instant voice notifications for all of your current performance data.

 

Kuai can operate autonomously or connected to your phone. At present we have the Kuai app available for iOS and Android, and through it you can see all your workouts data.

     

Connect your Kuai to your PC or Mac to upload music and training plans to your Kuai, access more detailed data from your workouts and create custom voice notifications.
                                                   

 

 

 

 

Kuai is a smart headset with all the sensors and internal memory to perform by itself. However, Kuai also incorporates Bluetooth 4.0 and ANT+  wireless technologies to allow it to connect to a multitude of devices should you wish to do so, including...

 

 

Kuai saves the sports data in .FIT format, so you can easily export your workouts to virtually any sport app or software in the market.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

All packages include three different ear tips to suit any sport, each in three different sizes (S, M, L) for the perfect fit.

 

 

Our initial research showed that people were extremely frustrated with the controls found in sport headphones because of the small buttons placed in inconvenient positions that made them nearly impossible to operate during exercise. Kuai was designed to offer users the easiest way to operate their sport headphones.

 

Kuai uses Clinically Validated technology to measure very precise biometric data during exercise. Unlike many other devices in the market Kuai delivers highly accurate heart rate during any sport, you can see a Peer Review Scientific Journal from Clinical Tests Publicly Funded in this link: http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/24743110

After two years of development, many sleepless nights, lots of prototypes and intensive testing, we are now preparing for mass production and start shipping in May 2016!

 

Ultra-marathoner and best seller David Clark has already run 9 marathons using Kuai, at iconic events like CES Vegas, ISPO Munich and Ironman 70.3 Boulder.

 

 

 

 

Screenshots from the iOS Kuai app of David's data after completing his last marathon at ISPO Munich.  Not bad considering he ran 3 more marathons in the 3 days before and 4 more marathons at CES Vegas two weeks prior!

 

 

 

Kuai was born from the desire to exercise more efficiently and make every second count during training.  Kuaiwear was created by Carlos, Oscar and Pablo; three marathoners, triathletes, and Ironmen with backgrounds in Software Development, Electronic Engineering and International Business.

Together with Chris and Bill; Software Engineers with experience developing products for some of the biggest names in the industry (Beats, Sony, and Nokia), and Dwight Phillips; a 5-time World Champion, Olympic Gold medalist, and President of the USATF, Kuaiwear is backed with the support of top-class advisers involved with OMRON, Sharp, NCR, Sony, HTC, Beats, and OSSIC.

        Kuai Team at the Escape from Alcatraz Triathlon - San Francisco 2015
 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

WHEN I WILL RECEIVE MY KUAI?

Please refer to the different perks for estimated delivery dates. We will do our best to deliver your perk on-time but please consider that this is a new product and delays in shipping may occur. 

PayPal Disclaimer: Delivery of rewards/perks are subject to best efforts and not guaranteed.

 

WHY KUAI?

Kuai are clinically validated multisport biometric headphones, which are waterproof up to three meters and calculate heart rate, VO2 max, calories, cadence, distance, pace and speed, on land and in water. Kuai eliminates the need to carry multiple devices during a workout by combining a heart rate monitor, foot pod, sport watch, MP3 player and virtual coach into one comfortable device. It is ideal for any sport and provides custom ear tips to suit each different sport.

Users can download professional training plans for a multitude of sports to train smarter and safer, while voice feedback and configurable voice alerts inform users about their heart rate, speed, cadence, distance, laps, calorie burn rate, etc. Kuai allows users to listen to music, answer phone calls and access detailed performance data during or after workouts and share it with friends and coaches using he Kuai platform or exporting the data using .FIT format used by all the mayor sport apps .

Kuai is compatible with Bluetooth Smart (BLE) and ANT+ and features desktop apps for PC and Mac and mobile apps for iOS and Android devices. Kuai offers 8GB of memory to store music, workouts and training plans, plus a 7-hour battery life.

HOW DOES KUAI WORK?

Clinically validated by Duke University, Kuai monitors users’ biometrics and sport performance using sensor technology.

Users have the ability to train while listening to their favorite music with the integrated MP3 player or by connecting to their phone. Kuai uses quality stereo sound and includes ear tips for different sports made of medical-grade silicone. Easy to use, Kuai only has two navigation switches to control all the sport and music functions, and has the ability to operate autonomously without a phone connection.

Kuai can connect to other devices using Bluetooth,  BLE and ANT+. Performance data is stored in the cloud to sync across all Kuai platforms and saved in .fit format to sync with other fitness apps.

CLINICALLY VALIDATED?

Yes, in partnership with the Duke University Center for Living, the performance of the biometrics used in Kuai was tested versus benchmark ECG and indirect calorimetry (measurement of heat produced by physical changes) sensors. The final results showed that the sensor technology used by Kuai measures heart rate and predicts energy expenditure accurately, with a low standard deviation for heart rate of ±4 percent and energy expenditure (or calories burned) of ±7 percent. Considering that the machine errors of the ECG and gas exchange analysis devices are within a standard deviation of ±3%, it have been determined that the technology is accurate when compared with clinical gold standards.

In studies carried out by North Carolina Wesleyan College and Campbell University, 40 participants completed a dynamic protocol that included 15.5 minutes combining sitting, standing, walking and running on the treadmill using the biometric technology inside Kuai. The results showed a significant positive correlation compared to twelve lead ECG, 95 percent of data points (74,440 total data points) were within the 95 percent confidence interval and a low standard deviation of ±4.43 percent with respect to ECG.

HOW DO THE SENSORS WORK?

The optical infrared (IR) emitter shines infrared light on the region of the ear between the anti-tragus and concha. The vast majority of the light travels through the skin and never reaches the detector. Some light is absorbed by the skin and never reach the detector. Some light is reflected directly off the surface of the skin causing signal noise. A tiny amount of light will enter the tissue, be modulated by the blood flow, and scatter back out to the optical detector. This is the heart rate signal our sensors cleverly use to give you super accurate data that is clinically validated by Duke University.

SENSORS IN THE EAR?

Yes! The ear region is an ideal location for measuring vital parameters. The carotid artery system runs perpendicularly along the ear canal region and a capillary system runs across the antitragus and earlobe, providing access to blood flow and heart rate through PPG. Because a user’s ear is generally well protected and does not move excessively during running or exercise, it is a stable platform for physiological measurements.

WHAT IS THE PHOTOPLETHYSMOGRAPHY METHOD?

Kuai uses a photoplethysmography (PPG) method, a non-invasive optical technique used in medical devices for measuring blood oxygen saturation through the detection of blood volume changes. Using the PPG method, light is shined on the surface of a person’s skin and an optical detector resting on top of the skin measures changes in scattered light from the skin and blood. These changes in scattered light create a waveform with each heartbeat.

The PPG waveform is a pulsatile (‘AC’) physiological waveform attributed to changes in blood volume with each heartbeat. This waveform is superimposed on a slowly varying (‘DC’) baseline that changes with respiration, nervous system activity and thermoregulation. Applying PPG, Kuai uses a sensor technology inside the earbud that directly measures changes in scattered light from the ear and uses algorithms to translate this scattered light signal into highly accurate estimates of heart rate.

Using the PPG method, light is shined on the surface of a person’s skin and an optical detector resting on top of the skin measures changes in scattered light from the skin and blood. These changes in scattered light create a waveform with each heartbeat.
The PPG waveform is a pulsatile (‘AC’) physiological waveform attributed to changes in blood volume with each heartbeat. This waveform is superimposed on a slowly varying (‘DC’) baseline that changes with respiration, nervous system activity and thermoregulation. Applying PPG, Kuai uses a sensor technology inside the earbud that directly measures changes in scattered light from the ear and uses algorithms to translate this scattered light signal into highly accurate estimates of heart rate.

story:
Guess what just started shipping out to all of you? That’s right; iBaby Air monitors are on the way to your doorsteps! We hope this is a great beginning to your relationship with iBaby. Thank you again for believing in our vision and backing our campaign.


Recent Awards:

ATTENTION FUTURE BACKERS:

Thank you for your support! Please make sure to read the updates frequently. We decided to change the name of the product for light wood and dark wood models to 'AirSense'. Rest assure, there is no change to the product features. The product is still designed and manufactured by iBaby. Below, you can see how the future orders will look. For any questions, feel free to contact us at elnaz.sarraf (at) ibabylabs (dot) com

What Is iBaby Air / AirSense?

iBaby Air / AirSense is an indoor smart Wi-Fi air quality monitor and ion purifier that detects volatile organic compounds (VOCs) such as carbon monoxide, alcohol, and eight other elements. It purifies the air with negative ions, tracks your air quality and allows you to create charts and see changes over time. Best of all, there's no cleaning, maintenance, or replaceable parts (like filters)!

Why Did We Create iBaby Air / AirSense?

Traveling the world, the iBaby team could not help but notice the air pollution that people have to live with. The unfortunate state of air quality led us to research air pollution in big cities.

We learned that in the US, air pollution is responsible for increased number of visits to ER, hospitalization with respiratory illnesses, and even tens of thousands of deaths every year, especially in children.


iBaby Air / AirSense Was Created To Make A Difference

With no comprehensive indoor air monitors on the market, our team decided to take the lead on the project. We believe that creating awareness about the air you breathe and knowing how it may be affecting you, will help people make informed decisions about their lifestyle. 

Let us help you have fresh and clean air indoors with iBaby Air / AirSense monitor.


iBaby Air / AirSense Has Two Beautiful Wood Patterns For Your Interior

We do not believe in ‘one size fits all’ solutions. That’s why we are offering iBaby Air / AirSense in three colors: pure white, light wood, and dark wood. We found that adding the wood pattern to the product gives it a warm, homey feel that people enjoy. 

We love light wood pattern for minimalist interiors with lots of sunlight, and the dark wood pattern for ornate interiors or offices. 

The World's Smallest Air Purifier Up Close

iBaby Air / AirSense is only 6 inches tall, but don’t be fooled by its compact appearance! The monitor is packed with useful features and is extremely easy to use. Executed in clean and elegant design, iBaby Air / AirSense will be a timeless addition to any interior. 


iBaby Air / AirSense is Not Just A Monitor, It Is The Smallest Ion Purifier On The Market

One of the features that sets iBaby Air / AirSense apart from other monitors is the fact that it has an ion purifier. But it's not just an ion purifier, it's the smallest one on the market. It is small and light enough to accompany you on trips, and is compatible with different electricity currents.  


Select From Millions of Colors Through The App

Danger Around You That You Might Not See

People may not realize that many common household items can cause severe health damage with prolonged exposure. Children are especially vulnerable to VOCs due to their physiology and other factors. As a result, children are not able to process the chemicals as effectively as adults are. Using iBaby Air / AirSense can help their sensitive systems to deal with the indoor pollution better. 


What Does iBaby Air / AirSense Track?

There are several common pollutants that are found all over the US. Most of them are invisible and odorless.

iBaby Air / AirSense will keep you informed about the air quality indoors. The app will send you the following alerts: 

Superb when the air is great, 

Poor when the air quality worsens, 

Oops! when the air quality is low,

Alert when you need to take immediate measures towards your air quality.



iBaby Air / AirSense Offers A Ton Of Useful Features

Ion Purifier Test Results In Our Lab

In our lab experiments, negative ions released by iBaby Air / AirSense removed cigarette smoke from the air within 15 seconds. For an average size room (approx. 300 sq ft), it will take about an hour to purify the air. iBaby Air / AirSense can turn the purifier on automatically, and will show you the progress of the purification. In this video, you can see cigarette smoke completely disappear when the purifier starts working.



Benefits of iBaby Air / AirSense Are Evident And Tangible

iBaby Air / AirSense allows its users to stay on top of their environment at home. iBaby Air / AirSense has the potential to lower health risk for individuals and, as a result, lower healthcare associated bills and expenses.

Not only the app gives you facts and numbers, but it also interprets the information you get. You will receive helpful suggestions on improving your lifestyle and living a healthier life.


Equipped with a free app, iBaby Air / AirSense sends alerts and daily room reports to the user’s mobile device. Monitor through your smartphone or Apple Watch to be always aware of the changes in the environment where your iBaby Air / AirSense is located.

 

The monitor features RGB lights that change colors based on air quality, or act as a smart light. Users have complete control over the light colors, can compare historic data, share the data with each other, prioritize which alerts to get first, and always be aware of the environment around them.


Who iBaby Air / AirSense Is Made For

iBaby Air / AirSense will be useful for everyone, but especially for those with small children, pets or elderly, people with chronic respiratory diseases or allergies, and those with pre-existing heart or lung disease, as they are more susceptible to developing health issues because of air pollution.


Ease Of Use

iBaby Air / AirSense was created with the end user in mind, which resulted in an unprecedented ease of use of the monitor. The gadget supports both iOS and Android platforms, making it valuable to a wider audience.

iBaby Air / AirSense is Wi-Fi based and automatically picks up the owner’s mobile device network connection, which means no need for typing your network's (probably long!) password. 

The iBaby Care app supports unlimited number of users and offers user-friendly interface with all features accessible at a tap of your finger. You will also be able to add other iBaby devices, such as iBaby baby monitors.

We bet you won't need to read a tutorial to navigate the app - it's that intuitive.


iBaby Air / AirSense And Comparable Products

Compared  to similar products on the market, iBaby Air / AirSense stands out with its size and functionality. The monitor is the smallest ion purifier available, and offers two-way audio, as compared to other air quality monitors. 



Our Awesome Engineering Team

Our engineering team has over 20 years experience in R&D, engineering, manufacturing, and product development. The team has worked on several large-scale projects for global companies, as well as for iBaby Labs.



A Little About iBaby

iBaby is the leading player in video baby monitoring. For over 5 years we have been changing parents’ lives with smart baby monitors sold online and in stores with Apple, Amazon, Nordstrom, Target, Babies R Us and other major retailers. iBaby has received worldwide recognition by largest media outlets, and received highest awards in the industry.

The team has worked on several generations of iBaby video monitors, and iFamCare Helmet home monitor that was successfully launched on Indiegogo in 2015. The team’s current designs are championing the way into Connected Home industry. Backed by solid knowledge and experience in monitoring business, we are aiming to become one of the fastest growing family care brands in the world.


Frequently Asked Questions

What colors is iBaby Air / AirSense available in?

iBaby Air / AirSense comes in three colors: white, light wood and dark wood. 

Is iBaby Air / AirSense battery-operated?

iBaby Air / AirSense does not have a battery. It comes with power adaptor that has Type A (American) electrical outlet plug. Plug adapter for other countries is not included. 

Can I only use iBaby Air / AirSense in the US?

While iBaby Air / AirSense comes with the American plug, you can use it anywhere in the world. It runs on both 110V and 220V electricity. Note that plug adapter is not included.

Can iBaby Air / AirSense be used outdoors?

iBaby Air / AirSense is not waterproof, and is only recommended for indoor use.

What happens to the money you raise on Indiegogo?

The money will be used to assist with manufacturing and component costs. We also plan to add more features to the app as we raise money.

Can I get a refund or return iBaby Air / AirSense?

You can get a full refund within 30 days after purchase. Note that return shipping costs, including international shipping, are to be paid by the customer. There is no restocking fee. Importation fee needs to be paid by the customer in their country of origin.


When will iBaby Air / AirSense ship?

We are scheduled to start shipping first batches of iBaby Air / AirSense starting August 2016.

Where does iBaby Air / AirSense ship?

We are shipping all over the world.


What can iBaby Air / AirSense do?

iBaby Air / AirSense is a Wi-Fi based air quality monitor and ion purifier. It features temperature and humidity sensors, ion air purifier, and ability to detect volatile organic compounds. Equipped with a free iOS/Android app, the monitor tracks the environment and sends alerts and daily room reports to the user’s mobile device. The gadget also features audio speakers, and tips and reminders system.

How is iBaby Air / AirSense controlled?

iBaby Air / AirSense requires use of the companion app, iBaby Care. The app is free and is available for both iOS devices (phones, tablets) and Android phones.

What can iBaby Care app do?

iBaby Care app is a companion app for a variety of iBaby products, and provides full control of the device. For instance, you can change the ambient light, use two-way audio system, track air quality, chart data, and receive reports.

Are there any requirements for router for iBaby Air / AirSense? Does it work with hotspots?

iBaby Air / AirSense works on 2.4 GHz. It will give you the best performance when located within 20-30 feet from the router. iBaby Air / AirSense will also work with a hotspot.

Is there any monthly cost associated with iBaby Air / AirSense usage, such as cloud storage cost?

There will be no cloud or other service fees at this point.


For more questions, please contact us via the contact link on this campaign or email elnaz.sarraf (at) ibabylabs (.com)

story:
Campaign cancelled

Lots of web developers these days prefer stylesheet preprocessors like LESS or SCSS over plain CSS . The preprocessor code in most cases is much cleaner, maintainable and re-usable. However, all of those cool preprocessor features come with their own set of problems. I’m pretty sure most of you often stumble upon some of them:

  • How would this nested selector look in CSS? Is that the selector I need?
  • What’s the value of this variable? And the result of that expression?
  • What does this mixin output?
  • Do I already have a variable for this value, or should I create one?

In other words, web developers have to use their brains as preprocessors. So I wrote LiveStyle Analyzer to solve this problem.

What is LiveStyle Analyzer?

LiveStyle Analyzer is a tool for extracting runtime data from LESS and SCSS stylesheets. It takes a source code, compiles it into CSS and analyses internal data generated during compilation. At the heart of this tool is LiveStyle Engine: a custom implementation of LESS and SCSS preprocessors written in pure JavaScript. Unlike official implementations, this preprocessor was designed specifically for development. It can:

  • preserve exact mappings of source selectors and properties with generated counterparts, much more accurate than using source maps;
  • recover from errors;
  • recompile only sections of a stylesheet, as well;
  • provide access to internal variables and mixins scope for every section and property.

See it in action

For demonstration purposes, I’ve implemented LiveStyle Analyzer as Atom plugin. You can install it, open any LESS or SCSS stylesheet and check for yourself how LiveStyle may improve your workflow.

Computed value

Displays computed result of property value expressions, if possible. Also displays color previews even for static values.

Resolved selector

Displays resolved CSS selector for nested sections.

Variables and mixin completions

Displays a list of mixins and variables with computed values. LiveStyle tries to be smart here: it displays variables and their values available exactly for current scope, not all variables from current file.

Mixin output

Displays output of selected mixin. Output is updated in real-time when you edit mixin call arguments.

Suggested variables

Finds variables for given static property value with the same or similar (for colors) computed values. Extremely useful for picking colors in image editor and finding declared variable for it.

Quick outline

Displays stylesheet tree and its compiled CSS counterpart. Selecting compiled CSS node will automatically point you to its preprocessor origin.

What do I need funding for?

All of the examples above work extremely well but with one caveat: it analyses only the currently open file, all of the dependencies and global files are ignored. Which makes it pretty useless even for small projects where variables and mixins must be extracted from external stylesheets.

My goal is to raise $15,000 to develop a dependency graph builder so it will be possible to scan all project stylesheets, parse them and make all of the declared variables and mixins available across files. It would take approximately 2—3 months of my spare time to implement it and then some time for support and bugfixes.

After reaching initial goal, every next $10,000 will be spent on adding new editor support. Note that since Analyzer provides custom context UI hints, it will be hard to implement the same level of support across all editors. For example, Brackets, VS Code, CodeMirror, Ace are good candidates since they are web-based and can be easily customized. IDEs like Eclipse and WebStorm are good too but will require much more time and effort to implement. But highly popular Sublime Text isn’t because it does not allow UI customization (although there are some possible solutions).

If you’re going to sponsor editor plugin development (e.g. donate $10,000) please contact me first about implementation details.

LiveStyle Analyzer and editor plugins will be open-sourced under MIT license. Note that Analyzer contains LiveStyle Engine which is not open-source but still available under MIT license.

Who I am

My name is Sergey Chikuyonok, I’m a front-end developer. And I love to build tools for developers like me. You may know me as the developer of Emmet — the essential toolkit for web developers, used by millions of web developers worldwide. I truly believe that the best tools for web developers can be created by web developers only. So I spend most of my time building high-quality tools like Emmet, Re:view and LiveStyle.

story:
My spouse and I have recently become the temporary guardians of a very small child. S/he is a sweet, lovely little thing. I don't want to reveal any details to protect the privacy of the child as well as that of his/her parents, but it will suffice to say s/he's in a crappy situation, and we are happy to care for him/her as long as necessary.

The thing is, we're poor. We just are, and we do not have an adequate car seat for him/her. I'm starting this campaign in hopes of raising enough money to buy one. I looked at the local super store today, and it looks like what we need ranges from $45 to $80 dollars.

We are hoping to raise $100 to $200. ****Please note, inidiegogo requires a minimum goal of $500!**** We are not asking for so much as that! With $100 to $200, we could buy him a car seat and perhaps a little bed from craigslist. (Child is sleeping in a borrowed pack n play for now.)

Complicating the situation further is the fact that this child might leave us at any time. S/he might leave in 12 hours, or we could have him for months. We don't know. Should s/he leave before the car seat (and whatever) is purchased, money raised will be donated to Reece's Rainbow, which benefits children with special needs. Should we raise more money than we are hoping for, excess will go toward groceries and other kid related necessities (clothes, maybe a small set of rubbermaid storage drawers for his clothes, etc.), directly benefiting the child.

Anything would help. $5 would help. We just need to be able to transport him safely.

Should s/he leave before the car seat (and whatever) is purchased, money raised will be donated to Reece's Rainbow, which benefits children with special needs. Should we raise more money than we are hoping for, excess will go toward groceries and other kid related necessities (clothes, maybe a small set of rubbermaid storage drawers for his clothes, etc.), directly benefiting the child.Anything would help. $5 would help. We just need to be able to transport him safely.

story:
Our Story

Hello!  We are Johanna and Michael Hernandez and that is a picture of our babies, our embryos.  We got married in May, 2011 and we've been trying to have a baby since June, 2012.  We always knew we'd want kids right away, but we wanted to buy a home and get settled into a budget before we tried, so we decided to wait a year.  We were so excited to start trying, and the women in my family have always gotten pregnant quickly, so we were sure we'd have no problems having a baby right away.  We tried everything we could on our own, months of medicine, counting days, checking for ovulation, tests and doctor’s appointments, until we were finally referred to a specialist, an endocrinologist.  We even tried special diets, and products rumored to help infertility.  But nothing worked.  They told us, with our combined issues, we wouldn't likely be able to have a baby on our own, nearly impossible; they said we would need a lot of help.  They were right.

Or initial test results weren't terrible, and the endocrinologists were optimistic.  They thought we should start with an Intrauterine Insemination (IUI).  They were confident that with the quality of our tests an IUI could be successful.  IUI’s increase the odds of pregnancy from 1%-3%, with normal conception, to 5%-10%.  They aren't terribly difficult procedures, mostly just time and medicine, money and waiting.  The waiting is the hardest part emotionally, but the money is hardest part logistically. Our insurance doesn't cover infertility, so I got a second job and we set up a payment plan with the clinic.  Three IUI's later, we still weren't pregnant.  Each subsequent set of test results got worse.  Michael’s sperm count, motility and morphology went down with each IUI; we found cysts on my ovaries, I was developing polyps from the treatments, and I had endometriosis.  Our chances of conceiving with an IUI went down, significantly.  Each month got more and more difficult.  The doctors told me I needed to relax and minimize my stress.  But how do you do that?  At the doctor’s recommendation we scheduled an In Vitro Fertilization (IVF).  IVF is much more invasive than IUI’s and to prepare my body I needed shots every day.  One shot in my stomach every morning and one shot in my butt every night, for weeks to months depending on the success of the IVF.  The shots were painful to the point of limiting my ability to walk, sit and stand without pain, but it would all be worth it, if we got pregnant.

Just days before the IVF transfer, I was laid off from my job.  IVF costs $10,000.  After having gone through everything we had to get there, we just couldn’t cancel.  It was a risk that was well worth taking and we got pregnant!  Nothing could have made us happier!  That picture of our embryos was now the first picture of our babies.  For the best month of our lives we were parents and it seemed likely we would be blessed with twins!  Then, at six weeks, we lost the babies.  We were devastated, it's impossible to express such utterly complete heartbreak.  They don't know what went wrong, just that they were gone.  They were sorry, but sometimes this happens.  And just like that, we weren't going to be parents anymore.  After the miscarriage, the doctor suggested surgery for the endometriosis; he said it might decrease the chance of another miscarriage.  The surgery was successful, but showed only mild endometriosis.  Given the mildness of the endometriosis, the doctor wasn’t convinced it played a large role in the miscarriage.  Once I had healed, the doctor said we should try a Frozen Embryo Transfer (FET).  With this procedure, they use the “extra” embryos from the IVF.  They told us we had to pay off the IVF before they would continue with FET, so we drained my retirement funds and paid them off and tried for FET.  Sadly, we did not get pregnant.  After that, we had exhausted all of our savings and we were out of money, $13,000 later. 

We have enough “extra” embryos for two more FETs, just waiting for us.  But we can't do anything without money.  I've gotten a good job since then, and we want so badly to try again, but we just don't have the funds. 

It is impossible to express what your help would mean to Michael and me.  How can we possibly convey the gratitude of giving us a chance to have a baby?  The gift of life is without equal in this world.  There are no words, no actions, no amount of money that could ever repay your support and generosity.  The only thing we could do is dedicate ourselves to being the best parents we can be, to having the most loved child anyone ever had.  That we can guarantee.

What We Need & What You Get

We're trying to raise $5,000 to help pay for the medicine and costs of two FET procedures.  Each FET costs between $1,500 and $2,000, combined with the medicine needed and the costs of monitoring; if we reach our goal we'll be able to cover much of our costs.  If we get pregnant on our first FET, any additional money will be used for pregnancy and labor and delivery costs.  All of the money we raise will go onto a medical card dedicated to paying for infertility, monitoring and pregnancy costs. 

All we have to offer you for your help is our sincere gratitude, our fervent appreciation and our promise to be amazing and loving parents.  We promise to keep you updated on our progress and share pictures of our beautiful and amazing children we know, thanks to you all, we'll have someday!

Every dollar makes a difference, and every dollar will be used to help cover infertility costs.  Whether we reach our goal now or not, we will keep saving until we have enough and we will keep trying until we have a baby.  Nothing is more important to us, and we will continue to do everything within our power to have a baby.

The Impact

Every day we see and hear about people having kids 'by accident'.  How lucky they are to have that ability, when people like my husband and I, who desperately want to have a family, have to struggle.  We have worked to have a life we are proud to bring a child into, and we have so much love to give to them, if only we had the opportunity. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know times are tough for everyone.  While every dollar counts, we also need help spreading the word about our campaign.  The more people we reach, the better chance we have of attaining our goals.  If you can share this with everyone you know, you'd be helping us immensely!  Sharing this link on any and every social media outlet you have access to would be amazing. 

Thank you all, for your time and support; you'll never know how much it means to us!

story:
“The key to growth is the introduction of higher dimensions of consciousness into our awareness” – Lao Tzu

The AWEARS device provides vital Muscle, Heart and Oxygen data 


WHO

We believe that perfect health can be achieved through our advanced biotechnology. The AWEARS system provides real time muscle biofeedback during exercise and or activitites of daily living. Combined with cloud based data retrieve, AWEARS is the first body building system to provide high-tech muscle growth. 

ID-COR’s team consists of specialists in the fields of Medicine, Physical therapy, Personal training, Hardware/Software engineering and Business. Our vision is to push the boundaries of wellness using science and technology. We  have spent three years on research and development. Now with your help, we are ready to launch our dream.


Adjustable straps allow non-intrusive feel.


HOW

With support from you, we will grow awareness for proper funding towards production. Our goal of $25,000 helps put the wheels in motion. Anything over that shall help this product get to the public quicker!

                 STRAP                         MOVE                                      VIEW                         

Attach the AWEARS device across chest.  Strap sensors to any chosen muscle groups. Then simply move, monitor and record on any screen in real-time.


USER INTERFACE


Our first production run of the  AWEARS device is targeted towards medical and fitness professionals. Its software interface has multiple user profiles, adjustable sensor gains and more comparable data. Thus, providing comparisons in performance between actual and  projected. Muscle strap accessories will be produced on the first run. The professional grade device will include client demographics to support medical reporting.


Monitors muscular contractions up to 100 x per second


 WHAT

What makes us different from any other fitness band, watch or biotech clothing? Our non restrictive straps move easily around the body regardless of size and shape. The information gathered is not global, it is from your actual muscle contractions. No more broad based equations of steps equaling calories. From your muscular contractions our algorithms compose fact based data on fatigue, endurance  and ability.


Monitor corresponding muscle groups for perfect contraction and balance.


 The AWEARS simultaneously monitors your muscle activity in relation to your heart intensity and your oxygen consumption. The device displays muscle contractions in real time, providing biofeedback for ultimate performance,.Increasing strength and endurance to a level not otherwise achievable. Session data is saved and compared to past performances, to guide you in becoming your very best!

Monitor intensity and oxygen readings to control efforts for endurance.


The products we plan to produce in the coming years will continue to bring awareness of mind, body and ability, helping all to realize their true potential in fitness and life. Are you a person who wants better health care, new tools for research, and who wants real time data from the effort and energy usage?


Past, current and future fitness projections at you finger tips.


Then we are your company.

 Donate, Post and Refer a friend. With enough support we can have the future technology today. We believe this device will help many to better understand their bodies in fitness. 

Thank you for your support.


"Physical fitness is not only one of the most important keys to a healthy body, it is the basis of dynamic and creative intellectual activity" -John F. Kennedy


Our humble beginnings


Indiegogo has some share tools:

check us out at:

AWEARS.com 

contact me:

Thomas@intelidigitalcorp.com

story:
My name is Ryan Hebert. I have been working hard practicsing lacrosse every day in hopes of making the Nova Scotia Provincial team.    When I got the call I was very excited. 

The amount of money that our team needs to raise for  gear, training and travel is a great deal.  If you can help us represent Nova Scotia at any amount, I would be very grateful.  I pledge to run one minute for every dollar that I am supported. This way it will help our team with the money needed and improving my fitness at the same time!  

Any amount, even a couple of dollars will help!

Thanks so much for your support and I will update my running times and dates as the pledges come in.

story:
About the Tennessee Justice Center

“I couldn’t have done it without TJC. Their help gave me the time we needed to get my daughter stable so she could come home.” -TJC client

The Tennessee Justice Center (TJC) is a small, non-profit law firm in Nashville, Tennessee. We help low-income families gain access to health care. In 2013, we served over 400 individual clients and families. We stood alongside mothers as they fought to get their children necessary medicines. We helped daughters and sons as they fought for nursing care for their parents. We helped individuals appeal when they couldn't get the health care they needed, and we helped people keep their care once it was approved.  

We represent the 1.2 million individuals in Tennessee who receive their health care through the state's TennCare program. We help get uninsured Tennesseans covered. We help make the health care system fair, just, and accessible. We help save lives.

We help Tennessee families. You can too. Donate today. 

To learn more about TJC, visit our website and our Facebook page.

About Mothers of the Year

Every year, we honor moms, dads, grandparents, and other caretakers who have fought courageously to ensure that their children have the health care they need. These are often caretakers of children with special needs, who have struggled for many years to navigate the complex and bureaucratic health care system. These caretakers are not only our clients, they are our inspiration. Their bravery and determination motivate us each and every day.

This year, one of our Mothers of the Year is Evelyn Manley. Evelyn has a 4-year old son, Christian, who has a smile that lights up a room. Christian has Down Syndrome, and at 2 years old, was also diagnosed with autism. But thanks to the therapy his doctor ordered, when he was 3 years old, he hugged and kissed his mom for the first time.

In late 2013, TennCare told Evelyn that Christian's therapy would no longer be covered. Determined to make sure that Christian could hold on to his hard won gains and continue to develop emotionally, Evelyn called TJC to ask for help. We recruited a pro bono attorney who, with TJC's training and assistance, appealed and won Christian's case. Because of the devotion of a loving mom who wouldn't take "no" for an answer and the creativity and dedication of TJC staff and a pro bono attorney, Christian continues to receive the care he needs.

"TJC helped us during a really hard time. They were great advocates for my son, and for our family." -Evelyn Manley

To read more about past Mothers of the Year and our other 2014 Mothers of the Year, visit our website.

This year, you can honor your mom by donating to our Mothers of the Year campaign. With any donation amount, upon request, we will send a card to your mom, telling her that you donated to TJC in her honor.

Why We Need Your Help

TJC is a non-profit law firm that provides services to families who wouldn't otherwise have access to an attorney. To do this work, we rely on donations from people just like you. With your help, we can continue to help moms like Evelyn keep their children safe and healthy. With your help, we can continue to represent Tennesseans across the state and ensure they are getting the care that they need. With your help, we can continue to serve your children, your families, and your neighbors.

What Else Can You Do?

TJC needs donations, but we also need some love! The more you can spread our message about who we are, the more folks will know to reach out to us for help. To help TJC reach more families, you can:

  • Share this campaign with your friends and family!
  • Like us on Facebook, follow us on Twitter, link to us on LinkedIn, and follow us on Instagram.
  • Share our statuses and retweet our Tweets!
  • Do you live in Nashville? Email Katie at kalexander@tnjustice.org to learn about our volunteer and internship opportunities.
  • Do you know a Tennessee family that needs help? Tell them to call us at 615-255-0331.

story:
Hi :) My names Stacey, I'm 31 and a single mum to 4 amazing children, I've suffered with body confidence issues since...well...puberty


What We Need & What You Get

I need funding for a breast Augmentation... 

No I don't want to be a glamour model, an actress, I don't want to be a wag, or any of the other stereo types that go along with breast enlargement, I just want to be a female

 I say augmentation because to be frank theres nothing to enlarge. I spoke to a company and when they asked about size I am I had to

erm... I don't know crop top?


I hand on heart can't really offer you anything, apart from am immense gratitude that your even taking the time out to read and consider funding in the first place, I'm not going to be offering pictures or anything that would compromise who I am. That's not me at all


The Impact

Hand on heart it would change my life, I could start living, it would make it bareable to sit in on an interview with women, instead of sitting there feeling like I'm acting the part, I'd be able to have girl friends and friendship and in the same breath, I could consider a fulfilling relationship, not one where I hide away, I honestly feel like I'm missing missing a part, like a man without his manhood.

 I'm kind and big hearted, the first place family turn when they're upset of have a problem, Up until writing this I've never put myself first in anything, 

I'm an awesome mum don't always get it right like any parent but I love my children with every breath I take. Which is part on the reason I'm on here, I don't want them to miss out on anything for my sake, and funds aren't fantastic at the best of times, but I feel without this I'll never go out and play a normal part in the world and I want to I'm itching to go out there and smash it for them.

Surgery isn't my first option either, I'd really rather not but I've tried every cream, supplement, and treatment going and nothings made a difference so this really is a last resort.


I'm open honest and happy to discuss this with anyone that wants to chat, sure I'm going to get some stick somewhere along the way but please before you judge come and say hi :)


Also, I know there's people out there that need your help more, if you've read more than one profile and someone else needs it more please donate it their way


Other Ways You Can Help

Ok so this is where I should say share share share but that's hard for me, I'm not even sure that after the first donation I'll be able to accept it, its not who I am I don't like accepting help but if it's going to make this dream real, then feel free
story_txt:
Hi :) My names Stacey, I'm 31 and a single mum to 4 amazing children, I've suffered with body confidence issues since...well...puberty

What We Need & What You Get
 I need funding for a breast Augmentation... 
No I don't want to be a glamour model, an actress, I don't want to be a wag, or any of the other stereo types that go along with breast enlargement, I just want to be a female
 I say augmentation because to be frank theres nothing to enlarge. I spoke to a company and when they asked about size I am I had to
erm... I don't know crop top?

I hand on heart can't really offer you anything, apart from am immense gratitude that your even taking the time out to read and consider funding in the first place, I'm not going to be offering pictures or anything that would compromise who I am. That's not me at all
    
The Impact Hand on heart it would change my life, I could start living, it would make it bareable to sit in on an interview with women, instead of sitting there feeling like I'm acting the part, I'd be able to have girl friends and friendship and in the same breath, I could consider a fulfilling relationship, not one where I hide away, I honestly feel like I'm missing missing a part, like a man without his manhood.
 I'm kind and big hearted, the first place family turn when they're upset of have a problem, Up until writing this I've never put myself first in anything, 
I'm an awesome mum don't always get it right like any parent but I love my children with every breath I take. Which is part on the reason I'm on here, I don't want them to miss out on anything for my sake, and funds aren't fantastic at the best of times, but I feel without this I'll never go out and play a normal part in the world and I want to I'm itching to go out there and smash it for them.
Surgery isn't my first option either, I'd really rather not but I've tried every cream, supplement, and treatment going and nothings made a difference so this really is a last resort.

I'm open honest and happy to discuss this with anyone that wants to chat, sure I'm going to get some stick somewhere along the way but please before you judge come and say hi :)

Also, I know there's people out there that need your help more, if you've read more than one profile and someone else needs it more please donate it their way
    
    Other Ways You Can Help Ok so this is where I should say share share share but that's hard for me, I'm not even sure that after the first donation I'll be able to accept it, its not who I am I don't like accepting help but if it's going to make this dream real, then feel free

story:
Short Summary

The enthusiasm of the little Waldemar of four years old, who is about to begin his cycle in the kindergarten, was interrupted on January 17, when a grinder hurt his abdomen and pierced his small intestine, leaving him very injured. Now it is urgent to make a intestine transplant on him.

Dinora Conception Peña, mother of the child, said that in a blink of an eye her child got lacerated with the machine that is used to cut metal, and that her husband uses as a tool for structures of workshop metal at home.

The child is at the Benjamin Bloom hospital in general surgery, and he’s being fed through a catheter.

According to the explanations that doctors have given to his parents, they have to perform small bowel transplantation; however such interventions are not carried out in El Salvador, so it is necessary to take Waldemar abroad.

According to what the mother explained, Puerta de Hierro Hospital, in Jalisco Mexico, asked for $200,000 in order to perform the small intestine transplant.

Contacts have been made with other countries, and a requirement to accept the surgery is that the child and his family are going to be living for three years in the country where the transplant is going to be performed.

In June, there was a collect of almost $50,000 and more institutions have joined the cause, but help is coming very slow.

On April 16, Bloom Hospital medical staff reported an infection in one of the layers of the child’s heart. This happened as a result of having for long time the central catheter - a tube that can be inserted into a body cavity -, through which he was fed. Therefore, some nutrients are injected or administered orally.

In addition, parents make the effort to provide solid food, but due to the lack of bowel, these are removed instantly or are vomited by the kid.

In his innocence, little Waldemar repeatedly asks her mother when he will be able to go home so he will assist school again.

"When the accident happened (Thursday), that day we were going to buy things that are missing for his kindergarten classes because he was going to start on Monday, anyway he's still excited to go" said the mother.

The hope of this family has been placed, first to God, and then in those good-hearted people who want to help financially in order to perform the operation abroad.

The desperation of these parents from San Vicente, has led them to knock on the doors of several entities, but so far they’ve not received any response.

López Peña's family hopes to reunite the money as soon as possible, in order to pay the intestinal transplantation and save the life of his son.

 Those who wish to help financially can make donations to bank accounts in the name of: Dinora Conception Peña 003500380401; and 003500380627, Waldemar Oscar Lopez, both of Banco Agricola.

 

The Impact

Waldemar save life and help the family to perform the surgery and purchase of drugs currently Waldemar needs.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Bumblebee Boxing is a 501c3 organization dedicated to giving back to the youth of our community.  We are asking your help to send the team to the 38th annual Gene Lewis Invitational Boxing Tournament in Arizona on November 7th, 8th and 9th, 2013.

Your support will go towards food and lodging for the event, as well as the gas fare to drive there from Seattle.

Every little thing helps!
