story:
I've scheduled my surgery for April 23rd, 2014 and I need your help to pay for it.

I can't even begin to explain what this would mean to me or to my partner. For me, this would be the physical endpoint of a difficult and complicated journey. Logistically, I'd be able to change all of my government documentation to F which would allow me to not be outed to employers and physicians. But I would also be able to look how I want to look and have the kind of sex I want to have. I just want to know what it's like to love my body for one day and I'll be happy. Please help me get to that day.

What can you do?

If you're in a position to donate, please donate. 

I've tried to assemble a variety of interesting perks and stretch goals (see below) to encourage your generosity. You will receive my undying gratitude and you will be a part of changing someone's life in an incredibly meaningful way.

This is the one and only time in my life that I will ever ask for money. If you want to support me or say thanks for something I've done, this is your chance.

I recognize that not everyone is in a position to donate or that you might prefer to donate to folks in more desperate positions. I understand and respect that choice. I don't have money to give away, either, and I know that others need funds more than I do.

If you make the choice to support me, please share this fundraiser far and wide. Share it on Twitter, Facebook, Tumblr, even Google+. E-mail your friends. If each one of my Twitter followers raised $4 in one day of donations, I'd have enough money for the surgery TOMORROW. The further this spreads, the faster it gets funded.

What am I giving back? A GAME and more!

SUPER VAGINA TIME

In addition to several perks (at the side), this fundraising campaign has one major stretch goal. If it reaches $15,000 (an amount which will comfortably cover my procedure as well as associated travel and lodging costs -- see details below), I will commission game designer Cameron Kunzelman (Catachresis and Alpaca Run) to make 

a twitch-arcade vagina dilation game about vaginoplasty aftercare. 

If you enjoyed Super Hexagon, you'll like this game a lot. 

I will also commission my friend Brigid Choi to compose and record a riot grrrl soundtrack for this game. I'll also commission someone to help Cameron with the vagina art. THIS WILL BE AS AMAZING AS IT SOUNDS. It is tentatively titled: SUPER VAGINA TIME. The game will be released by January 15th, 2014.

A screenshot from Alpaca Run:

Possible Donation to the Sylvia Rivera Law Project

When the surgery is over and all the associated bills have been paid (including the wages of my game creators), 

I will donate any and all leftover money to the Sylvia Rivera Law Project.

SLRP is a legal aid organization that advocates for "low-income people of color who are transgender, intersex, or gender non-conforming." SLRP is a tremendous organization that helps people who are far less privileged than myself. 

Feel free to donate well beyond the stretch goal. If I reach the goal, I'll be publicizing the IndieGoGo as a way to raise money for SRLP, using the flashiness of our cool Super Vagina Time game to get the Internet interested in helping out low-income trans* folks.

Details and Disclosures

Transparency and honesty are the core principles of this fundraising campaign. I attend Emory University and I'm covered under our student health insurance plan. Thanks to remarkable transgender advocacy on campus, my health insurance plan covers both psychological counselling and hormone replacement therapy. The plan also covers a percentage of transgender surgeries depending on whether the surgeon is in network or out of network. 

Timing

My procedure is on April 23rd, 2014. After the first of the year, my surgeon will begin pre-authorizing the procedure with my insurance provider and it would be comforting to have the money on hand at that point. I'm raising the money early so that I can relax, be prepared and so that I can make arrangements that fall within my budget. More importantly, if I fail to raise the money this fall, I'll need extra time to take out loans and credit cards to cover all of my costs.

Cost of the Procedure

In the case of my surgeon, the plan should cover 80% of a procedure quoted to me at $20,000: $4,000. However, the only student to go through sex reassignment surgery under this health insurance plan was then charged another $4,000 in hospital and other fees: $8,000. That's what I've set as the main goal.

Extra Costs

This is nowhere near the total cost of this endeavor. There may be other medical costs associated with the procedure: hair removal on the genitals, precautionary tests or procedures for my heart condition, what-have-you. I will also have to travel to the location of the surgery (thousands of miles away) and I will have to find lodging for my convalescence. I won't be able to work for about a month. Someone needs to take care of me and help me dilate my vagina (the subject of Super Vagina Time). 

I would also like to be able to fly my partner out for the procedure and convalescence. She's a student to works part-time to pay for her tuition. She wouldn't be able to afford covering travel expenses on this income while being away from work. Having her by my side would mean the world to me. She'd be able to hold my hand before I went under and she'd be smiling at me when I woke up.

All this is to say that if the proceeds of this campaign exceed $8,000, the money will be put to good use and will not be used for any raucous parties. Overall, this whole trip will cost somewhere in the ballpark of $12,000-$14,000.

What Happens to Extra Money?

I've set the stretch goal for the game at $15,000 because I'm confident that will be enough to cover all of my costs and leave me with enough leftover to pay Cameron, Brigid and an artist.

When the surgery is over, and all the bills and game-makers are paid, I will donate any and all leftover money to the Sylvia Rivera Law Project.

Extra money will absolutely not be spent outside of the surgery trip or the game. I'm taking this campaign very seriously and, as mentioned, I'll be publicly posting documentation for all expenses.

Where Does the Money Go?

This campaign runs on a flexible funding model which means I will receive money even if I don't reach my goal. All money raised will be saved toward surgical expenses.

It will go into a separate savings account that I will not use for anything else. I will show this account balance to several trustworthy folks at regular intervals and they will verify that I'm not using it for buffalo wings and ice cream sandwiches. 

Receipts and documentation for everything the money is used for (with account numbers and personal info redacted, of course) will be posted publicly in updates to this campaign.

Acknowledging My Privilege

I want to be clear that I am incredibly fortunate to have a health insurance plan that covers a large portion of the cost of surgery. Other folks need care more than I do and I'd encourage you to seek out and contribute to other IndieGoGo campaigns as well. My addition of the potential SRLP donation is a way to try to use some of my visibility for other folks as well.

I also want to disclose that I come from an upper-class family that would typically swoop in to help me with life-saving medical expenses. The catch is that my parents are devout Mormons who have told me that transitioning was "the worst decision I can possibly make in my life." I'm on my own for this. And my grad student stipend checks are nowhere near large enough for costly medical procedures.

With those disclosures in mind, I'm asking for your help. If you like the work that I do, if you've enjoyed something I've made, this is a way for you to dramatically improve the quality of my life in return. You'll never forget that you were a part of this and I'll never quit thanking you.

I recognize that not everyone is in a position to donate or that you might prefer to donate to folks in more desperate positions. I understand and respect that choice. I don't have money to give away, either, and I know that others need funds more than I do.
If you make the choice to support me, please share this fundraiser far and wide. Share it on Twitter, Facebook, Tumblr, even Google+. E-mail your friends. If each one of my Twitter followers raised $4 in one day of donations, I'd have enough money for the surgery TOMORROW. The further this spreads, the faster it gets funded.

What am I giving back? A GAME and more!
SUPER VAGINA TIME
In addition to several perks (at the side), this fundraising campaign has one major stretch goal. If it reaches $15,000 (an amount which will comfortably cover my procedure as well as associated travel and lodging costs -- see details below), I will commission game designer Cameron Kunzelman (Catachresis and Alpaca Run) to make 
a twitch-arcade vagina dilation game about vaginoplasty aftercare. 
If you enjoyed Super Hexagon, you'll like this game a lot. 
I will also commission my friend Brigid Choi to compose and record a riot grrrl soundtrack for this game. I'll also commission someone to help Cameron with the vagina art. THIS WILL BE AS AMAZING AS IT SOUNDS. It is tentatively titled: SUPER VAGINA TIME. The game will be released by January 15th, 2014.
A screenshot from Alpaca Run:



Possible Donation to the Sylvia Rivera Law Project
When the surgery is over and all the associated bills have been paid (including the wages of my game creators), 
I will donate any and all leftover money to the Sylvia Rivera Law Project.
SLRP is a legal aid organization that advocates for "low-income people of color who are transgender, intersex, or gender non-conforming." SLRP is a tremendous organization that helps people who are far less privileged than myself. 
Feel free to donate well beyond the stretch goal. If I reach the goal, I'll be publicizing the IndieGoGo as a way to raise money for SRLP, using the flashiness of our cool Super Vagina Time game to get the Internet interested in helping out low-income trans* folks.
Details and Disclosures
Transparency and honesty are the core principles of this fundraising campaign. I attend Emory University and I'm covered under our student health insurance plan. Thanks to remarkable transgender advocacy on campus, my health insurance plan covers both psychological counselling and hormone replacement therapy. The plan also covers a percentage of transgender surgeries depending on whether the surgeon is in network or out of network. 
Timing
My procedure is on April 23rd, 2014. After the first of the year, my surgeon will begin pre-authorizing the procedure with my insurance provider and it would be comforting to have the money on hand at that point. I'm raising the money early so that I can relax, be prepared and so that I can make arrangements that fall within my budget. More importantly, if I fail to raise the money this fall, I'll need extra time to take out loans and credit cards to cover all of my costs.
Cost of the Procedure
In the case of my surgeon, the plan should cover 80% of a procedure quoted to me at $20,000: $4,000. However, the only student to go through sex reassignment surgery under this health insurance plan was then charged another $4,000 in hospital and other fees: $8,000. That's what I've set as the main goal.
Extra Costs
This is nowhere near the total cost of this endeavor. There may be other medical costs associated with the procedure: hair removal on the genitals, precautionary tests or procedures for my heart condition, what-have-you. I will also have to travel to the location of the surgery (thousands of miles away) and I will have to find lodging for my convalescence. I won't be able to work for about a month. Someone needs to take care of me and help me dilate my vagina (the subject of Super Vagina Time). 
I would also like to be able to fly my partner out for the procedure and convalescence. She's a student to works part-time to pay for her tuition. She wouldn't be able to afford covering travel expenses on this income while being away from work. Having her by my side would mean the world to me. She'd be able to hold my hand before I went under and she'd be smiling at me when I woke up.
All this is to say that if the proceeds of this campaign exceed $8,000, the money will be put to good use and will not be used for any raucous parties. Overall, this whole trip will cost somewhere in the ballpark of $12,000-$14,000.


What Happens to Extra Money?
I've set the stretch goal for the game at $15,000 because I'm confident that will be enough to cover all of my costs and leave me with enough leftover to pay Cameron, Brigid and an artist.
When the surgery is over, and all the bills and game-makers are paid, I will donate any and all leftover money to the Sylvia Rivera Law Project.
Extra money will absolutely not be spent outside of the surgery trip or the game. I'm taking this campaign very seriously and, as mentioned, I'll be publicly posting documentation for all expenses.


Where Does the Money Go?This campaign runs on a flexible funding model which means I will receive money even if I don't reach my goal. All money raised will be saved toward surgical expenses.
It will go into a separate savings account that I will not use for anything else. I will show this account balance to several trustworthy folks at regular intervals and they will verify that I'm not using it for buffalo wings and ice cream sandwiches. 
Receipts and documentation for everything the money is used for (with account numbers and personal info redacted, of course) will be posted publicly in updates to this campaign.
Acknowledging My Privilege
I want to be clear that I am incredibly fortunate to have a health insurance plan that covers a large portion of the cost of surgery. Other folks need care more than I do and I'd encourage you to seek out and contribute to other IndieGoGo campaigns as well. My addition of the potential SRLP donation is a way to try to use some of my visibility for other folks as well.
I also want to disclose that I come from an upper-class family that would typically swoop in to help me with life-saving medical expenses. The catch is that my parents are devout Mormons who have told me that transitioning was "the worst decision I can possibly make in my life." I'm on my own for this. And my grad student stipend checks are nowhere near large enough for costly medical procedures.
With those disclosures in mind, I'm asking for your help. If you like the work that I do, if you've enjoyed something I've made, this is a way for you to dramatically improve the quality of my life in return. You'll never forget that you were a part of this and I'll never quit thanking you.

story:
A message from Dina: 

I just want to say thank you to all of those who have already donated and those of you who will donate.  I’m really not one to ask for help especially financial help.  I may be kicking cancer in the butt but cancer is kicking my finances in the butt.  My mom has always said save for a rainy day, I should have listened to her because my rainy day arrived on February 4th, the day I found out I have breast cancer.

This whole experience has been very humbling for me, it has put my faith back into people like you who are donating to help me through.  I know you all work very hard for your money, you have family to support and you decided to help me.  I have paid it forward many times in my life never thinking that one day folks like you would pay it forward to me.

Saying thank you isn't enough for your generosity, all I can do when this is over and when I’m back on my feet financially is pay it forward to someone else in need and I promise you that I will pay it forward.

-Dina 


Hello! 

I am Dina's cousin Michelle, and I was heartbroken at the news of her cancer diagnosis.  Dina has never been one to ask for help so her niece Lisa and I thought this would be a good way to show Dina our support and for her friends to do the same.  

Dina uprooted the life she built in Birmingham to move back to East Rochester to be with her mom.  Because of this, she didn't have very many sick days to use up with her new job and is already facing a giant insurance deductible.  

The funds raised will go towards this deductible. 

You can follow Dina's progress on her blog:
http://gizzardgirl.tumblr.com/

There are a few perks for donating.  

Everyone will get a photo of Dina and her wonder dog Maddie along with a personalized thank you card.  

The hair and nails have been donated by Kristi Passalacqua, owner of Expressions Salon in Rochester.  She is Dina's hairdresser and has done such a great job taking care of Dina.  Your nail appointment will be by one of the nail techs that works at Expressions and you can make your hair appointment with Kristi or with one of her many fine stylists! 

Thank you so much Kristi!!

Another perk is a 5 x7 photo by Mark Head.  Here is a link to his photographs so that you can choose which photo you would like. 

http://tinyurl.com/mp9egmg

Thanks so much to Mark for donating his art! 

There is also a live Skype session with Dina's mother, Franca as a perk!  As you can see from the video above, Franca isn't too sure what Skype is but i suspect this will be a really fun perk.  And probably a rather loud perk! 

No amount is too small and if you can't donate, don't worry!  Spread the word and post this on your social media pages!  Send Dina an email or post something funny on her Facebook page!  Any kind of pick me up is a good one and I think Dina could use a pick me up right about now.  

Thank you all so much, so very much from the bottom of so many hearts.

story:
Heroes Marathon needs Pylons

The World Alzheimer's Day Run For Heroes Marathon is in it 4th year and we have a special and iconic course for the race.  Through the small town community of Amherstburg Ontario along the Detroit River and through a historic battle Fort Malden it is a stunning little race.  We have under 2,000 competitors for the race weekend that travel in from all around North America.

Run For Heroes Marathon is named after my mother, she took care of my dad who had Alzheimer's for 22.5 years and kept him at home for 19 of them as the primary care giver.  My mom is my Hero.  The beauty of the race is you name your own hero as it is deeply personal and rewarding.

My name is Chris Uszynski and I founded the World Alzheimer's Day Run For Heroes Marathon 8 years ago with the hope of raising money for Caregiver Support programs in our local area.  It started as an ultra marathon and grew to 100K long runs then after an illness I grounded it in the Town of Amherstburg with Kids run, 5K, 10K, 21K(half Marathon) and 42K(full Marathon) - Boston Qualifier to share with the World.  To date we have raised almost a quarter million for the local Alzheimer Society for caregiver support programs like Day Away and In Home Respite.

We need this campaign to continue the 42K Marathon course of the run.  

We need to buy our own Pylons and keep the infrastructure local 

The Marathon course is an in and out and requires 2,000 pylons to safely block off a lane for runners.  We currently rent them for over $10,000 for the day from a firm in Toronto.  In Southern Ontario no municipalities or rental companies has 2,000 pylons because they rely on contractors to own them.  Road contractors cannot guarantee them to us as they are in use in construction.  To close off a road and meet Ministry of Transportation guidelines as well as compiling with the laws and  insurance requirements you must use a specific pylon -TC-51B.  No pylons No Race.  If we buy them for $45,000 (they cost $20 each pus transportation) then we can use them year after year and sustain this race for decades to come.  It is one of those low use, highly required assets that a grant would be perfect for but none are available to apply for. 

The Impact

The Run For Heroes Marathon is Canada's most Southern Boston Qualifier and is one the Regions big athletic draws to our communities. Our region and small town needs the tourism and economic boost that our Marathon provides. We provide positive good health messaging and good habits for a future running generation.

If you help us we will name a pylon after you

When you give $25 you get to name the pylon.

For donations over $5,000 we will name a 5K portion  of the course after you or a company.  All mapping will detail it as well as posting signage on the course to acknowledge the course.

When you have donated email pylon@runningflat.com the name you want on the pylon.   

Thanks for you interest and Keep Running,

story:
Our goal is to expose and engage our community to a healthy and fit lifestyle.  We can only accomplish this by offering a stand alone fitness facility, where we will innovate what we do and how we do it.  Our passion is helping people achieve their fitness, fat loss, and health goals.  We are laser-focused in helping our clients accomplish dramatic body transformations. 

What is Upper Cape Fit Body

Upper Cape Fit Body is a part of an international fitness model.  With hundreds of locations throughout the United States, Canada and the United Kingdom, the franchise embarks itself on the front lines of battling the rise of obesity throughout the world.  The company's goal goal is to expose and engage 20% of the world's population to a healthy and fit lifestyle. 

We are on mission to make a positive impact in our Upper Cape community.  Our facility differs from that of a big box gym or Crossfit regiment in that we offer a results driven and energetic fitness and fat loss workout program that includes motivation, accountability and dynamic resistance training; all designed to get you the body that you want in a safe, fun and non-intimidating atmosphere.  Our programs can be used by all fitness levels, regardless of age. 

Every workout session is led by a qualified personal trainer and is designed to be fun, supportive and challenging, while burning maximum fat, in minimum time. Personalization is key to getting the best possible results, which is why our workout programs are modified to fit your goals and individual fitness level.

Unlike working one-on-one with a personal trainer, our workout programs are done in a group setting which makes them fun, motivating, challenging while keeping the cost of the program affordable compared to private one-on-one personal training sessions.

What We Need

Upper Cape Fit Body requires $20,000 in order to successfully launch.  The entirety of this funding will go towards licensing, facility build-out and equipment. 

Our 3000 sq foot facility will use funds for typical building improvements such as paint, signage, in additional to installing carpet backed foam flooring.  The equipment needed initially includes Dumbbells, TRX Suspension Training Centers, Battle Ropes and Pull Up Stations.  

In return for your support, we’re offering up some great rewards! They include fitness T-shirts, Workout Programs, Free Online Fitness Coaching, and Free Memberships to our facility.  

The Impact

 Over 78 million adults and 12.5 million children and adolescents in the United States are obese. Recent reports project that by 2030, half of all adults in the United States will be obese.  Obesity leads to chronic illness, diabetes, disability and death.  By supporting Upper Cape Fit Body, you are becoming an integral part in improving the health and lives of others in our community.   Our clients not only realize the physical health benefits of utilizing our facility, but also the emotional health benefits that come from a fat loss transformation.  Through our facility, we not only influence our clients to live healthier lives through fitness and sound nutrition, but they in return influence their loved ones to eat healthier and participate in regular exercise. 

Future Vision

Our future plans do not stop at Upper Cape Fit Body.  Our long term vision is to bring about the Fit Body model to not only the Upper Cape area, but to other surrounding towns through out the South Coast areas.  Our goal is to transform the lives of 10,000 people in these communities.  Your support will make this possible. 

Ways You Can Help

We cannot express how much your financial contribution means.  By contributing you are making a relevant difference in our mission, and the lives of others. If you aren’t able to contribute, we understand! We can use your help in other ways. Tell your friends, your coworkers, your family, and anyone else who may want to learn about us and our campaign! Share us on Facebook and other social media too. A little boost can make a world of difference to us and our campaign. Thank you so much for your help and support

story:
Your Community Starts Here!

Black & Poly is launching global monthly meetups to serve and assist new individuals in their transition to the Polyamorous lovestyle.  The contributions that you make will assist organizers with much needed tools to conduct meetings, print literature, secure locations, and expand meetup.com online presence nationwide.

Any Amount Will Aid Us In Achieving Our Goals


We are raising a mere $1500.00 to aid currently in the Launching of Atlanta, Houston, Dallas, and Los Angeles but you'll receive so much more in return:


  • A local Poly community leader that you can call on for guidance in tough times.
  • A chance to interact fact to face with Polyamorous families and individuals that you can share experiences with, learn and grow from.
  • A network of support and solidarity at a grass root level.
  • A foundation for building a meetup in your area soon.
  • And a great tax deduction if you're in the state of California! (not 501c3 yet) :(


If You Are Unable to Contribute, There Other Ways To Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please spread the word, share and make some noise about this campaign to raise funds for your community if you can!

story:
Tim and Rachel have been married for 9 years and have 3 beautiful children, Sarah (age 8), Andrew (age 5.5), and Jonathan (almost 2).  After being an avid runner, basketball player, drummer in the church band, summer camp counselor, and softball player for his work team, Tim suddenly found himself unable to get out of bed because of his rapidly declining health.  After many doctor's appointments over the course of several months, he was finally diagnosed with Lyme disease in April of 2009.  After finally receiving a diagnosis, Tim and Rachel thought they were on their way back to a normal, healthy life.

Unfortunately, their road has only gotten harder over the past 4 years with Rachel and their son Andrew also being diagnosed with Lyme.  Tim and Rachel are currently both being treated with IV antibiotics via PICC lines.  Tim's employer was so accommodating in allowing him to work from home since he was unable to get out of bed.  However, with his recent lay-off, Tim and Rachel have reached the breaking point.

For more of their story, please see their blog here: http://ourlyme.blogspot.com/2013/02/our-lyme-story-part-1.html

We know their bills are much more than $5000, but we didn't want to set an overwhelming goal.  If we beat this amout, it will all go to helping in their recovery.  Every penny counts. Please help them get their health and their life back.

***As our thank you to you, our donors, we will be having some giveaways over the course of our campaign on our blog, ourlyme.blogspot.com.  We are giving away children's books, jewelry, gas gift cards, sweet treats and more, so please check back often and share with your friends!

***Also, as an incentive to share our campaign with your friends, we will be offering a FREE giveaway of an Amazon gift card at our blog as well.

story:
AS SEEN IN:






NEWS FLASH! Thanks to our recent media splash and your contributions, the maker of Trident gum—Mondelez, one of the largest food manufacture in the world—called us to say it is not using nano in its foods. They are also requiring suppliers to provide nano-free ingredients. Mondelez did not respond to our inquiries last year, but with this campaign, food makers are beginning to see how much you care about nano.

So, instead of testing Trident gum, we are swapping in Betty Crocker Whipped Frosting to test for nano. It has the same coloring additive that we found in Dunkin' Donuts.

How can you say no to a fluffy white donut covered in powdered sugar? As it turns out, calories aren’t the only thing that you should be worried about. Our recent lab tests found potentially harmful nano-sized particles in the white powdered sugar on Dunkin’ Donuts.

Nanoparticles are one millionth the size of a grain of sand. Because of their small size, they are able to go places in the body that regular particles cannot. When eaten, nano can pass into the blood and travel to vital organs including the liver, the heart, and even the brain. A recent scientific study showed that ingested nano caused abnormal swelling in the brains of rats.

So how do we know if these additives are in your food?  Well, if it’s up to food manufactures, you won’t! 

That’s why we decided to take matters into our own hands by finding where nano is entering our food supply. We need your help to raise $9,000 to test three products we believe may contain nano: Pop-Tarts, M&M’s, and Betty Crocker frosting. All three may use colorings, just like in the white powdered sugar on Dunkin’ Donuts that contain nano.

By contributing to this campaign by March 13th, you will help us expose more sweets containing nano. We will use this information to press manufacturers to stop using this untested technology in our foods.

As You Sow is a nonprofit organization that has been fighting to get toxins out of consumer products for over 20 years. All donations are tax-deductible and there are many perks for donating.  

 

The food industry is exploring using nano because of its potential to do revolutionary things to our foods, like make creamy fat-free liquids, enhance flavors, brighten colors, and keep food fresh longer.

But there are no studies proving that nano is safe in food—especially for kids. Even the FDA says nano is not necessarily safe, but is not preventing companies from using it.

In 2010, As You Sow pressed McDonald’s and Kraft to create public policy statements about their use of nano. In 2011, we published a framework to help companies find out about nano in their supply chains. And in 2012, we surveyed 2,500 food companies and found only two have a formal policy on their use of nano.

We announced our findings in Slipping Through the Cracks: An Issue Brief on Nanomaterials in Food (2013) and have started talking to Dunkin’ Donuts about getting these additives out of their products until they are proven safe. Read more about the report and Dunkin' in The New York Times and Scientific American.

 

We will test Pop-Tarts, M&M’s, and Betty Crocker frosting for nano because they all contain a chemical we know is being used in nano form in other foods. You will be the first to hear when we get the lab results back—after all, you are making this possible! Then we will go public and start talking to the companies that make these products to share our concerns.

Each lab test costs $3,000 so each third of our fundraising goal sends another product to the lab.

This is just the first round of foods we want to test for nano. Check out the perks below to find out how to add your favorite food products to the testing list.

 

When you donate:

  • $25 – You get early access to testing results
  • $50 – You get an invitation to discuss the findings with our research staff
  • $100 - You get to vote on the ballot for the next round of food items to be tested
  • $250 - You get to suggest items to be added to the ballot
  • $500 - You get to have nano-free donuts with our research staff in Oakland, California
  • $1,000 - You get a free copy of Michael Pollan's In Defense of Food

 

Do your friends and family know they might be eating nano? Email, Facebook, or Tweet them a link to www.indiegogo.com/nanoays.

And come join the conversation with us on Facebook and Twitter!

 

At As You Sow, we take the old adage "you reap what you sow" to heart. We are sowing a better world by pushing companies to be socially and environmentally responsible, so we can all reap the rewards of a safe, just, and sustainable world. For more information visit www.asyousow.org. 

Photo Credit: Jacqueline Argote – Zach Behar Films
story_txt:
AS SEEN IN:



NEWS FLASH! Thanks to our recent media splash and your contributions, the maker of Trident gum—Mondelez, one of the largest food manufacture in the world—called us to say it is not using nano in its foods. They are also requiring suppliers to provide nano-free ingredients. Mondelez did not respond to our inquiries last year, but with this campaign, food makers are beginning to see how much you care about nano.
So, instead of testing Trident gum, we are swapping in Betty Crocker Whipped Frosting to test for nano. It has the same coloring additive that we found in Dunkin' Donuts.

How can you say no to a fluffy white donut covered in powdered sugar? As it turns out, calories aren’t the only thing that you should be worried about. Our recent lab tests found potentially harmful nano-sized particles in the white powdered sugar on Dunkin’ Donuts.
Nanoparticles are one millionth the size of a grain of sand. Because of their small size, they are able to go places in the body that regular particles cannot. When eaten, nano can pass into the blood and travel to vital organs including the liver, the heart, and even the brain. A recent scientific study showed that ingested nano caused abnormal swelling in the brains of rats.
So how do we know if these additives are in your food?  Well, if it’s up to food manufactures, you won’t! 
That’s why we decided to take matters into our own hands by finding where nano is entering our food supply. We need your help to raise $9,000 to test three products we believe may contain nano: Pop-Tarts, M&M’s, and Betty Crocker frosting. story:
This is my nephew Skylar. He is 6 months old and has spent the last 56 days in a children's hospital. In this picture you will see him how he typically is. A happy baby boy filled with love and laughter. What you do not see is the problem. His tiny heart is dying. The good news is he is on the list for a transplant. The bad news is we don't know how long that will take.

 

Every day is another battle for him. Every night is a victory. Skylar's sudden illness has devastated our family. Emotionally, physically, and financially. My brother drives over 600 miles to visit Skylar as often as he can. In the meantime all we can do is wait and pray.

 

I know you don't know my brother, but I can assure you, you will not find a more kind and generous man. His day is not complete until everyone around him laughs. My brother and his family are just like you. They work hard, live paycheck to paycheck, and shop at Walmart.

 

I started this drive with one goal in mind. To assist my brother and his family in spending more time with Skylar. We have no idea how this will all turn out. God willing, it will be a happy ending. I humbly request that you consider this cause.

 

While donations are greatly appreciated, it isn't the only way to contribute. Prayers, well-wishes, and thoughts are also a form of currency, this being the internet and all. Simply sharing Skylar's story may be all that is needed. The Sky's the limit.

 

Thank you and God bless.

story:
About HomeTouch

HomeTouch is an award winning software-as-a-service that enables families and care providers to manage the care of older people in their own homes. HomeTouch’s vision is to develop a globally accessible service that intervenes following a decline in functioning, prolongs independence at home and continues to offer support during higher levels of dependence towards the end of life.

HomeTouch’s vision is twofold: firstly, to enable older people to become less isolated, more active and less dependent, and secondly to provide families/care providers with a set of productivity, monitoring and communication tools to support care anytime/anywhere.

Our Founder

Dr Jamie Wilson is a physician and dementia specialist and worked for 10 years in the UK NHS. He founded HomeTouch to help families care better for isolated older relatives because he saw the lack of solutions to help families care for loved ones with early dementia.. HomeTouch was initially trialled at a memory clinic at Imperial College London. Jamie has an MBA from London Business School/UC Berkeley, a medical degree from Leeds University Medical School, and membership of Royal College of Psychiatrists. He has worked at leading healthcare organizations from the BMJ to Novartis and is also an experienced technology entrepreneur with a previous startup in Silicion Valley.

Our Investors and Customers

We have just been awarded a contract for £25k from BUPA to pilot a "care dashboard" in BUPA's care homes. Our first round of investment came from Healthbox, a healthcare accelerator backed by BUPA, and Guys and St Thomas' Hospital Charity amongst other. We have also won Best Company Award at Europe's premier Assisted Living Conference in 2012. We launched to consumers in May 2013 and have a small number of early customers.

How your Funding will Help

To deliver the best service we can, we need to invest heavily in the HomeTouch platform to improve existing functionality, broaden features and provide support to our users.

What We Need & What You Get

HomeTouch' current platform has three components:

1) a feature rich tablet application for older people, displaying services such as messaging, videocall, web radio, calendar, photo album and educational videos
2) a desktop application with dashboard analytics, services configuration, and
productivity tools for families/carers
3) an intelligent server which monitors activity and manages communication between the two applications

We will use £50k to develop the following:

£5k Real time notifications panel for care related activities

£5k Smartphone/SMS notifications for family members

£5k Optimizing existing functionality such as videocall

£10k Embedding  "social impact" metrics to track isolation and positive impacts on carers

£10k Medication and reminders system

£10k Improving the usability of the tablet and implementing a mood tracking tool

£5k Implementing a "Nurse call triage panel"

In return, we will provide significantly discounted monthly and annual subscriptions. Please see perks for more details.

The Impact

Our social impact model has been designed to target three long term goals: reduce social isolation in older people, prolong independence at home, and reduce ”carer strain” in family and informal caregivers.

HomeTouch addresses this problem by identifying the core (Maslow’s Hierarchy) needs of the participants in the system and improving connectivity and information flow to reduce isolation and carer strain. For instance, social isolation is now known to impact upon daily functioning, physical health and cognition, all of which, if deteriorate over time, can contribute to loss of independence.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this with friends or pass on details to families or organizations you think may be interested.

story:
Donations begin at $10 and go towards spa treatments (manicures, pedicures, massages and facials) for mothers of significantly ill children at North Carolina Children's Hospital. 

Donators will receive a pretty purple hair extension clip and button to proudly wear for the month of February, so as to raise awareness and to recruit others to our cause.

story:
Update #4 - October 27, 2013 

Just wanted to let everyone know that the instructions on how to build the DIY CineDrone are done and you should have gotten an email on where and how to get it. If you didn't then please contact me ASAP. For those of you who ordere the custom made CineDrones, just wanted to let you know that all I have to do is test out each CineDrones and if all is working I can send it to you. Unfortunately do to my crazy schedule I might not be able to test out all of the CineDrone and ship them out this week. After November 1st I am gone to Ecuador and won't be able to ship out the CineDrone until I come back to the USA on November 16th. I am now emailing everyone who ordered the CineDrone in the order that the pledges were made. If I get the payment for the shipping before November 1st then I will mail it out to you this week. If I don't then I will send it out after November 16th. Sorry guys, I know it's all delayed but I completely underestimated how much work building these will be. So I am trying to be as fair and fast by shipping the CineDrones out in the same order that each pledge was made.

Update #3 - September 7, 2013

I am done filming the tutorials, and editing them. The first tutorials will be out later this week. As for the custom built CineDrones, I'm still working on those. Here is a video that explains that in more detail: http://youtu.be/A4P3U5KWj18

Update #2 - August 15, 2013

We did it!!! Thanks to everyone who contributed to this project!!!!!!

I already ordered new parts and 2 extra gimbals to test out. Should be getting them in a week so I can start to test them out. As soon as I have decided on all the final parts I will be using, I'll start working on the video tutorials and the custom built CineDrone for you guys.

Update #1 - August 1, 2013

Here is some more info on the CineDrone. http://youtu.be/kGV2jqf_9HQ

Contact me for more info at http://tomantosfilms.com/contact/

 

Sky Is The Limit - the CineDrone

Thanks to advances in technology, indie filmmakers now have amazing tools that let them match the picture quality of Hollywood productions. However, one important aspect of filmmaking that has remained out of the reach of low-budget filmmakers is aerial cinematography. This does not have to be the case much longer, though. 

As soon as the first consumer quadcopters emerged, inventive filmmakers started to experiment with recording video footage from these devices. The results have been mixed. Even when the footage turned out to be satisfactory, usually the time, cost and technical expertise required to build such a system was considerable, thereby still keeping aerial cinematography out the toolbox of most filmmakers.

For the last year I have been testing different devices and components to see whether it is possible to build a system on a reasonable budget that would meet the needs of indie filmmakers. I am happy to say that I have constructed a system - i.e. the  CineDrone - that meets my needs as a filmmaker and cinematographer. Watch my test footage and judge the results for yourself. Considering that I have not used any post-stabilization, I think that CineDrone is capable of producing great shots that would fit perfectly in a mega budget film production.

 

Where do you come in?

I have spent a lot of time and money to build this one device. With this experience, I can now make improvements to the build of this system. I can also lower the costs if I can order all the components in batches.

Therefore, If there are enough of you interested, I can gain the scale and efficiency to deliver the CineDrones on an affordable budget.

I am foremost a filmmaker and so I am not planning to get in the business of selling these systems afterwards. But with your pledges I could dedicate the time to build a limited number of these devices so that more filmmakers can start getting great aerial shots.   

Here are some key advantages of my CineDrone:

- great aerial cinematography on an affordable budget

- a small device that only requires one person to operate it

- can be used in spaces where airplanes cannot or are not allowed to fly

 

What you get?

I have various rewards. The key is the CineDrone itself. If you don't know how or simply don't have the time to build one yourself then I can do it for you. This way all you have to do is attach your GoPro Hero 3 camera and you're ready to fly. If you want to build one yourself then I will produce video tutorials that explain how to make the exact same CineDrone like the one I have. Also, I will produce for you a series of training videos on how to get cinematic shots using an RC aerial platform like my CineDrone.

 

Here are some more shots I got using my CineDrone

 

Here is some information about me:

Last year I had a successful Kickstarter campaign where I produced the “Making Music Videos: Film School” - a series of filmmaking tutorials. 

And here is my short bio:

Tom Antos is a director, cinematographer and visual effects / animation artist - all rolled into one.  He has directed the feature film “Under Black Skies”, as well as numerous short films and music videos. In addition, he has fourteen years of experience in the areas of visual effects, CGI and animation. This work has earned him several awards, including Telly, Promax BDA and Worldfest Gold Remi. Tom’s professional experience ranges from large Hollywood productions like “Bait” and “Everyone’s Hero” to small budget DIY projects.

Tom has been sharing his filmmaking experience and knowledge through online tutorials that have gained a large and loyal audience on YouTube and Vimeo. His tutorials have been seen over two million times on YouTube alone, and his YouTube channels have over one hundred thousand subscribers and over thirty million views.

Even if you cannot contribute, I appreciate if you can spread the word. Thanks!

story:
What if there was an all natural bug repellant that would protect humans and animals from those annoying and dangerous bugs that bite us in warmer weather?   What if there was a company that was willing to donate this product to areas of the world that are infected by these bugs?  What if you could help fund the production of this product so that it got off the ground faster?

My name is Eric, and I have been pained by the number of people and animals that are tormented by biting and stinging insects that spread Malaria, West Nile Virus, Lyme disease, EEE, and Dengue Fever, to name just a few. According to statistics from the CDC, NIH and VAA, biting insects are responsible for the deaths of over one million people and 50,000 horses every year. I bring up horses along with humans for a reason.

The horse on which I take riding lessons was being tormented by the biting and stinging insects that feast on his blood. During one riding lesson some years back, Ronin was being particulary swarmed by the various flyng biting and sucking insects (gnats, bots and the dreaded giant Tabanidae-horse fly). Then in one moment, he snapped and bucked me off. The resulting bruise spread from knee to ribcage.

So, obviously, a bug repellent was indicated. When I saw what was commercially available, I was appalled. Every available product is nearly toxic. 

So I looked to Nature to find a solution to the blight of those bitey buggers.

We did not look to Citronella.

WE CAN NOT CLAIM THAT KTBOOM DIAGNOSES, PREVENTS OR CURES ANY DISEASE.


What we can claim is that after years of trials, we found a blend of organic essential oils in a base of organic alcohol, safely and effectively discourages from landing all of those arthropods which carry and transmit Malaria, Eastern Equine Encephalitis (EEE), West Nile Virus (WNV), Dengue Fever and painful bites and stings. This includes mosquitos, ticks, fleas, biting flies, bot flies, deer flies, horse flies, biting gnats, spiders, ants and bed bugs. 

If they do not land, they can not bite and spread disease.

Here is a testimonial from Becky Duncan, my riding instructor and a long time equestrian: "Our barn is surrounded on three sides by parkland. Great for trail rides, but also a constant source for flies, gnats, mosquitoes and ticks. With all my horses I need a lot of fly repellent. I don't want to use any of the poisonous fly sprays because I treasure my horses, my grandchildren, my planet. 

Eric's KTBOOM is the most effective and safest fly repellent I have tried. I used to try every new product I could find. I am now content that I have found the best."



This campaign will not start out with a slick video or advertising campaign. I'm already pretty much invested in the development. If funded, this money will be used to produce a first run of $1500 (both 2 and 4 oz) atomizers of KTBOOM by a company in Boca Raton FL that has received it's organic certification. They will produce it and bottle it in aluminum atomizers (so far, they seem the best vessel). NO AEROSOLS!

 
The first-run costs will be approximately $4000.  There is an additional $1000 for waterproof labeling.  The rest of the money will be used to develop the most efficient and animal/earth friendly way of producing the large 28oz spray bottle that will use a plant-based surfactant to enable the product to spray a foam.  The foam bottle will be intended for protecting larger surfaces:  like your horse or fidgety dogs.  It will still be people friendly, but more effective than an atomizer for applications to larger surfaces.  The cost is variable.  We are in negotiations on development costs and have yet to develop a prototype. Soaps, shampoos and cosmetic friendly products to work in tandem follow.

Finished product retail will range from $11 (2oz), $19 (4oz) and the foam $29-32 (28oz).

We will promote the product through social media (facebook, a reasonably slick website [I want to make a video similar to the 70's commercial where someone sprays Deet on their arm and sticks it into a misquito filled glass tank and the bugs flee. I will use MY arm]). Plus, affiliations with anxious equestrians in Potamac MD, and people who do not yet know that they want it in mosquito infested Ocala FL, will enable us to put it in front of appreciative people.

Let us be honest with ourselves, if the Earth is warming, then this type of vector will only become a greater threat.

Initially, this will not be profitable. It will be laborious. When it does become a viable enterprise, we commit 10% of all profits from the sale of these products to the distribution of KTBOOM to regions, domestic and foreign, where it will provide needed relief. 

Yes, mosquito netting saves many lives, but you cannot spend your day walking around in it. And Deet has saved hundreds of millions of lives. At what environmental and health cost?

We will have to get a patent immediately. No, I don't have a patent. I have a chocolate company to run. Maybe a patent attorney would like to take this up as a cause celebre. If people show interest, we will set to it.

The perks:

The knowledge you helped save people (and yourself) and animals you love from painful bites and possibly fatal diseases.

Not enough?

OK. No matter whether we get funded or not, if you commit the $, we'll get you the perk. I'll make the product myself, package and send it.

The FUNDER of $1000 gets a good amount for human and friend, plus we will send a case in their name to wherever they choose. This is for the folks who have a platform, and liquidity: Woody Harrelson, Angelina Jolie, Sheryl Crow, Madonna, Sean Penn, George Clooney, John Lyons...

They are able to fund our work, and we support theirs.

If this site is not cool enough yet, check back.
story_txt:
What if there was an all natural bug repellant that would protect humans and animals from those annoying and dangerous bugs that bite us in warmer weather?   What if there was a company that was willing to donate this product to areas of the world that are infected by these bugs?  What if you could help fund the production of this product so that it got off the ground faster?
My name is Eric, and I have been pained by the number of people and animals that are tormented by biting and stinging insects that spread Malaria, West Nile Virus, Lyme disease, EEE, and Dengue Fever, to name just a few. According to statistics from the CDC, NIH and VAA, biting insects are responsible for the deaths of over one million people and 50,000 horses every year. I bring up horses along with humans for a reason.
The horse on which I take riding lessons was being tormented by the biting and stinging insects that feast on his blood. During one riding lesson some years back, Ronin was being particulary swarmed by the various flyng biting and sucking insects (gnats, bots and the dreaded giant Tabanidae-horse fly). Then in one moment, he snapped and bucked me off. The resulting bruise spread from knee to ribcage.
So, obviously, a bug repellent was indicated. When I saw what was commercially available, I was appalled. Every available product is nearly toxic. 
So I looked to Nature to find a solution to the blight of those bitey buggers.
We did not look to Citronella.
WE CAN NOT CLAIM THAT KTBOOM DIAGNOSES, PREVENTS OR CURES ANY DISEASE.

What we can claim is that after years of trials, we found a blend of organic essential oils in a base of organic alcohol, safely and effectively discourages from landing all of those arthropods which carry and transmit Malaria, Eastern Equine Encephalitis (EEE), West Nile Virus (WNV), Dengue Fever and painful bites and stings. This includes mosquitos, ticks, fleas, biting flies, bot flies, deer flies, horse flies, biting gnats, spiders, ants and bed bugs. 

 If they do not land, they can not bite and spread disease.
Here is a testimonial from Becky Duncan, my riding instructor and a long time equestrian: "Our barn is surrounded on three sides by parkland. Great for trail rides, but also a constant source for flies, gnats, mosquitoes and ticks. With all my horses I need a lot of fly repellent. I don't want to use any of the poisonous fly sprays because I treasure my horses, my grandchildren, my planet. 
Eric's KTBOOM is the most effective and safest fly repellent I have tried. I used to try every new product I could find. I am now content that I have found the best."


This campaign will not start out with a slick video or advertising campaign. I'm already pretty much invested in the development. If funded, this money will be used to produce a first run of $1500 (both 2 and 4 oz) atomizers of KTBOOM by a company in Boca Raton FL that has received it's organic certification. They will produce it and bottle it in aluminum atomizers (so far, they seem the best vessel). NO AEROSOLS!
 The first-run costs will be approximately $4000.  There is an additional $1000 for waterproof labeling.  The rest of the money will be used to develop the most efficient and animal/earth friendly way of producing the large 28oz spray bottle that will use a plant-based surfactant to enable the product to spray a foam.  The foam bottle will be intended for protecting larger surfaces:  like your horse or fidgety dogs.  It will still be people friendly, but more effective than an atomizer for applications to larger surfaces.  The cost is variable.  We are in negotiations on development costs and have yet to develop a prototype. Soaps, shampoos and cosmetic friendly products to work in tandem follow.
Finished product retail will range from $11 (2oz), $19 (4oz) and the foam $29-32 (28oz).
We will promote the product through social media (facebook, a reasonably slick website [I want to make a video similar to the 70's commercial where someone sprays Deet on their arm and sticks it into a misquito filled glass tank and the bugs flee. I will use MY arm]). Plus, affiliations with anxious equestrians in Potamac MD, and people who do not yet know that they want it in mosquito infested Ocala FL, will enable us to put it in front of appreciative people.
Let us be honest with ourselves, if the Earth is warming, then this type of vector will only become a greater threat.
Initially, this will not be profitable. It will be laborious. When it does become a viable enterprise, we commit 10% of all profits from the sale of these products to the distribution of KTBOOM to regions, domestic and foreign, where it will provide needed relief.

story:
When it comes to your baby, there are no compromises.

As a doctor, Michelle had witnessed the anxiety of parents wanting to do everything to keep their baby healthy and strong, and alleviating their fears about SIDS and other health concerns that can affect newborns, infants, and toddlers. While she knew the chance of these things happening were slim, she understood that peace of mind is priceless, and if an opportunity arose for parents to take action, it seemed to be simple, common sense. 

What she and Doug never expected was for that reality to hit them so close to home. One night she found that her son had stopped breathing, and was lying there limp and turning blue. She knew what to do and jumped into action; after a frantic resuscitation, her baby began breathing normally again. Doug and Michelle were lucky that night, for them it was a happy ending. 

Doug, a Biomedical Engineer, resolved to do something about it. He created AIM™ and built the prototype. 

Thanks to new technology, Doug and Michelle would have that Peace of Mind that they needed. If anything happened, whether in the family room, the kitchen, the home office, or yard – wherever they might be – they’d know. 

A safer baby isn’t an option… it’s common sense. When it comes to your baby’s safety, knowing is everything.

The Alerting Infant Monitor (AIM™) keeps your baby safe by monitoring the movements coming from your baby’s tummy.  The monitor is clipped to the baby’s diaper and alerts the parents if movement is not detected.

For us as parents, the most important thing was to keep our babies safe when they slept, but the monitors that were on the market did not provide us with the peace of mind that we needed.   While a video or audio monitor can be useful to see what our baby needed when it cried, it would not help us to detect if our child stopped moving during the night, so we came up with a solution that would. 

How does the AIM™ work?

  • Slide the AIM™ onto the baby’s diaper or the waistband of their clothing.
  • The AIM™ is then monitoring the movement of your baby. 
  • If movement is not detected for 15 seconds, the AIM™ administers a gentle vibration to the baby’s tummy that we call the JustChecking™ reminder, sometimes all the baby needs is a little tickle to start moving again. 
  • If movement is still not detected, the AIM™ alerts parents with an audible alarm allowing them to check their baby. 

What Is Included

The AIM™ is cute, functional, stylish, lightweight, and precision-engineered but all business as it delivers an unequaled level of information. It attaches comfortably to baby and features a durable high quality finish. 

Why Crowdfunding?      

With high hopes we presented it to manufacturers of conventional baby monitors, only to have it declined for “business considerations".

A monitor like the AIM™ is complex, with costs that other simpler products just don’t have. The electronics controlling the monitor have to be right. There are no compromises with your baby.

Right now, the goal of $100,000 will enable us to ensure that our high standards will be met, and that our first manufacturing run will be covered.

Thank you in advance for your support – we know that the AIM™ will help parents the world over keep their baby safe.

Risk

The biggest risk that we face is market penetration, to reduce this risk we are partnering with a company who has sold thousands of baby monitors and other baby products within our intended market.  On the rare occasion that there is a delay in production, we promise to be upfront and communicate any delivery date challenges we encounter. 

Market Background

There are over 4 million babies born in the US each year, and 130 million babies worldwide. Unfortunately, over 2000 babies pass away each year in the US. Regardless of the why, every loss is tragic. The impact on our community is huge! Despite the advances in our medical technology, there are still far too many babies who do not live to celebrate their first birthday. 


Funding Goal:

Despite how simple AIM™ is to use, it is surprisingly complex, and has production and regulatory costs that other baby products don’t always encounter. We want (like you do) only the best, highest quality monitor for our baby. Manufacturing a monitor like this requires the highest standard and strict quality control.

We have selected a manufacturer that we know can meet and exceed the regulated product safety requirements, and that you can be assured that the AIM™ is The Best Baby Monitor on the market. We have goals to extend the product too, so that it is a complete monitoring system, but this is for the future.

Right now, the goal of $100,000 will enable us to ensure that our high standards will be met, and that our first manufacturing run will be covered.

Thank you in advance for your support – we know that the AIM™ will help parents the world over keep their baby safe.

What’s more important than the safety of a child?!

Undeterred, and pouring our hearts, energy and all of our savings – as well as the investment of like-minded friends and family into the project – Healthcare Zoo was born. 

“If one child is saved and one family spared because their parents have the information they otherwise wouldn’t have, that’s all we care about.” - Michelle 

As parents we wanted to come to Indiegogo to get the support we need to start the 1st run of production.  This will allow us to help parents all across the world obtain a tool that we wish we would have had, when our child needed it the most. 

Your support will help us finish the 1st round of manufacturing needed to make AIM™ a reality. 

Thank you! 

Doug and Michelle

story:
Introducing Athelix: The Athletic Elixir for Athletes*

 *Any individual dedicated to his or her sport.

Why Athelix?

You're most likely thinking, why should I bother funding this project? There are plenty products I could get at a local supplement store that can help me achieve my desired goals. What makes this so different from the others?

Athelix addresses this question. The supplement industry is unregulated. Many of the most popular products have active ingredients, but are mixed with fillers to cheapen the production. Don't believe me? Check the label and look for the words "proprietary blend". With a proprietary blend they do not disclose how much of the active ingredient is actually in the product. This was initially meant to protect the manufacturing formula, but now many use it as a way to short the consumers.

Our mission at Athelix is to provide a quality product of the highest standards. Each consumer is different, but his or her energy systems are not. Athelix creates its products to support the body’s energy system, while following the rules of the US Anti-Doping agency. We formulate our products based on the guidelines of theNational Strength and Conditioning Association. These guidelines explain how much, why, and what each active ingredient does for the body.

What differentiates Athelix?

Our product is specifically tailored to work with the body’s energy systems. This gives athletes a way to customize their supplement intake based on how they train and their personal goals.

The body has three basic energy systems that are utilized during exercise; oxidative, glycolytic, and phosphagen. The duration and intensity of individual exercises dictate which of the three energy systems the body uses, this varies from sport to sport..

Duration

Intensity

Energy System

0 - 30 seconds

Very High 

Phosphagen and Fast glycolysis 

30 sec - 2 minutes   

High

Fast Glycolysis

2 - 3 minutes

Moderate

Fast Glycolysis and Oxidative

>3 Minutes

Low

Oxidative 

The Product:

Athelix has a baseline of products that are ready to be produced, and they will be produced in the foreseeable future. At this moment we are launching only one product; ATHELIX CROSS, and giving it directly to the consumer. Preorder now and receive your product after the production. CROSS is at a wholesale price with a limited quantity. Get it not before it's to late!

CROSS:

CROSS bridges the gap between endurance and strength. For the athletes looking to exert power and strength for a long duration.

Athletes utilizing the oxidative glycolytic system embody exercise and train in all components of fitness. These individuals are relentless and push themselves to a maximum threshold each day. 

CROSS gives an anaerobic boost while improving their aerobic threshold. With a special blend of nutrients, vitamins, and protein athletes can push themselves beyond their threshold as CROSS helps repair damaged muscles.

Active Ingredients:

Dosage:

1

Serving  Size: 58grams

Label  Claim

INGREDIENT

****

mg

Leucine (L)

25000.000

mg

Protein (Whey Protein Isolate)

****

mg

Isoleucine (L)

****

mg

Cocoa Dutch Powder (10/12%)

****

mg

Valine (L)

****

mg

Glutamine (L)

****

mg

Methocel K15M

****

mg

Threonine (L)

****

mg

Beta Alanine

****

mg

Arginine Base (L)

****

mg

Potassium (Bicarbonate)

****

mg

Proline (L) USP

****

mg

Carnitine (l) Acetyl HCI

****

mg

Glycine

****

mg

HMB Calcium

Additional Ingredients: Stevia White Powder and Chocolate Natural Flavor

There is no pixie dusting or shortening of active ingredients. Dosages are based on the recommendations given by national strength and conditioning association.

*The Container Pictured Is Only a Prototype. The real one shall be in a much bigger container; in a 3000cc white hdpe wide mouth jar, 110mm white ribbed self-venting hso cap, 50cc clear medium handle flat bottom scoop, celon neck band and 12pk.

What's in it? 

After the first days of test production it became obvious that most products were skimping the public. We do not produce our products unless they match the exact quantity of active ingredients chosen during the test phase. Our products only combine active ingredients with natural sweeteners and natural flavors to ensure quality over quantity. 

In order to create products that support different energy systems the ingredients have to be tested and proven by an organization of the highest standards. Athelix follows the guidelines and research done by the National Strength and Conditioning Association. 

It is safe and has been proven to help athletes compete at the highest level.

Some sports that can benefit from Cross are: 

Crossfit, Soccer, Boxing, Basketball, Football, Rugby, Mid Distance Track and Field, Mixed Martial Arts, Downhill Skiing, Cycling, Mid Distance Swimming, Wrestling, Lacrosse, Hockey, Tennis, and those who enjoy Metabolic Conditioning or High Intensity Interval Training.

About the the manufacturer:

Paragon Laboratories is a contract formulator, manufacturer and packager of nutritional and dietary supplements. It executes customers’ private label formulations and creates custom products under exacting quality requirements. Paragon Labs produces tablets, capsules, and powders in a very wide variety of sizes and configurations, and packages them to meet customers’ requirements. Paragon is a rarity among contract manufacturers of nutritional supplements.

Cerfitifications:

To help minimize the risk that a dietary supplement or sports nutrition product contains a substance banned by one of the major sports organizations, NSF developed the Certified for Sport™ program. Under this program, products are tested to ensure that they are free of banned substances prohibited by various international sports organization.

QAI offers organic certification to processors and manufacturers who wish to label their products organic. This program applies to operations that process or handle agricultural products intended to be sold, labeled, or represented as "100 percent organic," "organic," or "made with organic ingredients."

Organic is a labeling term that indicates that the food or other agricultural product has been produced through approved methods that integrate cultural, biological, and mechanical practices that foster the proper use of resources, promote ecological balance, and conserve biodiversity. Synthetic fertilizers, sewage sludge, irradiation, and genetic engineering may not be used for organic products.

Under this program, products are tested to ensure that they are free of banned substances prohibited by various international sports organization.QAI offers organic certification to processors and manufacturers who wish to label their products organic. This program applies to operations that process or handle agricultural products intended to be sold, labeled, or represented as "100 percent organic," "organic," or "made with organic ingredients."Organic is a labeling term that indicates that the food or other agricultural product has been produced through approved methods that integrate cultural, biological, and mechanical practices that foster the proper use of resources, promote ecological balance, and conserve biodiversity. Synthetic fertilizers, sewage sludge, irradiation, and genetic engineering may not be used for organic products.

story:
What This Campaign Is All About

My name is Summer, and in 2002, I weighed 271 lbs. I lost over half of my body weight in about a year and a half and have kept it off ever since.

Over the years I have worked to assist others with motivation and advice to help them achieve their weight loss and fitness goals. I ran a blog on the topic from 2011-2012, I am active on Fitocracy and other health/fitness-oriented sites, and I've started a YouTube channel to further help crowd out all of the bad information that exists and prevents people from succeeding.

As I look to continue these efforts, I struggle with one huge remnant from my past: a large amount of excess skin. It's a psychological barrier that occasionally causes me a lot of stress and difficulty with staying on a healthy path.

To understand more about my motivations, please read "Stop Telling Me I Have a Bikini Body."

What I Need & What You Get

At this time, I have a job that will allow me to work from home during the recovery phase, which in the past has prevented me from moving forward. However, I only have enough money (including loans) to fund about 2/3 of the surgery costs.

What I have to give back in exchange for your support are two things: information and entertainment. I'd love to make videos to answer any of your questions on the topics of health, weight loss, and fitness. But I know not everyone is interested in those things, so I'm also happy to be your dancing YouTube puppet.


    The Impact

    Should this campaign succeed and I have the surgery, I want to do several things:

    • Help spread the word about the psychological effects of excess skin and how it can be a tremendous barrier to maintaining weight loss
    • Fully document my experience to share with others who may be looking into this surgery
    • Continue providing informative and entertaining content to help others who struggle on the long road to health.

    Risks & Challenges

    Notice that I'm running an all-or-nothing campaign. This is because if I don't receive 1/3 of the cost, I literally cannot afford the surgery, and I do not want to take your money if that's not going to happen.

    Obviously the biggest challenge comes with educating people that this surgery isn't for superficial reasons. The truth is, excess skin is a deformity - not one that impacts the ability to live, but much like folks with large birthmarks, gynecomastia, or hirsutism, it definitely affects one's self-image on a very deep level.

    Hopefully, with the combination of your support and my attempts to spread knowledge, this can be overcome.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you aren't able to contribute today, please please please:

    • Help spread the word about this campaign across social media (Indiegogo has sharing tools built in to make this simple)
    • Subscribe and link people to my YouTube channel - http://bit.ly/slgloom
    • If my goal is hit, let me know if there's anything you could do during my recovery - my husband will need some breaks from caring for me, so even if it's just taking him out for a drink, it will be very much appreciated!

    Thank you again for your consideration and interest. I'll be forever in your debt if you can help make this a reality.

story:
The Solution

Periotwist is a reusable anti-bacterial inter-dental cleaner that not only cleans but also can medicate the most neglected yet most important space in your mouth – between your teeth!

Twist it out

World Class Design

Easy Instructions

Gently insert the PerioTwist between your teeth. Then push/pull or Twist!

Forget floss and wire brushes that tear, scratch or break

There's a reason your dentist keeps telling you to floss - it's important! But there's also a reason no one ever does it!

Flossing is often difficult, time-consuming and occasionally painful. Alternatives like wires and brushes break, scratch and damage your teeth, and often result in expensive dental work. PerioTwist is designed to fit between all your teeth – no matter how large or small the space, or how large or small your hands are. Use it anytime, anywhere and in less time that the alternatives.


How it works - Just like a "Turbo Toothpick"

Research has conclusively established that the inter-dental area is the area of the mouth that is the most prone to gum disease, cavities, and bad breath. and yet this area is the most neglected because most current cleaning devices are ineffective, difficult to use, and have many other disadvantages causing non-compliance.

PerioTwist is super simple to use. Just insert it between your teeth and twist or push/pull it and let the magic of its design take care of the rest. Alternatively, you could also dip it into any paste (like toothpaste, liquid or gel for addition benefits) and twist it clockwise as you withdraw it leaving toothpaste or other medicaments to keep on treating.

How PerioTwist Works

Additional Benefits

Why We're Here

We need your support to get as many advance orders as possible to keep the cost of PerioTwist (and your dental bills) low.

About the Founders

Meet Dr. Allan Coopersmith (BSC.DDS.FAGD.FADI.FICD.FCARDP.FACD)

Dr. Allan Coopersmith, BSc DDS FAGD FADI FICD FCARDP FACD FIADFE, graduated Suma Cum Laude from McGill University, in the Faculty of Science. He went on to graduate McGill School of Dentistry in 1975 to earn his Doctor of Dental Surgery Degree graduating first in his class over four years with the Thornton gold medal.

His post graduate training as a General Practice Resident at the Albert Einstein Medical Centre permitted him to attain his American National Board Certification and Northeast Regional Board Certification with a Massachusetts Dental License which is still active today.

Dr. Allan Coopersmith was bestowed the honour by his peers with fellowships in the Academy of General Dentistry, Academy of Dentistry International, InternationalCollege of Dentists, Canadian Academy of Restorative Dentistry and Prosthodontics, American College of Dentists and the International Academy of Dento-Facial Aesthetics.

Dr. Coopersmith was a lecturer and clinical Instructor in the Department of Restorative Dentistry, Faculty of Dentistry, McGill University for 20 years. He holds numerous dental patents. Dr. Coopersmith currently practices General and Cosmetic Dentistry in Westmount Quebec, Canada.

  • Educational Achievements:
  • University Scholarship 1971-1972-1973-1974 
  • McGill University B.Sc. 1973. 
  • Great Distinction McGill University DDS 1975. 
  • Great Distinction National Dental Examining Board of Canada. 1975
  • American National Board Exams. 1975 
  • Northeast Regional Board Exams. 1978 
  • Albert Einstein Medical Center—General Practice Resident 1976 
  • Dr. Thornton Gold Medal - Highest Standing McGill Faculty of Dentistry throughout 4 years 
  • Lecturer Faculty of Dentistry, Dept. of Restorative Dentistry, McGill University. 1976-2000 
  • Fellow American College of Dentist. 
  • Prizes and other Achievements:
  • Alpha Omega Prize 
  • Orthodontic Prize 
  • Order of Dentists of Quebec 
  • Canadian Dental Association 
  • Alpha Omega Dental Fraternity 
  • Fellow Academy of General Dentistry 
  • Quebec Dental Surgeon’s Association 
  • Fellow Academy of Dentistry International 
  • Founder—Dentists for Dentists Organization 
  • Royal College of Dental Surgeons of Ontario 
  • Fellow of the International College of Dentists 
  • Holder of numerous dental patents and trademarks 
  • Federation of Dental Societies of Greater Montreal 
  • Board of Dentistry-The Commonwealth of Massachusetts. 1983- 2010
  • Fellow Canadian Academy of Restorative Dentistry and Prosthodontists
  • Fellow of the American College of Dentists
  • Fellow of the International Academy of Dento-Facial Esthetics

Meet Nathalie Fiset, RDG

Nathalie Fiset is a registered hygienist who has been practicing Oral Hygiene for 20 years in Montreal Canada and has dedicated herself to instructing as well as motivating her patients in the prevention of oral disease. She is a co-inventor of the “PerioTwist “TM inter dental cleaner and delivery device.

Risks and challenges

We feel we've derisked our crowdfunding campaign to the best of our ability. We've tested and sourced the very best local manufacturers. PerioTwist has been vetted by numerous dental professionals and tested on hundreds of individuals.

While there are competitors on the market, PerioTwist is patent protected and is the only inter-dental cleaner that can be twisted and push/pulled, thereby providing the best cleaning experience.
