We are in pursuit of the perfect electric shaver!

story:
Success Story

We launched TRUFob (Travel Utility Key Fob) in November 2013, since then we are improving the software to become the leaders in the market. 

Now we would like to add a new functionality to the fob with the support of the sales from the contributors: a "selfie" function.

The two buttons in the TRUFob hardware will allow the user to take pictures with their Apple device  camera , with or without flash, as if it were a remote control.

Keep track of every important moment in your life!

We are using Bluetooth 4 technology in our device and for that reason we are only iOS compatible (iPhone 4S/5/5S - iPod 5 - New iPad - iPad Mini)

 

First test -Remote control-

First packages coming to Miami

Beta testing in Arizona

Beta testing in the Caribbean

All in one.

Keep track of your valuables and keep a record of your important moments at the same time.
• Distance Indicator & Battery Indicator
• Phone Finder
• Separation Alert
• Quick Finder
• Worldwide finder Community
• Friendly Places & Temporary Friendly Places
• Valuables mode (Keys/Backpack/Briefcase)
• Vehicles mode (Car/Bicycle/Motorcycle)
• Luggage mode (Main-Bag/Mountain-Bag/Rolling-Bag)
• History of alert notifies and locations

Details and Specifications

  • Specification

    Long range - up to 50 metres (Using Bluetooth Smart)

    Loud alarm (50 dB)

    Green & red LED lights

    Coin battery CR2032 3V.

  • Design

    Good looking design

    High quality plastic parts

    Transparent package to check before purchase

    Durable and flexible key hanger

    Speaker outlet with moldered holes

  • Features

    Easy setup and usage of TRUFob™ via app on iPhone and iPad

    9 tag types designed to define your valuables

    Friendly Places at your convenience

    Use without the need for monthly fees.

  • Carry

    Small compact design

    Only 1,5 inch in diameter with ultra-thin 0,75 inch

    Natural fit in hand and pocket

    Tactile and easy-to-press keys

    Easy attachment to keys or other items


Quick User Guide


Type mode User Guide

Learn about how the "type mode" could be a great advantage in the TRUFob day by day operation. 

Setup Tutorial

If you haven’t had a chance to meet TRUFob and see how it works yet, we encourage you to watch our tutorial.  

Meet us!
Mario Ghersi
CEO
Born and raised in a technologically advanced world, Mario has grown up with a lifelong fascination with technology and a desire to uncover the inner workings of devices. His logical way of looking at the world, has afforded Mario the rare gift of being able to solve even the most complicated of problems. It is this ability, amongst others, that has helped him reach the heights he has today.
With a specific interest in the travel industry, he focuses his energy on finding ways to connect our world through digital, wireless and mobile platform.
LinkedIn profile
Leonardo Paniceres

CTO

Leo’s keen eye for design and beauty has given him an insatiable hunger for the finer things in life. Always on the look out for new, exciting experiences, Leo appreciates all that the world has to offer him and draws inspiration from his surroundings. For Leo, technology is the answer to every problem. His passion for design and mission to develop revolutionary technology have given rise to his catch phrase “There must be an app for this!” Always full of ideas, there is no such thing as a boring meeting when Leo is around.

LinkedIn profile

Ronald Kritzler

Sales Director

After a long discussion about traveling a question came up; why people do not weigh their luggage before heading to the airport? Is not easy to weigh your 45 lbs luggage on your bathroom scale and most of the hotels in the world do not have a bathroom scale. My father had challenged me to come up with a new product, a digital luggage scale that will do a better job than what was out there.

One year and 5 prototypes later we launched in February 27, 2007 at The Travel Goods Show in Vegas, the Balanzza, the first Digital Luggage Scale for Travelers.

LinkedIn profile


The proposal

Our proposal consists on moving a step forward towards TRUFob software development. This is risk free crow funding because the TRUFob devices are now on sale.

  • The MSRP (Manufacturer Suggested Retail Price) of the TRUFob device is US$80 all the perks are very convenient.
  • The funds will be destined to afford the TRUFob device and to further develop the new "selfie version" software.
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, the TRUFob device will be delivered to you all the same.

No more animated GIFs

This was the GIFs for the campaign.

As of June 10, 2014, Indiegogo stopped accepting animated GIFs as a campaign's Summary Image in order to further streamline our site.

Frequently Asked Questions

TRUFob™ is a revolutionary new product that helps you keep an eye on your valuables. Whether that means keeping track of your iPhone®, iPad® or even your loved ones, the unique TRUFob™ features are designed to make your life easier. This page will help you find the answers to the FAQs about the features and functionality of the TRUFob™. If the answer you are looking for is not here, please feel free to contact us for more support.

General

What is TRUFob™?

TRUFob™ is an advanced wireless proximity alarm, which connects to your iPhone® or iPad® using a low power connection. TRUFob™ can also be used to keep track of other valuables like; keys, bags or even your children. Simply attach the device to the item of your choice and TRUFob™ is ready to go.


TRUFob™ is compatible with:

  • iPhone 5
  • iPhone 4S
  • iPad mini
  • iPad (4th gen)
  • iPad (3rd gen)


TRUFob™ is currently not compatible with any other Smartphone devices.

How far is the Alarm distance?

It is about 25 meters to 30 meters. 
Note that the actual distance depends on the surroundings. The human body, buildings, walls and other items all affect the Bluetooth range. Try not to have close body contact with your TRUFob.


I get false alarms. What can I do about it?

False alarms can be caused by several issues: 

Check and ensure your TRUFob is successfully paired with iPhone / iPad. Besides the App shows connected, TRUFob should also be registered and connected in the iOS Settings Bluetooth menu. To recover from an unsuccessful pairing follow the instructions in the video tutorial.

If you get false alarms while being inside a Friendly Place, please try and increase the Friendly Place radius and see if that helps. 

TRUFob has been programmed to cancel the beep notification if it is moved within a Friendly Place and not connected to iPhone / iPad.
 

Why doesn't TRUFob beep when inside a Friendly Place?

TRUFob has been programmed to be silent of beeps notifications if it is moved within a Friendly Place and not connected to iPhone / iPad. 

How do I switch my TRUFob™ on and off?

The TRUFob™ can be switched on and off by holding down the power button for a couple of seconds. When you hear the beep and see the green LED blinking, the TRUFob™ is switched on and ready to be paired with your iPhone® or iPad®. Please ensure you have installed the TRUFob™ app before attempting to pair your iPhone® or iPad® with TRUFob™. If you leave the device without pairing, in about 20 seconds the TRUFob will go off.

How durable is the TRUFob™?

The TRUFob™ is made of high quality, durable materials specifically designed to be used on a daily basis.

What is the maximum range TRUFob™ can reach?

TRUFob™ uses Bluetooth 4.0 technology (also referred to as Bluetooth Smart) to reach a range of up to 40 meters. Please note that certain factors such as metal or concrete walls may reduce the device’s range.

Can I use my TRUFob™ with my iPhone® and iPad®?

Yes, but not at the same time.

Can I connect more than one TRUFob™ to my iPhone® or iPad®?

Yes, you can currently use four TRUFob, with free version and up to 10 devices with TRUFob Pro version. Only one of those devices could be non TRUFob brand at free software version and 10 non TRUFob brand at the Pro version.

Do the batteries of the TRUFob™ need to be replaced?

Yes, TRUFob™ comes with a CR2032 3V. coin battery. To replace it just open the back of the device by turning the cap anticlockwise and use a paper clip to take out the battery. A new battery will last between 4-12 weeks, depending on usage.

Is the TRUFob™ alarm easy to switch off?

Yes, simply press any button of the TRUFob™ and it will automatically switch off.

How do I pair my TRUFob?

Please follow the steps shown in the video tutorial.

Why won’t the app allow me to change the name of the KeyFob at the edit mode?

The edit mode checks if the device is connected and it makes sure you are in range to change the name.

How does the proximity alarm work?

Using Bluetooth technology, TRUFob™ will connect to your iPhone® or iPad®. Once this connection has been established, your iPhone® or iPad® will be able to track your TRUFob™. If your TRUFob™ moves out of range, an alarm will automatically be triggered.

How does a Friendly Place work?

Friendly Place is a feature that prevents your TRUFob™ from triggering the alarm unnecessarily. Perfect for use at home or in the office. 

The TRUFob App creates the Friendly Place using the iPhone / iPad GPS system. When entering the Friendly Place, TRUFob will mute all alarms regardless of the Alarm setting.

TRUFob Friendly Places uses assisted GPS technology, wifi and Geofencing. The Friendly Place feature has been optimized to give a good experience without draining the iPhone / iPad battery. 

Note: To improve accuracy of Friendly Places, Wi-Fi shall be enabled in the iOS Settings Wi-Fi menu.

Can TRUFob™ help me find my children if they are out of my sight?

If your TRUFob is connected, you can use the 'Find Tag' feature to help locate your child, by listening to the alarm sound.

story:
Wheat, Barley & Rye Oh My!


It's more than an Oh My for lots of kids who never get to experience camp due to severe food reactions.  Have you ever tried to stay on a diet for one day? These kids adhere to a strict gluten-free, dairy-free, peanut-free diet for their entire life due to the risk of so many horrible reactions up to and including death.  Not to mention that 1/3 of all kids with Food Allergies are bullied.  It can stop with you!


I am a parent of a Celiac Child, who was diagnosed almost 8 years  ago.  There have been times his experiences have ripped my heart out.  Instead of giving up, I made the decision that sharing education with the community and school was far more important.  Watching people completely alienate him, peers tease him, and hearing kids say things like, "My mother said I can't invite you to my birthday party because we aren't having any thing gluten free for you", only continued to remind me how important it was to educate and assist in the mission to keep our kids safe and allow them to have the same experiences as other kids.   (As you see below, Celiac has not stopped our son from loving many of the same things other boys love!)

                                      

I also helped to co-found Gluten Free Living Now in Indy.  We held our first camp in 2012, but were unable to raise the funding for more camps.  GFLN hosted three annual Gluten Free Expo's in Carmel, but has since been purchased by Living Without Magazine.  The camp was not purchased, so we are still trying to raise private funding for the camp.  

                               

This flag was designed by our Inaugural campers.  It will hopefully fly proudly at the 2015 Camp!  Camp Gluten Freedom held its first and only Gluten Free Allergen Free camp in 2012, but I remain hopeful and steadfast in my commitment and that the community will unite in raising funds to make this camp happen again in the summer of 2015.    For 2015 our business sponsor is a2z Scrapbooking Supplies, who donate funds to the autoimmune community.  

Why send these kids to a separate, dedicated allergen-free camp? 

Have you ever tried to keep a diet even for one day? Were you able to resist and finalize it or you just gave in to the temptation of eating that chocolate? How about not eating chocolate at all for your whole life? How would you live having all the best stuff prohibited because it could be deadly?

Imagine you have to maintain a strict diet all your life because your body says so...because you have a genetic disorder that you cannot correct.  You often feel that no one understands your needs and your behavior and that this disease has many hard and challenging times.  Can you imagine how confusing and frustrating this can be for a child?

There are many children in America who experience these traumas for all their past and future lives living with Celiac disease. They have behavioral issues, neurologic challenges, embarrassing digestive issues, fear & insecurity issues - all resulting from their bodies' rejection of gluten. These children will become adults with special dietary needs, meaning the potential of years of struggling and not fitting in. 

Their special needs mean so much more. It means struggling, fighting temptations, being sick and in the same time staying strong, trying to integrate in the developing modern society and trying to be normal while aware that normal could kill them.

Celiac disease is a genetic disorder affecting children and adults. People with celiac disease are unable to eat foods that contain gluten, which is found in wheat and other grains. In people with celiac disease, gluten sets off an autoimmune reaction that causes the destruction of the villi in the small intestine. People with celiac disease produce antibodies that attack the intestine, causing damage and illness. Nearly 1 out of every 133 Americans suffer from celiac disease, according to a study conducted by the Center for Celiac Research in Massachusetts. 

This campaign is all about these children. We are committed to helping children located in Indiana and the surrounding states by organizing an overnight camp (4 nights/3 days) focused on the gluten-free community bringing education, events, a specific food educational program and a series of fun activities for the children to enjoy while they learn how to stay healthy, develop higher self esteem and learn to deal with some challenging issues. 

We want to give 40 kids the opportunity to experience a different perspective of having special needs. We are preparing a fun-filled "normal" week with peers who have similar dietary issues. The daily program will include team building activities, leadership development, and many activities centered on developing self confidence and dealing with the daily challenges that Celiac Disease and Gluten Intolerance can create. We will ensure three full meals of delicious gluten-free foods, snacks, and all the camp experiences that create lasting memories.

Having the experience of an amazingly successful previous camp in 2012, it was an honor to meet these kids and work through some definite life changing issues. In order to make this possible we need close to $15,000 in order to secure the facility, activity, food and support & instructor costs for this year's edition of the 2015 Camp Gluten Freedom - A Gluten Free Allergen Free Camp for Kids!

       


Testimonials:  Letters from previous session in 2012

 "I learned to explain my special needs and now I feel confident in making new friends who won't laugh at me."                                                           10-year old girl

"It was great to meet other kids just like me. At times it is frustrating and you think you are the only one."                                                               12-year old boy

 "I have never been to camp because my mom was always scared, and so was I, that I'd get sick. This gave me the opportunity to experience camp for the first time."                                                                                             10-year old boy

All supporters will receive a personalized drawing from campers.  Payments over $300 will receive a letter from the camper that was sponsored through this donation.  You will be sent additional tokens of the camper's and my appreciation as well as being listed on the website as a supporter or have a link of your choice listed on the site to direct traffic to you and your organization.

You can have a MAJOR impact on a child's life!

We invite you to take the opportunity to meet these kids and offer them THE EXPERIENCE  of a LIFE TIME!  ALL dollar amounts ($1/$5 and up) of donations are welcome and no donation is too small to help change a life. 

Be a sponsor for a child whose life can be quite challenging based on their dietary needs, help us show them that we are there for them. 

The campers were able to experience many life changing experiences and memories for kids in 2012 and we are so looking forward to being able to do this again at Camp Jameson in Indianapolis.  Our 2012 camp was fortunate to have some amazing sponsors that included:  Schar, Udi's, Glutino, Pamela's, Applegate Farms, Al Fresco, MapleGrove Farms, Nature's Pharm, Endangered Species, Wellaby's, Gluten Free Find and Farm Bureau Insurance.  

Please view the video to see the beautiful facilities:  http://www.jamesoncamp.org/videos/ (Scroll down the right side of the page for all the great videos from youth leaders and the attendees)

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can't contribute financially, doesn't mean we can't use your help

  • Please help us make some noise about this campaign and get the word out!
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
This is Joshua Calcagno. He is 22 and fighting cancer. A few years back he was diagnosed with stage 4. Right now it is getting worse and could get fatal. He finally was able to qualify for surgery. It is in Tennessee and it will help him breath and hopefully help him get stable enough to try doing chemo. The only problem is he doesn't have the money to do it. 

Right now he is employed as a cook but makes only enough to keep him on his feet. He doesn't have much income and has no one to turn to for financial needs. He had a very tough childhood and sometimes had to live on the streets, and to make it harder his mother passed away last year. 

All of this money would be going to the surgery and gas to get him there and a hotel room while he is there. The rest of the money would be much needed help to pay for this chemo he will need once he heals a little bit. This is all scary for him and he cant wait much longer to have this surgery but needs the money to be able to get it done. 

Please help us raise this much needed money for Josh.  He is a good kid, very sweet, caring, and strong guy and doesn't deserve any of this. Its a bad situation and hard to watch him struggle and hurt living day by day not knowing what the next day will bring. This is very serious surgery and the sooner he can get it the better the chances. I appreciate it. If you cant donate just send him a quick prayer/thought.

story: ..

Who knew wheelchairs could be uncomfortable? Someone who lives daily in one, that's who. This is for all the walking friends of Laura, to help her get the working cushions she needs for her wheelchair ride to be as comfortable as she deserves. This is our chance to give back to one of the most beautiful people we know.

Cushions Aren't Forever?

Recently, Laura had a problem with her medical grade cushion on her wheelchair. It is designed to prevent bedsores by providing an air-ride for the countless hours she spends sitting, day after day, as she travels around, visiting with friends and family. Unexpectedly, her cushion developed a small leak. She tried several solutions, all the way to asking the cushion manufacturer for help. Aside from a total cushion replacement, she didn't find a solution, leaving her no choice but to use the wheelchair without an air pad. Most of us wouldnt be bothered by that, because we dont live in a wheelchair. But to Laura, this was a humongous problem, one that could create medical concerns for sitting on such a surface for such a length of time. And on top of that was the cost of replacement.

Laura's insurance does provide a solution for this situation, but not in a timely manner. In fact, Laura has been without the comfort of her cushion for a week and a half so far, with no less than another 7 days before receiving a new cushion. What if one of us had to spend two and a half weeks unable to walk around because our shoes caused bleeding blisters? What if we had to wait such a length of time before we could leave our house and be a part of the world again because our benefit provider was slow to pay?

Well, the good news is we don't need to fix Laura's insurance provider. All we need to do is give back to this wonderful friend who has been a beautiful example of hope, and faith, and love for so many of us. Her enduring devotion to her God and to her friends, has been so grounding and humbling for all of us. If we each donate as we can, we can reach the goal for Laura to be able to buy a cushion on her own, without waiting on the untimeliness of her insurance company. Each cushion ranges from $300-$400. The goal of $1500 would allow her to buy up to 4 in advance, never having to be in this situation again.

We Can Help Our Friend

Two and a half weeks ago, Laura asked her Facebook friends to assist her. "My FB friend, I have a dilema, I got a hole in my Wheelchair cushion and would anybody, know how i can get it repaired without it costing me an arm and leg? HELP PLEASE!!!"

Several people offered suggestions, from WalMart bike tire repair kits, to repair kits from the manufacturer (http://www.therohostore.com/Products/ROHO-Repair-Kit__A5.aspx). She followed all those leads, and had to seek help from her insurance company because of the price of the kit, and a new cushion. Shame on her medical provider for the wait, but shame on us, her friends...because we can fix this!

Laura has been feeling the frustration of being homebound, but with her usual gracefulness, all she posted to her friends on Facebook was: "Pray for me, as I have been in my house for 8 days now, due to a hole in my wheelchair cushion that was not fixable, & I'm waiting on the Base Hospital Doctor to call me & give me approval to get a new Wheelchair cushion, then when that is approved it will probably take another week to get it to the house, so that will be 3wks that I have been in my house, I WANT VISITOR'S PLEASE!!"

We all know Laura. This situation has been way too educational into the issues of healthcare, and the difficulties our friend has experienced with just the issue of a minor leak in her wonderful cushions. Most of us will live our lives never having to face such a limitation, or such a dilemna. We can't give our friend legs to run, but we can help her by making sure she has the most comfortable ride for her journey. $1500 should pay for 4 cushions for her chair, and the 4% cost of this site to make it all happen (http://www.1800wheelchair.com/asp/view-category-products.asp?category_id=821). If you want to give more, please do. The cost of this need caught her by surprise...future finances will help her be prepared. At the least, stop by on her Facebook page and say hello, and tell her you are thinking of her.

If you can't help, please feel free to post this on your facebook page and let others know. Some people are just looking for a chance to stop, and help someone along the way!

story:
HELP KAREN STARKE GET TREATMENT FOR RARE CANCER.   One in 6 million women are diagnosed with  Leiomyosarcoma each year.

Hers is advanced stage and doctors will not operate.  A new drug which costs $6,000 a month and either proton or Cyberknife radiation are her only options.

Even the smallest contribution would help with treatment or travel expenses.

Karen is on disabilty income and has very little insurance coverage.

Increase her chances for more exposure on Indiegogo.com by becoming a team member, "liking" the campaign on facebook or twitter.  Spread the word to your friends.  The more exposure this kind of cancer gets, the better the treatment options will be in the future.  Thank you all for you help so far!

story:
Jada is 48 years old and she loves her pets; 3 dogs and 2 cats. She also enjoys camping and woodworking. She is an outgoing person and enjoys spending time with her friends. Let’s help get Jada back to enjoying life!

My sister in law, Jada, was critically injured in a roll over crash just outside of Reno Nevada on October 6, 2012. She was air lifted to the hospital which is where this long journey begins:

Within the first 24 hours they weren't detecting a pulse in her hand which was badly injured in the crash. They needed to do surgery to save her hand but weren't sure if she would be able to go through the surgery. They deemed the surgery "safe enough" to save her hand and went ahead with the surgery. During that same surgery, the plastic surgeon worked on closing up the wounds to her head.

After surgery, the pressure was rising in her head. The scans didn't show any specific reason why it should be rising, so they put her into a medically induced coma and she is currently still in that state. 

On October 10th they tried to lift her out of the coma state to see how her vitals would react and she did not respond well at all. They immediately stopped that and will try again in a few days.

In the meantime, my brother Mark, remains by her side. He is currently taking time off work to be with Jada, and his work says he can take all the time he needs. But we all know what that means, no work = no money coming in.

I am starting this campaign to help ease some of the burden from my brother. I want him to focus on Jada, her recovery, and himself. There is a very long road ahead of them. According to the neurosurgeon, once she awakens they will know more about what the extent of damage to her brain is. The doctors have said be prepared for her to possibly be asleep for weeks, then extensive recovery in the hospital, then extensive rehabilitation etc.

Please help with our campaign to help offset the cost of the medical bills and day to day bills that will continue to add up as they move forward with Jada's recovery. If you aren't able to give at this time please share this campaign and help us spread the word. We would also please ask that you pray for a full recovery for Jada and pray for strength and comfort for my brother Mark as well.

God Bless!

story:
The above video is a small footage that I took after we've finished the Taraweeh prayer, on my left is the Masjid. Unfortunately, 15 min. later, it was also caught by the fire.

August 4, 2012

Just after the Taraweeh prayer, Masjid Alawi located in Iligan City, Philippines was in the middle of a fire. And I was one of your brothers to immediately help our brothers and sisters who lived just near the Masjid.

The Masjid was gone for good. in sha Allah.

The Masjid where I grew for 20+ years. The Masjid that was put up by our poor brothers and sisters just to have our own Masjid to pray on.

I really felt also what our brothers and sisters felt right on the incident. Specially, our Imam, who lives just at the back of the Masjid. 

I created this fund raising also to help our Muslim brothers and sisters who really bare to put up their own home and now all are gone. May Allah grant them a piece of mind and help them all through out.

Where will your donations go?

I'll be giving this to our Imam to help out our brothers and sisters and ultimately to raise up our Masjid again. In sha Allah.

 

Thank you so much!

Every dua and donations you made are so important to us. Thank you so much.

May Allah give you more blessings, specially in this month of Ramadhan. 

In sha Allah.

story:
Project Protect

The goal of our project is to empower patients, parents, and care-takers with high quality and easy to understand information about antibiotics and infections.  We are doing this with printed material, ebooks, and a smartphone app.  Right now we are raising the funds to create printed materials and an ebook.  Later stages of the project will include developing the smartphone app.

The immediate actions made available through this project will include gathering and summarizing the information most important for patients to have, medical editing of the information, translation into Spanish, Hmong, and Punjabi, printing of materials, creation of an ebook, and distribution of materials to new mothers, elder people, and athletes in our community through daycare centers, senior centers, and sports teams.

The funds that we raise will cover the production and postage for the perks, professional printing of the guide to antibiotics and distribution to seniors, new moms, and sports teams in Merced.  If funds allow, we will also develop an app that people can take with them to the doctors office on a mobile device.   Future plans include creating a Project Protect website, continuing to make youtube videos, sponsoring an art contest to generate good images for antibiotic resistance, a web comic about resistance, a flashmob to promote awareness, and undergraduate research with Mercy Medical Center.

We are doing as much of this as we can with volunteers and freely available resources, but printing in color is expensive, as is professional filming, stock photos, and app development.  There are also miscellaneous website and computer software costs.  Sponsoring an art contest will also have direct costs in the form of prizes and indirect costs associated with website development.

We will accomplish as many of these goals as funds allow.

Flexible funding makes it possible for us to receive any amount of funds raised, even if our goal isn't met.

All perks will be distributed regardless of the amount raised.


Why this project is important

How many people do you know who have become sick from bacteria, or from antibiotics?  The numbers are astounding.  It is a problem for everyone.  Maybe that person is you, maybe a loved one, a family member, a neighbor, a classmate, or a friend.  We all know someone who  has been affected by antibiotic resistance.

Sometimes antibiotics don't work and people are hospitalized or die.

Sometimes antibiotics have dangerous side effects.

Sometimes stomachs hurt badly for a very long time after taking antibiotics.


This project is for people who have become sick from bacteria or from antibiotics, and for the people who love them.


Worldwide statistics

-Antibiotic resistant bacteria kill more people every year than HIV/AIDS. 

-In the United States alone, there are annually at least 120,000 deaths from antibiotic resistant infections that are improperly treated due to a scarcity of reliable antibiotics.  

-There are at least 80,000 limb amputations

-There are 1.7 million multidrug resistant hospital acquired infections that extend hospital stays, increase medical expenses and decrease quality of life. 


People who are the most threatened

People under the age of 3 and over the age of 60, and those who are immunocompromised are the most vulnerable to resistant infections. 

Side effects of antibiotics are also worse in elderly populations.

This project is to help everyone have the information they need to keep themselves and their families safe from resistant bacteria.


Project Protect has three goals

1.  Education- We want to provide members of the community information so that they can obtain the most effective treatments when they need antibiotics.   This is the priority of this campaign.

We are creating a guide to antibiotics and resistance that we want to make available in our community.

We have translators lined up to translate it into Spanish, Hmong, and Punjabi, because those three languages are important to us.

We are going to distribute the guide through senior centers, daycare centers, nursing homes, and clinics.

Because this is a grassroots effort, and so many students are involved, it gives us a unique opportunity to reach people who might not be interested in resistance.  


We have other important missions too, that we would like to address later, or if funding allows, as an after effect of this campaign.

2. Research- Evolutionary biology holds the keys to unlocking solutions for fighting resistant superbugs. Bacteria evolve antibiotic resistance.  We have found a way of reversing evolution.  We need some help to test it out enough to be able to safely use it.

3. Impact- Our local hospital is working with us to show that our method of reversing evolution works. They provide us with resistant strains and pharmacy records so that we can do research in a real clinical environment. We are identifying antibiotics that they can cycle among hospital patients to stop antibiotic resistant superbugs from evolving. The discoveries we make here will most likely apply to hospitals in other cities as well.


How this project can help you

We are providing information to you to keep yourselves and your families safe.

The postcard

On the front there will be beautiful art.  On the back, there will be a list of websites with useful information that you can hang on your fridge, desk, etc for an easy reference.

The T-shirt


The Trading cards

These are prototype examples of the style and content depth the trading cards will contain. 

The guide to antibiotics 

We all need basic information about the antibiotics we take to make sure they are the right treatments. The specific goal of Project Protect is to develop a guide to antibiotic therapies to be distributed as a printed booklet, e-book, and mobile device app that will contain the following:

- How to care for wounds so they don't become infected

- How to care for your immune system so that it can do the fighting for you

- The risks of taking antibiotics

- Different kinds of bacteria and infections

-Different kinds of antibiotics, what infections they treat, side effects of taking them

- Questions to ask the doctor

- Questions to ask the pharmacist

- MRSA, C. difficile and other virulent bacterias

- Strep throat and ear infections

- Sexually transmitted infections

- How to recover after taking antibiotics

Donor

Your name will be acknowledged as a funding source in a scientific publication.  Money comes and goes, but publications last! (By request, donations can be made anonymously.)

Phone call with a scientist

You know when your kids are driving you crazy with questions about why things are the way they are?  Well, maybe they are budding young scientists, because that is what scientists do.  And answers are out there.  Dr. Barlow has had lots of practice answering questions about death, baby birds, sea creatures, respiration, alien life, and just about everything else by her nieces and nephews.  She has also answered questions about nearly everything to college students and other adults.  Ask  questions, or we can update you on antibiotic resistance, or we will just brainstorm together on the spot....  For harder questions,  I will research published literature (up to 2 hrs.), write up an answer for you in every day English, and provide you with that and all the primary literature from which the answer came. 


Writer's workshops

This is a workshop intended for people who want to write about science.  Evolutionary biologists will be able to benefit the most from this workshop but all biologists are welcome.  The dates are not yet set.  As people sign up, I will ask their availability.  And start narrowing the dates down on this site.  This is intended to allow as many individuals to participate as possible.  If you are interested, please email miriam.barlow@gmail.com

Topics I plan to cover are:

-Developing a vocabulary appropriate for your science.

-How to structure a document

-How to begin writing a manuscript, and see the project through to the end.

-How to use scientific figures

-Transitions

-Showing off in subtle ways

This workshop will also cover any additional topics that come up and use attendee writing samples to illustrate points.  This workshop is intended for beginner-intermediate writers.  ESL students are welcome.  You must come with a draft of whatever you are working on.  We will develop those drafts and find ways of overcoming the greatest difficulties in them throughout the workshop.

For workshops physically located in Merced, writing will go on each morning.   In the afternoons, we will explore exciting and beautiful locations that are nearby such as Hornitos, Lake Don Pedro, and Sonora.

Breakfast and lunch will be provided each day.

Why Indiegogo?

-When the US Government committed to spending more money to find a cure for HIV/AIDS, the funds for that research were taken from public health management and infectious disease research and public health monitoring.

-Bioterrorism research took even more money from public health management and antibiotic resistance research. 

-There are very few private funds for public health management and antibiotic resistance research.

Our Sponsors

story:
From the Beginning

This journey started over a year ago when Tammy started seeing a pain specialist because of the chronic severe pain she was having in her legs and lower back.  During this year, they had tested her blood over 8 times and not once did they check her white blood count or anything other than to make sure she wasn't on drugs.

In the middle of June Tammy discovered strange lump in her neck. After consulting with her sister in law while on vacation, who is a certified nurse, she decided she needed to get them checked out. After going back home, it was a couple of weeks before she got in to see the doctor. The doctors started doing tests on July 18 2013. The first set of result came back with her white count being over 20,000 (normal range is between 8,000 and 10,000). They started her on steroids and antibiotics immediately; hoping that is was just an infection. The following week, they tested her white count again and it was over 28,000. At that point they realized it was a much bigger problem than just an infection and starting doing more extensive test (i.e. X-rays, MRI’s, blood, etc.). On July 24th, they did a biopsy on the lymph nodes in her neck and groin. During this time they found something suspicious on her white cells, which they sent in for further tests. Because of the suspicious findings in her white blood cells, the primary doctor sent her to a blood specialist for further testing and diagnosis. On August 16th, Tammy got the results back that she has stage four non-Hodgkin’s lymphoma. She has different strains of the cancer, one is fast moving and the other is slow moving. At this point, they took her straight in to test her bone marrow, which they later found out that because the cancer had spread so quickly her bone marrow was also affected.

Approximately 12 days after the initial diagnosis and many tests later they started her first chemotherapy treatment on August 28th. During the first treatment, she had a severe reaction to rituxan, a part of the chemotherapy treatment. She started having heart palpitations, shortness of breath, and the doctors were expecting her heart to stop.  After they reversed the reaction of the drug she did much better.  Because of her treatments and the severity of the pain, she had to go on leave from her job, being a care taker for Alzheimer patients.  On Monday September 16th, they denied her from getting short term disability because they said she hasn't worked long enough. The only time she has ever taken off of work was so she could raise her children, but because of this they are penalizing her. Her second treatment was  two days later on September 18th, where again she had a reaction to rituxan, which they finally determined she was allergic to and they would have to continue the chemotherapy regimen without it. 

What We Need 

Our goal is to raise enough money to help Tammy and her family with medical and living expenses while they go through this horrific experience.  With you lending a helping hand to this family in need, you will received the gratification and a personalized Thank You from the family to show their appreciation.

The Impact

Living with cancer can be very costly on a single income.  Therefore, raising money for Tammy will go towards:

  • Medical bills
  • Prescriptions
  • Travel Expenses for treatment and appointments

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate financially, thoughts, prayers and words of encouragements are always welcome. If you would like to contribute but would rather not use your credit/debit cards you are more than welcome to mail us your donation:

Tammy McIntosh

C/O: Paul Cuneo

2001 Foothills blvd #B

Grants Pass, OR. 97526

 Thank you for your consideration and contributions.

story:
Mario came to the sad conclusion that people with disabilities still had few opportunities to release their full potential. In particular, they could not move, use their hands, stand up because the wheelchair, something they use every day, squanders their freedom, life quality and relationships with others. 


Standard wheelchairs are of a time when people with disabilities were thought to be unable to work let alone win medals at Olympic Games.  While times have changed -people with disabilities do win gold medals -;  the wheelchair has not. While horse carriages have been replaced by sports cars or motorbikes in less than 100 years, the wheelchair has stayed the same: limited. While some of us have the choice to drive a Jeep, a Corvette or a Harley, others are left with a chair they need to push with their hands. 

This doesn't sound right, does it?

This is why a prototype named "MarioWay" was born: to start a true revolution, create an electricity-propelled, hands-free mobility device so extraordinary that everyone will desire it.

For this, we need your help!

How ? Starting in 2012, we have prepared a business plan, done some calculations on the viability of the project, set-up a Social Entreprise, built 2 prototypes, found top-class suppliers. Now it's your turn: to make this project happen, from the people to the people, with no other intermediaries, we have set up a global-fund raising campaign here. 





   

WHO WE ARE

Mario Vigentini - 'the man of vision' has 20 years experience in working with people with developmental disabilities.

Lorenzo Pompei - 'the first backer' is a social business entrepreneur who has backed up various social and community initiatives.

Massimo Ghidelli, Samuele Reali and Stefano Martinelli from AbnormalCycles - 'the magicians',  are the award winning mechanics and designers behind the MarioWay.

                                                                   

OUR IMPACT: LIVES ARE TRANSFORMED


MarioWay creates autonomy 

MarioWay moves through balancing the upper torso leaving people's hands and arms free to do whatever they like without any assistance: play basketball, shoot a movie, talking over the phone while on the street etc.

Its size allows people to pass through the average doorway on their own making it possible for them to go to places previously inaccessible to them. 

MarioWay transforms relationships

The user is at a standing height, making eye contact or shaking hands simple again. Breaking away from the seating position of traditional wheelchairs, MarioWay improves communication and interpersonal relationships. 

Its mechanical suspensions protect the users from the discomfort of bumps and holes during a ride.

MarioWay provides real physical benefits


Its purpose-built seat and knee rest allow the user to comfortably rest while being out and about in town and at home. MarioWay can also be used to exercise the body.



Neck: reduction of neck pain and migraine that are caused by the muscle tension involved in the traditional wheelchair sitting posture.

Eyes: improved postural comfort can boost attention and efficiency due to a decreased musculoskeletal pain.

Rib cage: an ergonomic posture keeps the breathing pattern regular, improving the cardiovascular system.

Thoracic diaphragm:compression on the diaphragm is drastically reduced, facilitating the digestion process and bowel movements.

Abdomen and gluteal region: effective prevention of back pain. MarioWay allows a natural angle between the hip bones and the femur. It reinforces the core muscles of the back.

Upper limbs: MarioWay prevents tendinitis and brachial neuralgia.

Lower limbs: MarioWay prevents swollen legs, feet and ankle due to a fixed, traditional seated position thanks to the peripheral vascular circulation generated by the MarioWay mechanic up-and-down movement.

Ergonomic sitting position at variable heights: the weight load on the lumbar spine district is almost zeroed.  MarioWay prevents decubitus ulcers; it also prevents osteopenia (that is, below-average bone mineral density).


MarioWay removes stigma 

While there are some stand up wheel chairs in the market, Marioway is unique in that it combines Made in USA technology with Italian mechanics, craftsmanship and sophisticated design. We made it 100% adaptable (adapted to the users' characteristics and tastes), quick, and beautiful. No more chunky metal frames that stigmatize people with disabilities. We wanted to create something that all of us would want to ride. As we were developing MarioWay, we kept asking ourselves: would George Clooney ride this? 

By supporting us, you will be funding more than a revolutionary chair, you will transforms lives, relationships and people. You will help narrow the gap between people in terms of their life quality.



PROTOTYPE TECHNICAL DATA

  • Distance from the ground to the base: 3.35 inches (8.5 cm)
  • Width:  24.8 inches (63 cm)
  • Full-battery travel range: 16 ~ 24.2 miles (26 ~ 39 km)
  • Radius curve: zero.
  • Maximum speed: 12.4 mph (20 kmph).
  • Total weight: 105.8lbs (48kgs) (base, batteries and wheels included) + 57.3lbs (26kgs) (aluminum upper structure, seat and knee rests).
  • User minimum weight: 66lbs (30kgs).
  • User maximum weight: 198.5lbs (90kgs)
  • Total maximum moving mass: 361.5lbs (164kgs) 
                                     

                                                   


WHEELS


The wheels are the result of the best application of technology and craftsmanship developed for exclusive motorcycles. The rim was created with a CNC flow-forming and metal spinning machine.

It is then hardened and shaped inside out with a lathe. This makes it very special because the rim does not have any welds and is thus a perfect circle.

The alloy used is an aluminum alloy grade 6082 that has been strain hardened with thermal treatment T6. The 24 M6 wheel spokes and hub are made of high strength 304 grade stainless steel and are obtained by cold forging.

The external finishing is achieved by black anodizing so there will be not any paint chips, sleek, and it improves its resistance.

All components are made in Italy except for the tyres (Segway original 100/60x14 tube type).


                                                            


CUSTOMIZATION

MarioWay can be customized in different ways. 

Adjustable seat
Its seat height is adjustable in a number of positions between full upright and sitting. center of gravity etc. MarioWay adapts to a wide range of body weights and shapes including the length of the user’s femur and shinbone. 

It can be adapted to lower-limb amputated users.

Have your own MarioWay
Users will be able to have their MarioWay customized to their personal tastes by choosing the color and material of the seat or adding accessories. 


WHAT WE NEED 

We need to raise $140, 000 in order to:

  • make it even better: we want to create Prototype 3.0 in Q1 2014, which will have decubitus preventive material for the seat and knee pads, added comfort and additional safety measures. See the sketch below


  • get the CE certification: we need this to start production (and yes, it is a tedious task but it needs to be done) 
  • obtain international patent: another must if we want to change the lives of people around the world
  • manufacture the first 10 MarioWays to be commercialized (yeah!!!)
  • Observe and learn: we want to carry out a study on 100 potential users to understand their needs and help us improve MarioWay and develop the MarioWay community
  • develop Smartphone Apps for training and fitness programs.


OUR PLEDGE TO OUR SUPPORTERS


Here is what we plan to do with the funding we get, in chronological order.


Step 1: get our house in order i.e. refine MarioWay and get it ready for the market


Our pledge

Funds needed

Get our EC Certification

$  6,500

Complete prototype 3.0 (including insurance)                 

$  32,500

Develop a Smartphone app for users

$  6,500

Acquire Intellectual Property protection 

(International patenting and trademark protection)

$  18,000

Total

$  63,500

Step 2: manufacture MarioWays

Our pledge

Funds needed

Produce 1 MarioWay based on Prototype 3.0                 

$  17,280

Produce 3 MarioWays

 $  51,840

Produce 5 MarioWays

$  86,400


STRETCH GOALS

These will be added as soon as we reach our original funding to provide transparency to our supporters. 



WHAT YOU GET

PRESS

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

  • Economies of scales: we need a minimum orders to start production and keep the business sustainable.
  • Quality, craftsmanship at an affordable price: we need to focus on keeping costs under control and deliver the best possible quality, whilst avoiding relocation to low-cost countries. We think businesses have social responsibility in terms of developing their communities including local suppliers, customers and supporters.
  • Certification: we will need to go through several certification processes (CE, FCC) as well as pre-clearance and registration (think of the FDA in the US) before being able to market MarioWays.
  • Recourse to multiple gyroscopic mobility devices: in our quest for quality, the first choice fell on Segway®;  we can consider similar work on other brands
  • Keep a green, ethical, sustainable, socially-aware business whilst generating stakeholder positive returns

FAQs

What price tag will the MarioWay have? Depending on the level of customization required by the user, we aim at selling standard MarioWays in the region of $16k/$20k. We understand that is quite pricey, but the technology and components used justify this tag. Our goal is to make this device increasingly accessible to more people.

Up to what level of disability can the MW be used? We have so far successfully tested with a T9 user; bearing in mind that this is just prototype 2.1, we aim to raise our goals and progress for disabilities stemming from upper SCIs.

What certifications are you looking for?  To enter in production, we will need to pass industry standard certifications such as CE, TÜV. If used as a medical device, we will seek approval to the relevant authority  for each country.

Trials. With the funds raised, we will dedicate time to clinical trials on a sample of SCI-affected people to observe the use and feed-back from potential users.

When do you plan to have the MarioWay in production? We are looking at Q1 2015

Where can it be found? Our target markets are Europe, Northern America and Australia to start with.

How can I carry a MarioWay around with my car?  There are already ad-hoc elevators for cars available on the market to lift similar weights into the trunk.

Is the MarioWay allowed on public spaces such as roads, sidewalks, malls? Depending on the geography and state, similar two-wheels balanced electric devices are allowed in the majority of public spaces.

Can I buy parts?  It will be possible to purchase separately the upper mechanical part, wheels, knee-rests, handles and seats.

What is the maximum user weight allowed on a MarioWay? We estimate that 90 kgs is the maximum recommended weight. 

WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Thanks for taking some time to check out this project which is the fruit of our guts, dedication and passion for leveling the playing field for all (as well as countless sleepless nights). 

You can support us by funding us but also by spreading our vision by talking about MarioWay (you can use Indiegogo share tools). One word from you to the right people could make our Upright Revolution become a reality.


ITALIAN

VERSIONE ITALIANA


L'IDEA

Marioway e' stato concepito per trasformare le vite. E' un progetto cominciato sotto la guida e visione di Mario Vigentini, un educatore sociale attivo in Lombardia da oltre 20 anni.

Mario e' giunto alla conclusione che le persone con disabilita' hanno ancora molte barriere culturali intorno a loro, oltre che architettoniche. In particolare la carrozzina che utilizzano li costringe a vivere il mondo e le relazioni con gli altri in una prospettiva up/down, dal basso verso l'alto! Questo puo' in alcuni peggiorare la qualita' della vita.

Le carrozine tradizionale appartengono a un altro tempo, in cui a persone con disabilita' non era permesso lavorare, o vincere medaglie olimpioniche. I tempi sono certo cambiati, sono state create le Paraolimpiadi ma questo significa aver raggiunto solo parzialmente l'obiettivo di integrazione sociale: una divisione fra normalità e disabilità. Le carrozze trainate da cavalli sono state sostituite da macchine sportive o motociclette bellissimi nello spazio di 100 anni, le carrozzine sono uguali a se stesse da oltre un secolo.


C'e' qualcosa che non va, giusto?


Per questo e' nato un prototipo dal nome "MarioWay": per cominciare una vera rivoluzione e creare uno strumento di vera integrazione. Un mezzo di locomozione elettrico (partendo da tecnologia esistente) che permette la guida senza mani; uno strumento dal design ricercato al punto da essere desiderato da molti "normodotati"!

Abbiamo bisogno del vostro aiuto!

Come? Cominciando nel 2012, abbiamo creato una Start Up innovativa secondo la normativa italiana (che non permette la distribuzione di utili per 4 anni dalla creazione), costruito due prototipi, trovato una rete di fornitori di qualita' e stilato un progetto di creazione d'impresa. Ora e' il vostro turno: abbiamo organizzato una colletta online molto trasparente per ottenere un prodotto dalla gente per la gente, senza altra intermediazione. Questo per permetterci di andare avanti, condurre studi scientifici, medici e osservazionali sul prototipo 3.0, industriarizzarlo e renderlo disponibile a un massimo numero di utilizzatori.

Anche con un solo dollaro (circa EUR 0.77). Perche' in dollari? La campagna e' ospitata su questo sito molto conosciuto di raccolta fondi per idee imprenditoriali ("crowdfunding"), ed e' un sito americano. I rischi connnessi a una transazione commerciale sono ridottissimi; in caso di timori, potete alternativamente pagare tramite PayPal, il gigante americano leader mondiale di pagamenti online che offre una maggiore sicurezza della carta nella vostra stessa tasca.


In cambio del vostro contributo, avrete diritto a un premio:

$10: una mail di ringraziamento per averci donato un Sorriso;

$45: la partecipazione a un seminario web con il team MarioWay che spieghi il progetto e risponda alle domande di tutti;

$70: una T-shirt con il nostro logo;

$150: una T-shirt e una fibbia in alluminio con il nostro logo;

$300: dai il tuo nome a un MarioWay;

$1 000: ben 5 MarioWay porteranno il tuo nome;

$ 2 200: ruote con mozzo e raggi ricavati dal pieno, adattibili a qualunque SegWay;

$3 000: passa un giorno con noi e prova il MarioWay!;

FRENCH

VERSION FRANCAISE


L’invention du MarioWay ou comment améliorer le

confort d’un porteur de handicap


L'origine

En 2013, une Start Up a été créée à l’initiative de Mario Vigentini, pour faire évoluer le concept de «  fauteuil roulant  », resté quasiment inchangé depuis le XVIIIe siècle.

  

L'invention du MarioWay

 

- L’idée  : augmenter la liberté de mouvement de ceux qui l’ont perdu

- Le moyen  : un engin motorisé étonnamment maniable qui libère le haut du corps et les mains

- La réalisation  : 2 prototypes ont été réalisés et testés par des personnes à mobilité réduite

 

La production du MarioWay en série  

Pour le financement, l’idée retenue est celle d’une collecte de fonds en ligne (crowdfunding), comme souvent aux États-Unis pour financer des projets novateurs à forte composante sociale.

Ainsi de la générosité de chacun dépendra le bien-être de nombre d’hommes et de femmes.

Toutes les contributions à partir de 1 dollar sont acceptées.


Pourquoi en dollars ?

Notre collecteur de fonds est américain, mais il est possible de souscrire aussi via PayPal en toute securité.

Des prix sont prévus en remerciement de chaque participation  :

- 10 $ = un mail de remerciement

- 45 $ = la participation à un séminaire web avec l’équipe MarioWay

- 70 $ = un T-shirt avec le logo de l’entreprise

- 150 $ = un T-shirt et une boucle de ceinture en aluminium avec le logo MarioWay

-300 $ = le nom du donateur à un MarioWay

- 1 000 $  = le nom du donateur à cinq MarioWay

- 2 200 $ = des roues de collection produite en Italie avec le moyeu et les rayons obtenus d'un bloc entier d'alluminium et adaptables à n’importe quel SegWay

-3 000 $  = passer un jour avec l'équipe du MarioWayet pour essayer le MarioWay

- 10 000 $ = passer un week-end avec l’équipe du MarioWay dans une ville d'Italie du Nord
story_txt:
Mario came to the sad conclusion that people with disabilities still had few opportunities to release their full potential.
In particular, they could not move, use their hands, stand up because the
wheelchair, something they use every day, squanders their freedom, life quality
and relationships with others. 
Standard wheelchairs are of a time when people with disabilities were thought
to be unable to work let alone win medals at Olympic Games.  While times
have changed -people with disabilities do win gold medals -;  the
wheelchair has not. While horse carriages have been replaced by sports
cars or motorbikes in less than 100 years, the wheelchair has stayed the same:
limited. While some of us have the choice to drive a Jeep, a Corvette or a
Harley, others are left with a chair they need to push with their hands. 
This doesn't sound
right, does it?This is why a prototype named "MarioWay" was born: to start a true revolution, create an electricity-propelled, hands-free mobility device so extraordinary that everyone will desire it.For this, we need your help!How ? Starting in 2012, we have prepared a business plan, done some calculations on the viability of the project, set-up a Social Entreprise, built 2 prototypes, found top-class suppliers. Now it's your turn: to make this project happen, from the people to the people, with no other intermediaries, we have set up a global-fund raising campaign here. 
   


WHO WE ARE
Mario Vigentini - 'the man of vision' has 20 years experience in working with people with developmental disabilities.
Lorenzo
Pompei - 'the first backer' is a social business entrepreneur who has backed up various social and community initiatives.
Massimo Ghidelli, Samuele Reali and Stefano Martinelli from
AbnormalCycles - 'the magicians',  are the award winning mechanics and designers behind the MarioWay.


                                                                   
OUR IMPACT: LIVES ARE TRANSFORMED





MarioWay creates autonomy 
MarioWay moves through balancing the upper torso leaving people's hands and arms free to do whatever they like without any assistance: play basketball, shoot a movie, talking over the phone while on the street etc.
Its size allows people to pass through the average doorway on their own making it possible for them to go to places previously inaccessible to them. 

MarioWay transforms relationships
The user is at a standing height, making eye contact or shaking hands simple again. Breaking away from the seating position of traditional wheelchairs, MarioWay improves communication and interpersonal relationships. 
Its mechanical suspensions protect the users from the discomfort of bumps and holes during a ride.
MarioWay provides real physical benefitsIts purpose-built seat and knee rest allow the user to comfortably rest while being out and about in town and at home. MarioWay can also be used to exercise the body.







Neck: reduction of neck pain and migraine that are
caused by the muscle tension involved in the traditional wheelchair sitting
posture.
Eyes: improved postural comfort can boost attention and efficiency
due to a decreased musculoskeletal pain.
Rib cage: an ergonomic posture keeps the breathing pattern regular,
improving the cardiovascular system.
Thoracic diaphragm:compression on the diaphragm is drastically
reduced, facilitating the digestion process and bowel movements.
Abdomen and gluteal region: effective prevention of back pain. MarioWay
allows a natural angle between the hip bones and the femur. It reinforces the
core muscles of the back.
Upper limbs: MarioWay prevents tendinitis and brachial neuralgia.
Lower limbs: MarioWay prevents swollen legs, feet and ankle due to a
fixed, traditional seated position thanks to the peripheral vascular
circulation generated by the MarioWay mechanic up-and-down movement.
Ergonomic sitting position at variable heights: the weight load on the lumbar spine district
is almost zeroed.  MarioWay prevents decubitus ulcers; it also prevents
osteopenia (that is, below-average bone mineral density).



MarioWay removes stigma 
While there are some stand up wheel chairs in the market, Marioway is unique in that it combines Made in USA technology with Italian mechanics, craftsmanship and sophisticated design. We made it 100% adaptable (adapted to the users' characteristics and tastes), quick, and beautiful. No more chunky metal frames that stigmatize people with disabilities. We wanted to create something that all of us would want to ride. As we were developing MarioWay, we kept asking ourselves: would George Clooney ride this? 
By supporting us, you will be funding more than a revolutionary chair, you will transforms lives, relationships and people. You will help narrow the gap between people in terms of their life quality.







PROTOTYPE TECHNICAL DATA




Distance from the ground to the base: 3.35 inches (8.5 cm)


Width:  24.8 inches (63 cm)


Full-battery travel range: 16 ~ 24.2 miles (26 ~ 39 km)


Radius curve: zero.


Maximum speed: 12.4 mph (20 kmph).


Total weight: 105.8lbs (48kgs) (base, batteries and wheels included) + 57.3lbs (26kgs) (aluminum upper structure, seat and knee rests).

User minimum weight: 66lbs (30kgs).
User maximum weight: 198.5lbs (90kgs)

Total maximum moving mass: 361.5lbs (164kgs) 


                                                                                        


WHEELS




The wheels are the result of the best application of technology and craftsmanship developed for exclusive motorcycles. The rim was created with a CNC
flow-forming and metal spinning machine. 
It is then hardened and shaped
inside out with a lathe. This makes it very special because the rim does not have
any welds and is thus a perfect circle.
The alloy used is an aluminum
alloy grade 6082 that has been strain hardened with thermal treatment T6. The 24
M6 wheel spokes and hub are made of high strength 304 grade stainless steel and are
obtained by cold forging. 
The external finishing is
achieved by black anodizing so there will be not any paint chips, sleek, and it
improves its resistance.
All components are made in
Italy except for the tyres (Segway original 100/60x14 tube type).




                                                            



CUSTOMIZATION


MarioWay can be customized in different ways. 

Adjustable seatIts seat height is adjustable in a number of positions between full upright and sitting. center of gravity etc. MarioWay adapts to a wide range of body weights and shapes including the length of the user’s femur and shinbone. It can be adapted to lower-limb amputated users.

Have your own MarioWayUsers will be able to have their MarioWay customized to their personal tastes by choosing the color and material of the seat or adding accessories. 

WHAT WE NEED 


We need to raise $140, 000 in order to:

make it even better: we want to create Prototype 3.0 in Q1 2014, which will have decubitus preventive material for the seat and knee pads, added comfort and additional safety measures. See the sketch below




get the CE certification: we need this to start production (and yes, it is a tedious task but it needs to be done) 
obtain international patent: another must if we want to change the lives of people around the world
manufacture the first 10 MarioWays to be commercialized (yeah!!!)
Observe and learn: we want to carry out a study on 100 potential users to understand their needs and help us improve MarioWay and develop the MarioWay community
develop Smartphone Apps for training and fitness programs.

Here is what we plan to do with the funding we get, in chronological order.

Step 1: get our house in order i.e. refine MarioWay and get it ready for the market

story:
From 2001-2005 the United Wrestling Alliance (UWA) dominated the controversial and often misunderstood world of backyard wrestling. By bringing a professional attitude to it's shows and matches, the UWA set a new standard for not just backyard wrestling, but wrestling in general.

 

In the 6 years since UWA's last show, its alumni have gone on to achieve stardom in virtually every professional company in NY & NJ. The UWA roster has captured over 100 professional titles and have appeared on WWE & TNA television. They have gone overseas and competed in wrestling meccas including Mexico, Japan, & Germany.

 

Last Year, the promotion's founder and creator, David Swan reopened the doors of the UWA combining many of the original stars with some of the best up and coming talent from the Tri-State area, As "UWA Elite" the United Wrestling Alliance has burst onto the internet, bigger and better than before. With two weekly shows "UWA Allstarz" and "UWA Action Zone", UWA Elite delivers more than two hours of original content each week.

 

UWA Elite continues to grow and evolve, the 2012 UWA season will kick off on March 31st with a spectacular live event at the Historic Darress Theater in Boonton, NJ. This year, the UWA plans to expand it's company even more with live event all over the Tri-State Area and the opening of a kid friendly professional wrestling school that will allow students of all ages to be taught by a faculty with over 100 combined years in the Professional Wrestling Industry.

 

Now is your opportunity to help the UWA grow and thrive. With your donation you'll be helping make a dream a reality and help it reach young up and coming sports entertainers for years to come. All donations will be going directly to the down payment and rent for the upcoming UWA Elite Wrestling School. Thank you for your consideration and donations.

Last Year, the promotion's founder and creator, David Swan reopened the doors of the UWA combining many of the original stars with some of the best up and coming talent from the Tri-State area, As "UWA Elite" the United Wrestling Alliance has burst onto the internet, bigger and better than before. With two weekly shows "UWA Allstarz" and "UWA Action Zone", UWA Elite delivers more than two hours of original content each week. 
 
UWA Elite continues to grow and evolve, the 2012 UWA season will kick off on March 31st with a spectacular live event at the Historic Darress Theater in Boonton, NJ. This year, the UWA plans to expand it's company even more with live event all over the Tri-State Area and the opening of a kid friendly professional wrestling school that will allow students of all ages to be taught by a faculty with over 100 combined years in the Professional Wrestling Industry. 
 
Now is your opportunity to help the UWA grow and thrive. With your donation you'll be helping make a dream a reality and help it reach young up and coming sports entertainers for years to come. All donations will be going directly to the down payment and rent for the upcoming UWA Elite Wrestling School. Thank you for your consideration and donations.

story:
God Put a Smile Upon My Face

Thank you for taking the time to visit my Indiegogo page that I have established for the purpose of raising money to pay for reconstructive dental work.  This was a difficult decision for me to create this campaign.  I am not in the habit of asking for help and I can see the other campaigns on this site are for people who need new organs or are fighting cancer.  Not to mention the fact that it is rather embarrassing to let people see what I look like in “real life” without my teeth.  It was only after much prayer and meditation that I felt Spirit move me to be brave enough to let people know I needed help.

This campaign was set up for me to raise the funds needed to have a non-metallic, organic materials bridge permanently fixed to my remaining teeth by my dentist here in Berlin.  Since arriving to Germany, my “source” of income was unexpectedly cut-off.  (The quotations are there to remind myself that God is my Source.  My income was a severance package that I had been receiving from my former employer in bi-weekly installments.  Unbenounced to me, being abroad disqualified me from future payments.)

For the past several years, I have been wearing a temporary, partial denture in my mouth to hide the fact that I am missing my front teeth.  Even with the insurances from past employers, I’ve never been able to afford getting my teeth permanently repaired.  The reason I have chosen now to get the work is because I ran across a wonderful dentist in Berlin who can actually complete the bridgework without using harmful metals in my mouth and he is has a spiritual approach to dentistry.

I need $7,000 because the procedure, along with removing my metal fillings and general cleaning, costs approximately €5,000 (Euros) and this accounts for the lower value of the American Dollar.

With your help, I will for the first time in over 30 years be able to have a healthy, beautiful smile.  I call this campaign “God Put a Smile Upon My Face”.  This is not because of the prospect of getting new teeth, but because in spite of having poor teeth, God has always put a smile on my face.  In fact, I smile almost all the time.  Once in New York someone asked me why I smile all the time.  I simply replied, “Because I can.”

 

How I Lost My Teeth

During the winter of ‘79 I was 10 years old, in the 5th grade, and gearing up for the break over the holidays.  On the last day of school we had to play kickball indoors.  When I was up to kick, I lined a single between 2nd and 3rd base.  Being the competitor that I am, I decided to slide headlong into first base.  By the way, this is a bad idea on a hardwood floor in a gymnasium.  My head bounced off the court face first with a bone-chilling CRUNCH!!  Through my daze, I looked down to see four large pieces of tooth matter on the floor.  My two front teeth had broken completely out of my skull and were each broken in half.  I went into shock as the blood started to flow freely form my bewildered face.  On the way to the nurse’s office, I remember Junior Saul gawking at me; pointing, and yelling, “Cool man!  Gene Simmons!!”  Gene Simmons, as some of you know, is the lead singer of KiSS who used to spit blood during their performances.  Remember, this was 1979! 

Since then, my smile has been such a source of pain and embarrassment for me.  Even though my partial temporary “flipper” worked fairly well cosmetically, It being in my mouth for 16 years is causing my other teeth to decay prematurely.

 
 
Thank You

Anything you can spare to give is greatly appreciated.  I have faith that there is a way for me to pay for this dental procedure.  I thank you from the bottom of my heart for understanding how difficult it is for me to even put myself “out there” like this.  God bless and Namaste. 

 

Additional Video Footage of Me Before My First Dental Appointment.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4xe1Yt_gqf4

story:
My aim of this fundraiser is to raise money through charitable donations so that I have the opportunity to take part in an upcoming 20 week Pre and Post-natal Doula/Birth Attendant Training here in Melbourne, Australia.

The course is an accredited Cert4 qualification through the Australian Doula College and at the end of the 20wk course I would be a qualified Doula/Birth attendant and able to support mothers with pre natal pregnancy and birth support and care and also post natal care in the first 2 weeks after birth. This course is the highest accreditation for doulas in Australia and comes highly recommended.

The word Doula is an ancient Greek word meaning 'womans helper', and a Doula's role is to support the mother emotionally and physically through the pains and fears of childbirth, whilst also having a wide knowledge of different supportive birth positions and massages. Up until 100 years ago when birth became clinical and hospitalised in very male environments, majority of all birthing mothers would have been surrounded by female members of her family and community offering their support and wisdom before, during and after birth. There has been a lot of research that has shown that births are calmer, more positive and happier experiences when the woman is supported emotionally and physically by a female birthing partner/attendant.

When I was 12 I witnessed my mother labour at home with my beautiful sister Mialani. She was attended by two independent midwives, and birthed my sister at home in my parents bed. When I was 16 and 20 I witnessed the full labour and birth of my two youngest sisters Freya and Miyuki, both home births with independent midwives and both water births. Experiencing 3 births before I hit 21 I was amazed by the miracle of birth and how empowering this experience can be for women when they are in a relaxed and supportive environment. Since then I have got more and more intruiged by the mysteries and magic of birth and pregnancy, researching stories of people's different labour experiences, the different possibilities available to women during birth in the 21st century, and found out so much information about the importance of a empowering birth experience for women in the bonding with their child but also in how they relate with themselves and their own bodies.

Over the last couple of years I have been hearing more and more about Doula's and have even had some close friends complete their training and become active Birth Attendants. Becoming a Doula to me is an opportunity to learn and experience the magic of birth and nature in a whole new way. It is also an amazing opportunity to support women and their partners in the most phenominal way, and help empower people to see what they are capable of and how incredible humans are. I can see clearly that I would make a fantastic Doula and that I have such a drive to support people in this way.

I have done a lot of reseach into the best courses and have come across a fantastic 20wk course in my home town of Melbourne, Australia which comes highly recommended and is the highest accreditation for Doulas in Australia. At the end of the 20 weeks I would hold a Certificate IV in Doula Support Services which would cover me to work as a Pregnancy, Birth and Post Natal Doula. The course is held twice yearly and costs a wopping $5000. I would LOVE to be able to take part in this course and if any one would like to support me in making this a reality then please feel free to contribute through my IndieGoGo Campaign Fundraiser that I am currently setting up! (I will link as soon as it is complete). I am looking to raise $6500 which will cover the costs of the course as well as allow me some financial support to help cover some of the days that I will not be able to work in my usual job as a Nanny/Childcarer. All proceeds will be very well spent, and I cant thankyou enough for reading this.

 

Rebekah

story:
First of all some about me. I am a 25 year old mother of two, an 18 month old and an 8 week old. My first pregnancy I had no major complications and everything went smoothly. However, my second, I was not so fortunate. I had complications during the last 2 months of my pregnancy. My son was born 6 weeks early and now suffers from heart and lung problems. He is on a monitor that runs about 348 dollars a month not including the 'leads' (the things that stick to his skin, that he constantly ripping off) and they cost 60 dollars per pack. He also has to see a pediatric cardiologist and a pediatric pulmonologist, again, no insurance. To make matters worse, I went to my six week check up to go back to work full time and was given some devastating news. While she was examining me she noticed my neck/throat looked swollen. She felt around and said that it was my thyroid as well as my lymph nodes. After some blood work she determined that I needed to go see an oncologist and have some biopsies done. Bottom line there is a 95 percent chance that I have cancer. 

Although I am facing my own medical problems, I must put my child first and I must deal with his. All my life I have wanted nothing more than to be a good mother and give my kids nothing but the best. How? I have no family to turn to and no one else to ask for help. 

Not only has it been my dream to give my kids all I could and everything that I never had, I always wanted to help other people. Now I just have this feeling like I can't even help myself or my sons with all of the medical bills mounting.

There are people who ask for money because they are 'broke', I mean in this economy who isn't. Truthfully though, we see campaigns every day for things like advancing technology, etc and people all over the word are donating thousands, if not millions for technology among other things. All I am asking is for a little bit of help and I pray to God that there are still some genuinely nice people out there! I sit here in tears and beg you to help so I don't have to leave this world with piles of medical bills and my sons not being taken care of. I appreciate the time you have taken to read my story. Every little bit helps!
