story:
Turning the tide...

People going online to explore the health benefits of marijuana will often stop short because they feel uneasy.  They give up too soon because they're constantly bombarded with confusing lingo and inappropriate material.  Sadly, this deters many people from a health resource that could greatly improve their quality of life.   

Hopegrown.org is a website built for the people who need it the most -- people battling a chronic illness who have run out of options, professionals who are concerned about their privacy and older patients who have difficulty navigating the internet.  These are the kinds of people who go online to find answers to simple questions and deserve to do so without being made to feel like a criminal. 

At Hopegrown.org, patients can find a doctor or marijuana provider near them they can trust. Hopegrown’s standards of being Safe, Clean, Welcoming & Knowledgable ensure that the businesses listed on our network are the kinds of places....well, you’d send your mom to.  

It started with a ripple...

Hopegrown began in the living rooms of Pete and Peter, buddies and neighbors at a small apartment complex near Universal Studios.  When they first met, the two friends were both new to medical marijuana and they would often trade stories about their experiences as first-time patients.  They discovered that they were often encountering the same problems and asking the same kinds of questions. Like, why is going online to find a legal marijuana resource so unsettling?  Is no one out there developing standards to separate the good guys from the bad?

When Pete and Peter started asking some of these questions out loud, they found that a lot of other people were asking them too.  For Pete and Peter, one thing was clear: the status quo wasn't working.  It was time for a change.  It was time to start Hopegrown.

Hopegrown grew quickly as Pete & Peter didn't have to work hard to convince their wives, some friends and family, some lawyers, some doctors, some teachers, some activists and few complete strangers that this idea was worth investing time and money into. 

The next two years were then spent doing research, building the perfect team and setting up a sound infrastructure.  Meanwhile, the two buds were traveling up and down California and meeting with patients and industry professionals so that they could develop the most complete and easy-to-use website possible. All of this while barely holding down their day jobs.

Making waves...

We are so close to the finish line and we're confident we can cross it with your help.  Your generous donation will help us to afford things like cameras and editing equipment for our how-to videos, travel and payroll expenses for our street teams, marketing and curriculum materials for training and publicity ... and much, much more.

Once we launch, Hopegrown will be able to sustain its operations from the monthly subscriptions of the businesses that make up our Hopegrown Network.

If money is tight for you, like we know it is for so many, you can still make a difference by sharing us with your family and friends.  Pass the video on.  Like us on Facebook.  Follow us on Twitter.  Spread the word! 

By supporting Hopegrown, you’re not just helping a small company get its feet off the ground, you’re giving momentum to a movement.  You’re bringing to life a website that will make a huge impact on the lives of thousands of people who are out of options and desperate for relief.  Thank you for your time and consideration.  We look forward to serving you and your community...

The Hopegrown Team 

A special thanks to our interviewees Charles Keenan and Susan Proffitt-Wattles of 

Nichols Canyon Co-Op (http://nicholscanyonco-op.com/).

 

 

The Hopegrown Support Bracelet in green, orange and yellow.

 

 

The Hopegrown Tri-colored Highlighter.

Our Hopegrown Foldable Vase with one of three different Sunflower Seed Packets.

  

 Hopegrown 3-piece Spatula Set for all your cooking needs. 

 

 

Our official "Better Health. Better Living." campaign T-shirt.  

The Hopegrown Pins are here! Receive one of four colored pins.  

 

If you liked our short video please share it with a friend.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Hi, my name is Devyn Whittle. I am eighteen years old. I live in the great state of Washington and I am a senior in high school. Since I was in fourth grade I have been bullied and teased about my weight. In eighth grade is when this got very bad, and dealt with depression.  Things were better for a while, then last year, my best friend was murdered.  Although it's been really hard to deal with, I decided the best way to honor my friends memory was to make a change in my life.
  • This champain is to kick off my weight loss by going to a camp.
  • With your help, I will not only begin the road to a healthy weight, but I will then be able to teach other's who like me, are young an dealing with issues regarding their weight.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • My mother has paid the deposit, and my place is camp is secured.  The money raised will go directly to pay the remaining balance for 8 weeks of camp, $10,000
  • When I return from camp, I plan to use my connection with the local YMCA to help other young people to learn to exercise and meet their personal weight loss goals!
  • If I don't reach the final goal, I will use whatever money is raised to go to camp, even if it is for a shorter period of time.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to this then please spread the word to your friends. Everything helps.

story:
Hey guys, this fundraiser is for our friend Dante Cassius, who works for a San Francisco nonprofit. He's raised over $300,000 for humanitarian and environmental causes, but now needs assistance himself as he's severely ill and can barely function. 

Many of us have helped him out ourselves financially as much as we can afford, but now it's time to reach out to the larger community. 

He's currently unable to work due to his illness, and his family cannot help him much as they're poor themselves. 

Free clinics in San Francisco have told Dante he needs to see a neurologist, but the soonest available appointment is in March. And he's been to the emergency room several times, but they only are able to treat those whose situations are immediately life-threatening (i.e. heart attacks, gunshot wounds). 

Dante's one of the most driven, determined, energetic people we know and he's only in his mid twenties, so this is very unusual for him. 

 

What We Need and What You Get

We're looking for resources to help pay Dante's bills (phone, food etc) while he's waiting for a diagnosis, getting treatment and recuperating. Also for him to get a proper diagnosis as soon as possible. He would most likely qualify for Medicare so we're looking into the procedures for that also. 

Any and all cash raised will go directly to help him - and we'll let you know more specifics of how much this is going to cost when we know them. 

Many of us work in the publicity, communications and nonprofit fields - so we're offering our services in exchange for contributions. I'm personally a literary publicist and have worked as a science/tech and a human interest journalist. So I will write and edit resumes and cover letters, create press releases, write and edit any documents, and/or solicit blog reviews and publicity for your book, film, music, etc. 

By the way guys, just for fun - back in the day I was an uber-fan of House M.D. and I wrote a set of fanfic pieces where he moves to the West Coast, works at SF General and ends up dating a tough but smart working class girl from the East Bay. Funny but with some mature themes, just a warning for all concerned. Will send to anyone for a $25-$35 donation to Dante ;)

Charles Ayres also offers translation services as follows: 

Your Name in Japanese! 

$25- A published Japanese translator and Columbia University graduate will write your name in Japanese for $25. You will receive your name via Word file and it will show two possible ways to write your name in Japanese. Turnover time is 2 days from receipt of name! Arigatou!

Here is skill #2:

Will translate a short word or phrase from English into Japanese for you. You can use it as a mantra or tattoo. Turnover is 2 days after receipt of donation and phrase. Translator is Columbia University grad and published translator.

Cost: $10

Maybe say it will be in Japanese characters in a word file. The pronunciation of the characters will be included.

All money raised will go to help Dante pay bills while he's too sick to work. And the suggested donations we're asking for our services are actually good deals considering what you'd pay going to a professional PR agency. 

The Impact

This fundraiser will help Dante get back on his feet and healthy again so he can continue to offer his many gifts to the world. Also - it's a chance for us to network and develop our professional skills by assisting with your professional projects! 

A positive attitude may not solve all your problems, but it will annoy enough people to make it worth the effort.
-- Herm Albright

Mountains cannot be surmounted except by winding paths.

-- Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe

 We grow because we struggle, we learn and overcome.
-- R. C. Allen

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word about our campaign! Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, and IndieGoGo's share tools will all help spread the word.
story_txt:
Hey guys, this fundraiser is for our friend Dante Cassius, who works for a San Francisco nonprofit. He's raised over $300,000 for humanitarian and environmental causes, but now needs assistance himself as he's severely ill and can barely function. 
Many of us have helped him out ourselves financially as much as we can afford, but now it's time to reach out to the larger community. 
He's currently unable to work due to his illness, and his family cannot help him much as they're poor themselves. 
Free clinics in San Francisco have told Dante he needs to see a neurologist, but the soonest available appointment is in March. And he's been to the emergency room several times, but they only are able to treat those whose situations are immediately life-threatening (i.e. heart attacks, gunshot wounds). 
Dante's one of the most driven, determined, energetic people we know and he's only in his mid twenties, so this is very unusual for him. 
 


What We Need and What You Get
We're looking for resources to help pay Dante's bills (phone, food etc) while he's waiting for a diagnosis, getting treatment and recuperating. Also for him to get a proper diagnosis as soon as possible. He would most likely qualify for Medicare so we're looking into the procedures for that also. 
Any and all cash raised will go directly to help him - and we'll let you know more specifics of how much this is going to cost when we know them. 
Many of us work in the publicity, communications and nonprofit fields - so we're offering our services in exchange for contributions. I'm personally a literary publicist and have worked as a science/tech and a human interest journalist. So I will write and edit resumes and cover letters, create press releases, write and edit any documents, and/or solicit blog reviews and publicity for your book, film, music, etc. 
By the way guys, just for fun - back in the day I was an uber-fan of House M.D. and I wrote a set of fanfic pieces where he moves to the West Coast, works at SF General and ends up dating a tough but smart working class girl from the East Bay. story:
Control Your Dreams! Live Your Fantasies! Go On Nightly Adventures......with iCeption!

The iCeption Lucid Dream Controller not only lets your mind know you are dreaming while you sleep, causing lucidity, but also plays soft, personalized messages or dream scenarios the user creates to guide and influence the destination of the dream.

We wanted to find a way to not only let the dreamer know they are dreaming, but also take command of their dreams.  So many times, lucidity can be reached, but the subconscious mind can often control and manipulate the dream.  iCeption was created to guide or point the dream in the direction the user wants it to go.

First of all, these messages and dream scenarios had to be quite, so to NEVER disturb the sleeper.  In fact, without absolute silence, it is almost impossible to hear the iCeption dream scenarios, insuring the dreamer is never woken. What makes iCeption customizable and personalized, is that the dream scenarios are created by the user, by choosing a background setting (the location of the dream), and typing into the app what the characters in the dream will say. The artificial voices generated by iCeption speak word-for-word what the user types into the app.  

With a huge library of background settings, and the user with the ability to choose the voices, sex, and accents of the characters and what they say in your dream, there are LIMITLESS dream possibilities. You can guide your dream in any direction you desire. TAKE COMMAND OF YOUR DREAMS!

If you have ever fallen asleep with the television on and whatever was on made its way into your dream, it's the same concept, except that the dream scenarios are personalized where even the characters can call you by name.

The Sleep Cycle Alarm also is the FIRST ALARM EVER to not only wake you outside of REM Sleep more refreshed and energized, but to a soothing message that the user creates. Choose a calming background setting and type into the app your morning greeting.  The realistic artificial voices wake you gradually and peacefully, outside of REM Sleep, to an uplifting and encouraging message.

Also the Positive Affirmation feature allows users to listen to uplifting and encouraging messages, created by the user, calling them by name and addressing their specific issues and goals.  Everyone struggles sometimes.  Positive affirmations can offer a boost of confidence, increase self-esteem, give encouragement to overcome addictions and achieve goals, and even change mentalities and habits. iCeption gives the user the ability to hear, what they need to hear, to better their life.

For more information, see our websites and information below, as well as tutorials and feature videos. 

Also visit us at Facebook at www.facebook.com/Iception

Visit our website at www.iceptionsleep.com

LUCID DREAMING CONTROLLER:

What would it be like to fly every night? Or be stranded on an island paradise? What is you could be rich and famous, or go on a pirate treasure hunt, or travel to the moon. You can when you learn how to LUCID DREAM! iCeption can help!

Watch this quick video on how to use the iCeption Lucid Dream Control Feature........

https://vimeo.com/47346049

Dreams have always fascinated us. They are still a mystery to scientists and everyday people alike. Lucid dreaming can be so realistic and influential, that it can change habits, attitudes, and perception. Much like the movie Inception, an idea, thought, or scenario planted deep into the subconscious mind is powerful. In our search to find a product that could actually command our dreams, we found some products which are able to track sleeping patterns and let you know you have reached lucidity, but nothing that will help you take control of your dreams. That is when the idea for iCeption was born.

iCeption works like this. By downloading the iCeption App for your iPhone, iPad, iPod, or Android Device, and placing the device on your bed, or in the iCeption Dream Pillow at night, iCeption will track your vibrations and movements while you sleep, to determine your sleep cycles and when you reach REM Sleep, which is your highest chance of lucid dreaming. The iCeption Dream Pillow keeps your device secure, keeping your device from falling off the bed or sliding underneath the sleeper.

How does tracking the movements you make at night enable iCeption to determine your sleep cycles and moments of REM Sleep?

First off, REM Sleep stands for Rapid Eye Movement. Your brain experiences heightened activity during this time. Some studies have shown that the mind is actually more acceptable to information and capable of learning during REM Sleep than in conscious hours. These are also your hours of most intense and realistic DREAMING!

It is during this stage of REM Sleep that the brain releases a chemical, which makes it difficult to impossible to move your body. This is a nice and even essential safety feature the body has put into place. If not for that chemical, it would be possible for our bodies to act out our dreams in our sleep. That could be very embarrassing and definitely dangerous.

It is by sensing these stages of movement and non-movement that iCeption determines your sleep cycles, through tracking even the slightest movements and vibrations in the bed. When your body becomes motionless for a certain amount of time, you are most likely in REM Sleep. The iCeption technology follows documented sleep cycles and will activate not in your early hours of sleep, but your deepest hours of REM sleep.

HOW CAN I CONTROL MY DREAMS?

By placing your device on your bed, or in the iCeption Dream Pillow, iCeption will track your movements, and when you reach REM Sleep, iCeption will activate your phone’s speakers or wireless earphones. Then, iCeption will play a soft but distinct tune called a DREAMTONE to let your mind know you are dreaming. The user trains his or her mind to recognize this repeated tune to indicate they are in the dream state. This is when your dream becomes lucid. Then the magic begins.

iCeption will play soft messages to you while you dream….but no prerecorded messages. YOU program exactly what you want iCeption to tell you in your sleep...word for word. Choose a background setting like a quiet forest, gentle stream, or sounds of the office or city street. This background setting is the location of your dream scenario. Then you choose the characters in your dream, their sex and accents, and then type what you want them to say. Even have the characters call you by your name to make the experience truly REAL and more authentic. It's like performing a theatrical play for your mind while you sleep. The sound levels are so low, so to not wake the dreamer, and the computer generated voices are the highest quality and extremely.

We want to make sure your dreams scenarios seem absolutely REAL! For that reason we use the highest quality voice software and background settings.  Watch this video to hear a sample of the high quality Text-to-Speech Software and background settings.....

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=soULMqHUcWw&feature=g-upl

If you have ever fallen asleep with the television on, and whatever was going on on the TV somehow trickled into your dream, it is the same concept, but with much, much softer and calming messages, activated while you are deep in REM Sleep so to not wake you up.

For a closer look at the App Navigation, please visit http://www.iceptionsleep.com/site/navPreview

SLEEP CYCLE ALARM:

Introducing the iCeption Sleep Cycle Alarm, which is the first alarm not only to wake you outside of your REM Sleep Cycle, waking you more refreshed and energized, but the only alarm to wake you with a personalized and calming message YOU create!

Watch this video on the Sleep Cycle Alarm Feature....

http://vimeo.com/47346120

This is exciting.  Waking up is the hardest thing for me.  I love my sleep.  With iCeption, the experience is a lot more bearable.  Studies have shown that when we are woken outside the REM Sleep Cycle instead of during REM Sleep, we wake much more alert and refreshed. Just think about how that could change your life....waking up....more awake.  Here is what your sleep cycles look like......

 

 

The greatest feature about the Sleep Cycle Alarm is that not only will you wake more refreshed, but iCeption is the FIRST and ONLY alarm that will wake you up to a soothing and personalized message that YOU create.  Imagine waking to the soft sounds of a beach and hearing a realistic and confident voice calling you by name and saying.....

"Good Morning.  Today is Monday.  Today is YOUR day.  You are in complete control of your destiny.  You are going to be positive today.  You are going to be happy and content.  You are going to accomplish everything you need to without stress or aggravation.  Today is YOUR day."

WHAT A DIFFERENCE!  How much better will your day go if you woke up to something like that?  No more blaring alarms designed to startle and upset you.  What a horrible way to start the day.

Maybe you would like to learn a new quote or bible passage every morning.  Anything uplifting and inspirational will do.  You just type into the app what you want to wake up to.  We LOVE this feature.  If you are not into Lucid Dreaming or Positive Affirmations, get iCeption just for this purpose.  You will LOVE it too:)

For a closer look at the App Navigation, please visit http://www.iceptionsleep.com/site/navPreview

POSITIVE AFFIRMATIONS:

Life is tough.  We all need a little encouragement every now and then. Usually now more than then. 

We always let our conscious life effect the way we sleep.  How many sleepless nights have been spent worrying about the future or the upcoming day?

WHY NOT LET OUR UNCONSCIOUS LIFE AFFECT OUR CONSCIOUS LIFE? Watch this video on the iCeption Positive Affirmations Feature.....

http://vimeo.com/47346157

iCeption can send you positive and personalized messages that you create, tailored to your needs and issues.  Say you are trying to lose weight. Imagine listening to this message over and over before you sleep, during your dreams, or when you need a little boost of encouragement.....

"You are strong and in control of your body.  Nothing tastes as good as skinny feels.  You are going to lose weight and feel better.  You are going to look better and be healthier.  You are going to resist the foods that will get in the way of your goals. You can do it."

Especially in positive affirmations, make sure to have the app call you by your name.  The message is more personalized and rings more true to the listener. If you have ever paid more attention to a parent when they call you by your full name instead of just your first name, you know that it carried and still may carry a lot more weight.

This feature of the app really creates positive mentalities and gives the user the ability to constantly be uplifting and encouraging themselves.  If you are a believer that your attitude and perception on life can actually effect the outcome of your life, you need this feature!

For a closer look at the App Navigation, please visit http://www.iceptionsleep.com/site/navPreview

Here is a little tutorial on all of the iCeption Features, including information on Lucid Dreaming, REM Sleep, and how to control and guide your dreams....

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nHd-Yjy44Uc&feature=player_embedded

REWARD LEVELS

story:
The Goal of TK2013

There are now 110 pupils at Shine Academy, a small school in Kibera Slum, Kenya, run by the Impoverished Children NGO. The goal of TK2013 is simple:

  • Raise $4400 to provide breakfast for all these 110 students for one year.
  • Raise $110 to provide deworming medication and education for all pupils for one year. Intestinal worms steal precious nutrients from their hosts. Deworming is one of the most cost-effective public health interventions available.
  • Deliver health education on the topics of prenatal care, pregnancy, and children's health for families whose children attend the school.
  • Complete repeat medical and nutritional assessments for the school’s 75 older pupils as well as the members of the school’s newest and youngest class. I will be returning to Nairobi in October and will update medical charts started for every child and stored in a locked area of the school during my visit last year.

What is Tikkun Kibera?

My name is Esther Johnston. I am a family physician and a public health practitioner, and I started the Tikkun Kibera campaign to provide funding support, medical assistance and health education at Shine Academy.

Last year the first round of our fundraising collected over $3200 to support the children of Shine. I could tell you and over and over how grateful I am, but here is what you achieved:

  • Breakfast for a year for over 75 students, many of whom have no regular access to meals outside of those provided though the school.
  • Deworming of all of the school’s pupils. It doesn't take more than $1 per year to provide a critical medical treatment in an impoverished area in which many children suffer from nutrition-sapping and pain-inducing intestinal parasites. Many of the children came to school the week after deworming last year reporting reduced abdominal cramping and distension.
  • Provision of first aid supplies to the school and the creation of a medical file with growth chart for each of the school's students
  • Donated multivitamins ensuring that children with HIV and other conditions placing them at increased risk for malnutrition had access to the most basic daily nutrients


All of this help meant the world to the students of Shine Academy in Kibera. But our ability to impact the lives of these children does not end there.

From a waiting list of hundreds, Shine Academy has accepted a new baby class this year, bringing the total number of students in the school from 75 to 110. I am asking for your help to continue one of Shine Academy's most critical programs: full meals every day for all 110 students, ensuring they will have access to the nutrition they need to focus on their studies and become the innovators that will help improve their community.

Please, return to Kibera with me.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even $10 can make a huge difference in this campaign. But times are tough for many and you can help in other ways besides monetary donations. Regardless of what you can donate, consider doing the following:

  • Share the link to this campaign on your Facebook page, on Twitter, or on your web site.
  • Send an email to your friends, family, and colleagues letting them know about the campaign.
  • Learn something about Kibera. There is perhaps no greater force than education to counter poverty and injustice. The links embedded throughout this page can be used as a starting point.

What's with the "Buzz" and "No-Buzz"?

This year every dollar that you spend earns you a vote on whether or not I should shave my head.
       (*donate enough $ in favor of the buzz and you can bankrupt my boyfriend!)  


Why Me?

I return to Kenya because I feel moved to do so.

In the winter of 2011 I arrived in Kenya as a CDC-Hubert Global Health Fellow. While on temporary duty in the offices of the United States Centers for Disease Control in Nairobi I fell in love with Shine Academy.

I was so impressed by the dedication of Shine Academy's teachers and the strength of spirit of its pupils, and wanted to support them. But I didn't yet have all the clinical training I needed to help them in the way I thought would do the most good. Prior to arriving in Kenya I worked on international health projects in the USA, Mexico, Guatemala, Nicaragua, and Ecuador. I earned my Master of Public Health (MPH) with a focus on humanitarian assistance from Johns Hopkins, and by the summer of 2011 I graduated with my Medical Doctorate (MD) from the Virginia Commonwealth University School of Medicine with a focus on international, inner-city, and rural medicine.

I am now only seven months away from completing my post-graduate medical training in Family and Community Medicine at the University of Arizona. I have delivered almost 50 babies and cared for newborns, school-age children, Baby Boomers, and octogenarians in the delivery room, the clinic, and the intensive care unit. I am thrilled to the have the opportunity to return to Kibera again as a practicing clinician.

Why is the Shine Academy Important?

"The children almost broken by the world become the adults most likely to change it."
-Fran Warren-

Shine Academy was founded through the Impoverished Children NGO by Australians Catherine Whiting and Javier Martinez in 2008. The couple has found a home in Kenya ever since. They established Shine Academy in order to provide quality education to children who otherwise would not have access. Each year hundreds of families come out to interview for the school's available slots. The Academy specifically recruits those with HIV/AIDS, orphans, and children suffering from violence.

In order to help kids in such difficult straits succeed, Catherine and Javier provide 2 meals a day at school, counseling services to parents, fight the corrupt practices of local government officials, and have regularly gone searching through this dangerous slum to search for their missing students. In the fall of 2013 Catherine & Javier opened a new rescue home for children and single parents fleeing abusive situations who need a place to sleep in safety.

                      

Why Kibera?

Kibera is a place where hundreds of thousands live without running water or functioning latrines, 5 to a room (or more). It is a place where the primary source of electricity is the illegal hook-up a family must run to the nearest main line, resulting in regular horrifying fires throughout the slum. It is a place where children are routinely sexually assaulted and disappear while government officials are easily bribed to look the other way.

Research done by Kenyan physicians and public health officers show that malnutrition is rampant.

Recent estimates vary on the prevalence of HIV/AIDS in the area, but local NGOs estimate that it is higher than the national average, and the number of orphaned children from HIV+ parents living in the slum is an indication that access to antiretroviral medications has historically been inadequate.

Estimates of Kibera's population range widely. Current geospatial mapping indicates that roughly 270,000 people are crowded into the slum, a space "roughly 75% of the area of Manhattan's Central Park", yet Kibera is a place of children. Close to 50% of those living in the slum are under the age of 15.


*What is Tikkun?

Tikkun is a Hebrew word which can be roughly translated as "to heal" or "to repair". There are myriad ways to seek tikkun outside of the provision of healthcare or medical supplies. Education itself, the gift of the Shine Academy, is transformative - with the power to mend past wrongs, counter injustice, and pave a path to healing.
story_txt:
The Goal of TK2013


  There are now 110 pupils at Shine Academy, a small school in Kibera Slum, Kenya, run by the Impoverished Children NGO. The goal of TK2013 is simple:


Raise $4400 to provide breakfast for all these 110 students for one year.


Raise $110 to provide deworming medication and education for all pupils for one year. Intestinal worms steal precious nutrients from their hosts. Deworming is one of the most cost-effective public health interventions available.

Deliver health education on the topics of prenatal care, pregnancy, and children's health for families whose children attend the school.
  
Complete repeat medical and nutritional assessments for the school’s 75 older pupils as well as the members of the school’s newest and youngest class. I will be returning to Nairobi in October and will update medical charts started for every child and stored in a locked area of the school during my visit last year.
  


What is Tikkun Kibera?


My name is Esther Johnston. I am a family physician and a public health practitioner, and I started the Tikkun Kibera campaign to provide funding support, medical assistance and health education at Shine Academy.


Last year the first round of our fundraising collected over $3200 to support the children of Shine. I could tell you and over and over how grateful I am, but here is what you achieved:



Breakfast for a year for over 75 students, many of whom have no regular access to meals outside of those provided though the school.


Deworming of all of the school’s pupils. It doesn't take more than $1 per year to provide a critical medical treatment in an impoverished area in which many children suffer from nutrition-sapping and pain-inducing intestinal parasites. Many of the children came to school the week after deworming last year reporting reduced abdominal cramping and distension.


Provision of first aid supplies to the school and the creation of a medical file with growth chart for each of the school's students


Donated multivitamins ensuring that children with HIV and other conditions placing them at increased risk for malnutrition had access to the most basic daily nutrients








  All of this help meant the world to the students of Shine Academy in Kibera. But our ability to impact the lives of these children does not end there.

  From a waiting list of hundreds, Shine Academy has accepted a new baby class this year, bringing the total number of students in the school from 75 to 110. I am asking for your help to continue one of Shine Academy's most critical programs: full meals every day for all 110 students, ensuring they will have access to the nutrition they need to focus on their studies and become the innovators that will help improve their community.


Please, return to Kibera with me.


  Other Ways You Can Help


  Even $10 can make a huge difference in this campaign. But times are tough for many and you can help in other ways besides monetary donations. Regardless of what you can donate, consider doing the following:



Share the link to this campaign on your Facebook page, on Twitter, or on your web site.
  

Send an email to your friends, family, and colleagues letting them know about the campaign.
  

Learn something about Kibera. There is perhaps no greater force than education to counter poverty and injustice. The links embedded throughout this page can be used as a starting point.
  


  What's with the "Buzz" and "No-Buzz"?


This year every dollar that you spend earns you a vote on whether or not I should shave my head.

        
  (*donate enough $ in favor of the buzz and you can bankrupt my boyfriend!)
   
  



  Why Me?


  I return to Kenya because I feel moved to do so.


  In the winter of 2011 I arrived in Kenya as a CDC-Hubert Global Health Fellow. While on temporary duty in the offices of the United States Centers for Disease Control in Nairobi I fell in love with Shine Academy.


  I was so impressed by the dedication of Shine Academy's teachers and the strength of spirit of its pupils, and wanted to support them. But I didn't yet have all the clinical training I needed to help them in the way I thought would do the most good. Prior to arriving in Kenya I worked on international health projects in the USA, Mexico, Guatemala, Nicaragua, and Ecuador. I earned my Master of Public Health (MPH) with a focus on humanitarian assistance from Johns Hopkins, and by the summer of 2011 I graduated with my Medical Doctorate (MD) from the Virginia Commonwealth University School of Medicine with a focus on international, inner-city, and rural medicine.


  I am now only seven months away from completing my post-graduate medical training in Family and Community Medicine at the University of Arizona. I have delivered almost 50 babies and cared for newborns, school-age children, Baby Boomers, and octogenarians in the delivery room, the clinic, and the intensive care unit. I am thrilled to the have the opportunity to return to Kibera again as a practicing clinician.





Why is the Shine Academy Important?


"The children almost broken by the world become the adults most likely to change it."
  -Fran Warren-


Shine Academy was founded through the Impoverished Children NGO by Australians Catherine Whiting and Javier Martinez in 2008. The couple has found a home in Kenya ever since. They established Shine Academy in order to provide quality education to children who otherwise would not have access. Each year hundreds of families come out to interview for the school's available slots. The Academy specifically recruits those with HIV/AIDS, orphans, and children suffering from violence.


  In order to help kids in such difficult straits succeed, Catherine and Javier provide 2 meals a day at school, counseling services to parents, fight the corrupt practices of local government officials, and have regularly gone searching through this dangerous slum to search for their missing students. In the fall of 2013 Catherine & Javier opened a new rescue home for children and single parents fleeing abusive situations who need a place to sleep in safety.


                        
  

  Why Kibera?


Kibera is a place where hundreds of thousands live without running water or functioning latrines, 5 to a room (or more). It is a place where the primary source of electricity is the illegal hook-up a family must run to the nearest main line, resulting in regular horrifying fires throughout the slum. It is a place where children are routinely sexually assaulted and disappear while government officials are easily bribed to look the other way.


  Research done by Kenyan physicians and public health officers show that malnutrition is rampant.


  Recent estimates vary on the prevalence of HIV/AIDS in the area, but local NGOs estimate that it is higher than the national average, and the number of orphaned children from HIV+ parents living in the slum is an indication that access to antiretroviral medications has historically been inadequate.


  Estimates of Kibera's population range widely. Current geospatial mapping indicates that roughly 270,000 people are crowded into the slum, a space "roughly 75% of the area of Manhattan's Central Park", yet Kibera is a place of children. Close to 50% of those living in the slum are under the age of 15.


*What is Tikkun?


Tikkun is a Hebrew word which can be roughly translated as "to heal" or "to repair". There are myriad ways to seek tikkun outside of the provision of healthcare or medical supplies. Education itself, the gift of the Shine Academy, is transformative - with the power to mend past wrongs, counter injustice, and pave a path to healing.

story:
Attached is a link to a letter Giovanna wrote in 2012 about her illness. Please check it out:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1XdACb6IC7blJK0qQl7QIUyFZ5Oi-R8GntMZXC3AUAto/edit?usp=sharing

Attached below is a link of pictures of where Giovanna currently lives:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1SUKO7lXkZ52NRYiTmqX9fEDST6bRY7ifDNyFkYZNYJ4/edit?usp=sharing

Our Story                                                                                    

             Where do I start? I’m sure you have heard it all and seen it all- people writing letters and taking videos about what is happening with their lives; their pains and sorrows, heartaches and problems that have halted their lives.   Out of desperation and not knowing where to turn, we decided to start a fund raising in order to bring hope and light again in our lives, and maybe , just maybe, a smile that willdominate into a lifetime of hope.  I am one of those people who is looking for that smile for my sister.  She was diagnosed with Lyme disease 6 years ago and not knowing she has had it, has made our lives for the past 3 years the hardest imaginable.  Along with the Lyme disease, she has environmental illness which has turned our lives upside down. Environmental illness is difficult to live with.  Individuals who have this are hypersensitive and some like my sister are affected by electricity, magnetic fields, low and high frequencies. This means she can’t be around any chemical smells (perfume, soaps, etc...), anything that works on electricity, electrical wires, transformers, cell phones, computers, motors of any kind and so on. You can imagine how difficult it has been for us.  Apart from that, she is also light sensitive and has been living in the dark for the past 2 ½ years

            We live in the Laurentians, north of Montreal, Canada.  In 2009, from the month of August up until November, we lived in the dark with no electricity to accommodate my sister’s needs.  The doctors said she needed to be away from the elements that make her ill.  That is why we took her in, my husband and I and our two young children of 8 and 4 and a half years of age.  It was very difficult; our children sacrificed so much for their aunt.  We used hot bottles to warm up when autumn came along. Using heaters was out of the question in order to help my sister.  Winter was soon on its way and out of desperation, I contacted her doctor and she said that some people isolated themselves to keep away from the elements that are keeping them sick.

            We then built an 8x12 trailer in the hopes that it could be used to transport her to where she could be safe and bring her to her doctor.  Unfortunately, because we needed to build it a specific way using inert materials that her sensitivities could handle, the trailer ended up weighing too much and wasn’t safe to move.  She lived in the trailer for about 2 years, electricity free, with no bathroom.  She did her waste in glass jars that we emptied daily.  She is connected to our home to heat her trailer through a water heating system.

            Her needs are getting too much for me and my family to handle.  We needed help to build her a safe home but no one had the heart to support us.  My parents took a 125 000.00 mortgage to help her and we are now 50 000.00 in debt because of the special materials that were needed; we went way over budget.  We don’t have the money to pay it and the interest keeps increasing. She lived in her atelier (workshop) next to her house for about 8 months.  She was hospitalized at Notre Dame Hospital in late October 2012, but the doctors didn’t know how to help her.  They have been tossing her from hospital to hospital - three hospitals in four months; as one doctor put it, she is the patient no doctor wants.  We would want to take her to the Environmental Health Centre in Dallas run by Doctor William Rhea who can help her.  However, it is in the US and the province where we live does not recognize my sister’s illness and will not pay for treatments.  Her doctor told us that it can costs up to 10 thousand a week to treat her.  That’s money we don’t have.  Our parents just took out a mortgage to help build her home (which is too new for her to live in), but the off gassing of the materials used are affecting her sensitivities so she cannot live there for much longer. We have run out of time and money to help her.  Her treatments are costly and the government won’t help people in her situation.  I’ve been using my children’s monthly support allowance and I’ve used up all my savings.  We are literally at the end of our rope and holding on but the pressure is getting to me and I’m being torn between my children, husband and sister.  I am only one person and I can only do so much. We are trying to change Quebec’s view on this illness.  I hope you can find it in your heart to help in any way possible so we can help my sister today and others in the future.

Thank You,

The Guagliardo and Vaccarella Families

 

What We Need

Our goal is to raise $130,000. Before Giovanna can go to Texas, she needs to go to another specialized Doctor for strengthening treatments. This can last anywhere from 1 to 2 months. These treatments cost at least $10,000. Giovanna needs a caretaker as well and a place to stay, food, and personal hygiene products. These funds would keep her there for at least 4 months, where she can hopefully overcome her illness. Any contribution would be greatly appreciated! If we do exceed our goal, the rest of the money will be put into a Lyme Disease Foundation for other people going through the same thing as my aunt, and will also be put towards a website for spreading the knowledge and people’s stories on Lyme disease. Her birthday is March 15th. Let’s make this a memorable birthday for her by raising enough money to help!

The Impact

Lyme disease is a relatively new diagnosis in the medical field, even though it has been around for quite some time. Many people are being misdiagnosed, like my aunt, and when they are correctly diagnosed, it is sometimes too late. I don’t want my aunt to be one of those people. I want to raise awareness for Lyme disease, and let people know that it truly does exist, and it does ruin a person’s life. Not only will this help my aunt in overcoming this illness, it will also help raise awareness of this horrible disease and hopefully help others in the process.

Other Ways You Can Help

Any contribution can help! A dollar per person can make a huge difference! Any amount is welcome and  please share this link with your friends, be it by e-mail, Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Reddit, etc.

story:
We are two young athletes Michal Krysta and Stanislav Mayer, who participate in extreme race RedBullXAlps 2013 (www.redbullxalps.com). It has been our dream since 2003. We started paragliding, climbing, studying routes and hard training. Now we got into the race.

RedBullXAlps is nonstop paragliding race from Salzburg to Monaco. It is more than 800 miles. The athlete can use only paragliding wing and his legs. No other kind of transport is allowed.

The idea of this race is amazing for us and fulfilled our dreams. It is really a huge challenge. We are disappointed that getting sponsorship can be so difficult.

We are looking for some donates mainly to support car transportation and our missing equipment. You can find more information on our websites www.xalps.cz or you can enjoy our videos on YouTube. (http://www.youtube.com/channel/UCymvhD3dJhmOZXaLKj2wW-Q).

 

We would like to present this race to other people, mostly the young generation and impress them. We believe that we can change their lives in the same way it changed ours.  

 

We are not expecting that everyone will be able to contribute. It does not mean you cannot help, although you would like to.


You can help us by sharing, linking, tweeting or blogging about this project. Just copy the share link from above and paste it on your social networks. Or better, join our campaign team!

story:
The Project: Respite Services for Regular People.  And, How You Can Help...

An overnight or weekend of:  Peace, solitude and reflection; True relaxation and recuperation, With no interruptions, No daily responsibilities....   Just Ahhh...... Come to the Oasis!

  • MY BACKGROUND:   Respite Care for Regular People is a service I've wanted to add to my practice for some time.  Hi, I'm LaDonna Macomber, a mental health counselor in Salem, Oregon.  I've owned and run my private practice for 23 years, and overall have been in the counseling profession for 30 years.  It's great work and I love doing it.  Adding Respite care for Regular People will broaden my practice, and help me address this unique need in society.  See, below, what your contribution can do to help!
  • Creative Approach:  I have always added more to my work than just counseling and therapy.  When clients experience life transitions and need to re-make themselves, I offer them a variety of tools, to help them make informed choices about their new directions.  Two of the best of these tools are the Strong Interest Inventory and the Meyers Briggs Type Indicator, both of which I am licensed to provide.  I have offered some of this expertise to contributors, in my various thank-you-perks outlined on this page.  
  • My Credentials: I'm state licensed, nationally certified times 2, and credentialed to provide life coaching services and clinical supervision to other counselors.  I have years of experience running programs, supervising, and managing large projects.  I am well suited to see this project through.  Only funding has stood in the way of doing so in the past.  See, below, what your contribution can do to help!
  • MY CAMPAIGN:  Respite Relief will provide respite care services to regular people, who have "hit the wall" with too many responsibilities or activities, or who give so much to others that they are exhausted, over-stressed, and Just Need A Break.  Help me help them!
  • Who Benefits from Respite Care?  Regular, everyday people. Anyone who is burned-out, stressed out, over-booked, or over-worked.  Anyone who does care-giving for a living or for a family member, has experienced a recent loss or trauma.  Anyone who needs a break.  Most of us would say we all could use a weekend of respite at the end of a stressful week or the completion of a large project. 
  • What Does the Respite Visitor Experience?   Each respite room is a private, personal retreat, simply furnished for rest, relaxation and sleep - meditation, yoga, and journal writing - reading, full-spectrum light therapy, and simple meals with in-room refrigerator and microwave.  No need for the Respite Visitor to leave the room and encounter other people.  Only rest, relaxation, and rejuvenation are on the agenda.  After a day or a weekend, the Respite Visitor leaves refreshed and ready to resume daily responsibilities.  See below what your contribution can do to help!
  • I am passionate about this project.  There is such a need for regular people who endure high stress in their lives, of whatever kind, to have the opportunity, and a place to go, to rest and recuperate.  Help me provide this service!
  • WHY THIS CAMPAIGN NOW?  It's the right time.  When my long-time office associate, and dear friend, informed me she'd be retiring as of December 1st, I realized I would be required to transition, as well.  I thought: either I have to size down and move to a smaller office that I can manage on my own, OR, I need to expand and pursue my dream of adding respite care to my therapeutic practice. 
  • For some time, I've wanted to move in this direction, and have taken steps toward this goal, including applying for grants and negotiating on a property.  Until now, the stars have not aligned.  With funds raised by this campaign, all my previous sketches and design plans, mission statements and strategic plans will become more than just fun mini-projects.  I have the energy and vision to get this project done, but previously have lacked enough funds.  Your kind support and generous contributions will make this project happen. 


What We Need & What You Get


  • WHAT I NEED TO LAUNCH THIS PROJECT:  I set the goal for this campaign at $20,000, because I want to make sure, with our hard work and your help, we can make it there.  I've learned from past experience that I need at least  $20,000 to $30,000 to entice a seller of the right property to carry my contract.  Why do I need this? Salary and wage earners can obtain bank financing based on their total, gross income.  Self employed persons are held to a different standard.  We qualify for bank financing based on our net income, after all expenses are taken out of the total.  This leaves us with a lower income and qualifies us for smaller sums of financing.  The way I can make this project happen is to convince a seller to carry my contract.  $20,0000 to $30,000 would win over a seller. So, for Phase I, $20,000 is the goal.  Again, your contributions, of any amount, add up and will make the all difference in helping make this project a reality.
  • WHAT YOU GET FOR HELPING:  You gain the good feeling and satisfaction of giving people who are exhausted and over-stressed, the opportunity to take a time-out from their overwhelming daily responsibilities.  You help "Give Them a Break" with your contribution.  See, below, what your contribution of any amount can do.   In addition, I will provide updates for you on the progress of the project on the campaign's Updates page and via facebook.  And, of course, I have provided some fun and interesting thank-you-perks at each level of contribution, which you may want to check out and claim.
  • WHERE THE FUNDS GO:  Whatever amount this campaign generates will go toward obtaining a suitable facility to house Respite Relief.  If we don't reach our funding goals, I will search for a smaller space with fewer respite rooms.  If we exceed our funding goals, I'll look for a larger facility with more respite rooms.  Your generous contributions will truly make all the difference.  Thank you for your help and support.

  • WHAT YOUR DONATION MEANS:  Contributions of any size are greatly appreciated!  Donations in the range of: $15 to $49 are equivalent to a weekend of simple, in-room meals for a respite visitor; yoga CD or yoga mat for a respite room; guided meditation, self hypnosis or relaxation CDs; essential oils for relaxation; aroma therapy supplies; a journal for writing; $50 to $99 are equivalent to comfortable bedding for a respite room; in-room microwave for simple meals; black out curtains for a calm environment; sound system for relaxation CDs or calming music; $100 to $299 are equivalent to an in-room refrigerator for a respite room; a therapeutic, full spectrum lamp for light therapy; a free over night stay for a respite visitor; $300 to $500 are equivalent to a small dining set for a respite room; a comfortable bed; three to five free over nights for respite visitors.

  • Your Contributions Help Create a Private Oasis With a Focus on Rejuvenation, for Deserving, Hardworking People .


The Impact


  • WHY IS RESPITE RELIEF VALUABLE?  Respite Relief is a service for regular, every day people.  It positively impacts the community, as it acknowledges and normalizes our honest feelings of overwhelm.  We all have them at some time or other.  Respite Relief provides one kind of answer to the problem of burdensome levels of stress in our society.  Why do our citizens have road rage?  Why do we scream at our families or kick the dog?  We, as a society, need positive ways to express our earned frustrations.  And, we, as individuals, need concrete answers and processes --simple things to do-- to reduce our high stress so we may function more successfully and peacefully as individuals and communities.  Respite Relief will help this happen.


Other Ways You Can Help


Of course, this campaign is about moving toward the funding goal.  I know some people just aren't able to donate, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help this campaign:

  • HOW YOU CAN HELP!  You can tell everyone you know about my campaign: Send an email to everyone on your list, Ask your contacts to email it on to 10 of their contacts, Talk about this campaign to your friends in person, on twitter, facebook, Show them my you tube video that explains this unique project, etc.  You can: Ask your friends and family, and encourage everyone you know, to come to my Indiegogo campaign page and make a contribution of any amount.  You can: Follow our progress in meeting our funding goals, Re-contact everyone you know at different times during this 47-day campaign, and ask them to help keep the funding process moving. You can: Direct your contacts to my business facebook page, Respite Relief, where I add periodic updates.  There is a link from there to this Indiegogo campaign.  Most importantly, you can: use the short link to my campaign:  http://igg.me/at/respite-relief  copy it and pass it on through social media to your friends to use, to direct people to this campaign.  This will keep the energy around Respite Relief constant and moving toward the end line.  All this will teach people about Respite Relief and create buzz about the project.  I am grateful for anything you do to help.   Many thanks for your support!  
  • That short link again:  http://igg.me/at/respite-relief.
story_txt:
The Project: Respite Services for Regular People.  And, How You Can Help...

An overnight or weekend of:  Peace, solitude and reflection; True relaxation and recuperation, With no interruptions, No daily responsibilities....   Just Ahhh...... Come to the Oasis!


MY BACKGROUND:   Respite Care for Regular People is a service I've wanted to add to my practice for some time.  Hi, I'm LaDonna Macomber, a mental health counselor in Salem, Oregon.  I've owned and run my private practice for 23 years, and overall have been in the counseling profession for 30 years.  It's great work and I love doing it.  Adding Respite care for Regular People will broaden my practice, and help me address this unique need in society.  See, below, what your contribution can do to help!


Creative Approach:  I have always added more to my work than just counseling and therapy.  When clients experience life transitions and need to re-make themselves, I offer them a variety of tools, to help them make informed choices about their new directions.  Two of the best of these tools are the Strong Interest Inventory and the Meyers Briggs Type Indicator, both of which I am licensed to provide.  I have offered some of this expertise to contributors, in my various thank-you-perks outlined on this page.  

My Credentials: I'm state licensed, nationally certified times 2, and credentialed to provide life coaching services and clinical supervision to other counselors.  I have years of experience running programs, supervising, and managing large projects.  I am well suited to see this project through.  Only funding has stood in the way of doing so in the past.  See, below, what your contribution can do to help!


MY CAMPAIGN:  Respite Relief will provide respite care services to regular people, who have "hit the wall" with too many responsibilities or activities, or who give so much to others that they are exhausted, over-stressed, and Just Need A Break.  Help me help them! 


Who Benefits from Respite Care?  Regular, everyday people. Anyone who is burned-out, stressed out, over-booked, or over-worked.  Anyone who does care-giving for a living or for a family member, has experienced a recent loss or trauma.  Anyone who needs a break.  Most of us would say we all could use a weekend of respite at the end of a stressful week or the completion of a large project.  


What Does the Respite Visitor Experience?   Each respite room is a private, personal retreat, simply furnished for rest, relaxation and sleep - meditation, yoga, and journal writing - reading, full-spectrum light therapy, and simple meals with in-room refrigerator and microwave.  No need for the Respite Visitor to leave the room and encounter other people.  Only rest, relaxation, and rejuvenation are on the agenda.  After a day or a weekend, the Respite Visitor leaves refreshed and ready to resume daily responsibilities.  See below what your contribution can do to help!


I am passionate about this project.  There is such a need for regular people who endure high stress in their lives, of whatever kind, to have the opportunity, and a place to go, to rest and recuperate.  Help me provide this service!


WHY THIS CAMPAIGN NOW?  It's the right time.  When my long-time office associate, and dear friend, informed me she'd be retiring as of December 1st, I realized I would be required to transition, as well.  I thought: either I have to size down and move to a smaller office that I can manage on my own, OR, I need to expand and pursue my dream of adding respite care to my therapeutic practice.  


For some time, I've wanted to move in this direction, and have taken steps toward this goal, including applying for grants and negotiating on a property.  Until now, the stars have not aligned.  With funds raised by this campaign, all my previous sketches and design plans, mission statements and strategic plans will become more than just fun mini-projects.  I have the energy and vision to get this project done, but previously have lacked enough funds.  Your kind support and generous contributions will make this project happen. 



What We Need & What You Get



WHAT I NEED TO LAUNCH THIS PROJECT:  I set the goal for this campaign at $20,000, because I want to make sure, with our hard work and your help, we can make it there.  I've learned from past experience that I need at least  $20,000 to $30,000 to entice a seller of the right property to carry my contract.  Why do I need this? Salary and wage earners can obtain bank financing based on their total, gross income.  Self employed persons are held to a different standard.  We qualify for bank financing based on our net income, after all expenses are taken out of the total.  This leaves us with a lower income and qualifies us for smaller sums of financing.  The way I can make this project happen is to convince a seller to carry my contract.  $20,0000 to $30,000 would win over a seller. So, for Phase I, $20,000 is the goal.  Again, your contributions, of any amount, add up and will make the all difference in helping make this project a reality.


WHAT YOU GET FOR HELPING:  You gain the good feeling and satisfaction of giving people who are exhausted and over-stressed, the opportunity to take a time-out from their overwhelming daily responsibilities.  You help "Give Them a Break" with your contribution.  See, below, what your contribution of any amount can do.   In addition, I will provide updates for you on the progress of the project on the campaign's Updates page and via facebook.  And, of course, I have provided some fun and interesting thank-you-perks at each level of contribution, which you may want to check out and claim.


WHERE THE FUNDS GO:  Whatever amount this campaign generates will go toward obtaining a suitable facility to house Respite Relief.  If we don't reach our funding goals, I will search for a smaller space with fewer respite rooms.  If we exceed our funding goals, I'll look for a larger facility with more respite rooms.  Your generous contributions will truly make all the difference.  Thank you for your help and support.

WHAT YOUR DONATION MEANS:  Contributions of any size are greatly appreciated!  Donations in the range of: $15 to $49 are equivalent to a weekend of simple, in-room meals for a respite visitor; yoga CD or yoga mat for a respite room; guided meditation, self hypnosis or relaxation CDs; essential oils for relaxation; aroma therapy supplies; a journal for writing; $50 to $99 are equivalent to comfortable bedding for a respite room; in-room microwave for simple meals; black out curtains for a calm environment; sound system for relaxation CDs or calming music; $100 to $299 are equivalent to an in-room refrigerator for a respite room; a therapeutic, full spectrum lamp for light therapy; a free over night stay for a respite visitor; $300 to $500 are equivalent to a small dining set for a respite room; a comfortable bed; three to five free over nights for respite visitors.
Your Contributions Help Create a Private Oasis With a Focus on Rejuvenation, for Deserving, Hardworking People .

The Impact 



WHY IS RESPITE RELIEF VALUABLE?  Respite Relief is a service for regular, every day people.  It positively impacts the community, as it acknowledges and normalizes our honest feelings of overwhelm.  We all have them at some time or other.  Respite Relief provides one kind of answer to the problem of burdensome levels of stress in our society.  Why do our citizens have road rage?  Why do we scream at our families or kick the dog?  We, as a society, need positive ways to express our earned frustrations.  And, we, as individuals, need concrete answers and processes --simple things to do-- to reduce our high stress so we may function more successfully and peacefully as individuals and communities.  Respite Relief will help this happen.




Other Ways You Can Help

Of course, this campaign is about moving toward the funding goal.  I know some people just aren't able to donate, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help this campaign:


HOW YOU CAN HELP!  You can tell everyone you know about my campaign: Send an email to everyone on your list, Ask your contacts to email it on to 10 of their contacts, Talk about this campaign to your friends in person, on twitter, facebook, Show them my you tube video that explains this unique project, etc.  You can: Ask your friends and family, and encourage everyone you know, to come to my Indiegogo campaign page and make a contribution of any amount.  You can: Follow our progress in meeting our funding goals, Re-contact everyone you know at different times during this 47-day campaign, and ask them to help keep the funding process moving. You
 can: Direct your contacts to my business facebook page, Respite Relief, 
where I add periodic updates.  There is a link from there to this 
Indiegogo campaign.  Most importantly, you can: use the short link to my 
campaign:  http://igg.me/at/respite-relief  copy it and pass it on through social media to your friends to use, to direct people to this campaign.  This will keep the energy around Respite Relief constant and moving toward the end line.  All this will teach people about Respite Relief and create buzz about the project.  I am grateful for anything you do to help.   Many thanks for your support!  

That short link again:  http://igg.me/at/respite-relief.

story:
The best is enough

Our body is sensitive. We keep changing everyday.  Even it is the best, we may get tired of it someday. That why we introduce this lovely, most functional vibrator egg to you and your love. 

This powerful and silent egg can give you a new pleasure to your life. The 69 egg has many function you dream of. You must find the most comfortable one for you. 

This Wireless Remote Control Egg is waterproof, ultra discreet, powerful and the small, discreet remote can slip into your pocket and works within 15-25 foot range!

Available in two color, will confirm with you thru email.

Thank you for reading

Please support us. We hope we can bring a new fantasy experience to you. Hope you enjoy.

story:
“TELL YOUR BODY WHAT TO DO, DON’T LET YOUR BODY TELL YOU” ~ CHELOMAN

Hi , My name is Jose Alonzo.  I go by Chelo Man or Chelo for short.  I have been boxing since I was only seven years old, and boxed professionally for a total of 15 years.  Last year I retired from boxing after an injury put me in position were if I got hit the wrong way one more time, I may not recover.

When you have been training to fight, or fighting your whole life, an injury might make most people want to just throw in the towel.  But not me; instead, I have decided to use my knowledge of training, nutrition, and motivation to help people hit their goals.

This is where you come in.  I want us to open a gym like no other you have ever been to.  I actually want to open 300 gyms, but I understand that every race in life starts with just one step.  With your pledge, I can open Chelo Man Fitness 24/7.  My gym will not be like the traditional gym.  Most people don’t realize that some of the most physically fit people in the world were Cave Man, Apache Indians, Gladiators, Mongol Warriors, and Vikings.  These people were intense athletes, and none of them had fancy machines to work out with.   They worked out using natural movements, and are considered some of the best athletes that ever lived.  This is what Chelo Man Fitness is all about.  We will have a 1,800 square foot rock climbing wall to simulate climbing mountains; straight, and inclined monkey bars to simulate climbing in the jungle; pull up bars and dip stations to help with upper body strength; jump boxes to help with lower body conditioning; climbing ropes for your core work out; indoor track for cardiovascular workouts.  We will also have boxing/MMA area to work on striking, kicking, and endurance.  Plus we will have over 3,000 lbs of dumbbells, Olympic, and kettle bells for traditional work outs.


To start getting people ready for our gym I have been organizing teams, and traning them for Mud Runs.  Below is some members of a team of 82 people who ran in a Mud Run with Team Chelo in July 2013.


Below is another team that competed in March of 2013.

 

 I am teaming up with some great people to make this happen.  I have my business partner Jeffrey.  Jeff is a retired US Army Military Policeman and Paratrooper.  He has also has been a finance manager for over 13 years, and his job is to make sure the money is right.  Our gym will be staffed with a professional athlete at all times.  We have a current Florida Swat Officer, and ex VMI star football player who will train people on how to create explosive power in their work outs.  We will have a Registered Nurse, with an emphasis on nutrition.  Her job is to create personalized nutritional programs for all members wanting help.  We will have a certified personal trainer specializing in performance and fat burning exercises.  He is also certified TRX trainer.  TRX uses your body weight and rubber bands to push body conditioning to the limit.  And lastly, we have a MMA fighter, who will teach striking, kicking, and endurance training.  All of our trainers will be certified personal trainers, and have excelled athletically in their profession.  This is important because most gyms hire trainers that are not certified, and this can be very dangerous.

All of our 180 group training classes offered each month will  be free.  You don’t pay your gym dues, and then pay more to have someone help you reach your goals.  All the Boot camps, Yoga, Cross Training, Circuit Training, TRX Classes, Boxing, MMA Classes, Nutrition Classes, Kick Boxing, and Rock Climbing Classes are always FREE!!!

Below Chelo is working with the Wounded Warriors Foundation.  It's about giving back to the community.   

 

We have broken down where the money that we raise will be going to...

Projected costs for build out and operating expenses for 6,600 square foot facility:

Rent (Start up): $16,500

Flooring/ Indoor Track with install: $20,500

Rope Climbing (3) stations: $275

Weight- Olympic, Bar Bells, & Kettle Bells: $12,400

Benches (12) Adjustable: $2,990

             (6) Flat: $995

Computer, & POS Equipment: $1,195

44 Ft of Stag Racking (Pull up/ Squat): $6,995

Monkey Bars (3 sets): $1,495

Dip Stations (6): $599

Pylo Boxes (6): $599

Sledge Hammer Station (4): $599

Boxing/ MMA Stations (6): $2,394

Rock Climbing Wall 1,600 Sq Ft: $10,500

Paint, and Build Out: $1,995

Sign/ Advertising: $5,995

Insurance: $5,000

Misc (Because you always overlook stuff): $4,995

Total: $93,716


I know the gym will cost more than what we are trying to collect.  But my business partner Jeffrey, and I, have been saving and are covering the rest.  This is a dream that can come true with just a little help from the community.

 Here are some of the perks you will receive....

 A 45 day supply of Chelo Man Multi-Vitamin Energy Complex.  Give yourself energy, while taking all the vitamins your body needs daily to be a champ.


Chelo wearing one of the free One of a Kind shirts donated by Jeffrey '69 Clothing to help Chelo reach his goal.


Some members of "Team Chelo" wearing the t-shirt we will be giving as a perk if you donate $50 or more.  The t-shirt will be a different color to commemorate this crowd funding event.

This is it...  Hopefully you have learned a little bit more about me and what I stand for.  I have had many set backs in life.  But I have excelled from every challenge put in front of me.  Please help me make my dream of Chelo Man Fitness become a reality.  Thanks for taking the time to hear my story.

Chelo and his family.

Boom! You Can and You Will!!!

story:
Origins

Tec Quidditch is based inside the university “Instituto Tecnológico y de Estudios Superiores de Monterrey (ITESM)” in Monterrey, a city of Nuevo Leon, México. Tec Quidditch was founded in August 2011. Since then, the main board  has been integrated by Antonio Cruz as President, Antonio Miguel as Vice-President, Palmira Obeso as General Coordinator and Alberto Rodríguez as treasurer.

Once the board was assembled, the Quidditch club was officially recognized at ITESM as a sport club and a official student organization.

Tec Quidditch's main goal since the beginnig was to attend the quidditch world cup in order to represent our country, Mexico, and in order to do so, the group has made many things in order to get funds. For example, on november 2011, the quidditch club organized contest called “The Biggest Potterhead” (a contest of knowledge about the Potter universe) in order to get money for quidditch equipment. Also, on march 2012, the quidditch club organized the first quidditch tournament in Monterrey, N.L. MX. We also sell t-shirts of popular culture, we make raffles and we also sell krispy kreme doughnuts in our campus.

But we still need your help!

Fortunately, we´ve gathered enough money to purchase our plane tickets, but we still need at least 2000 dls to cover hotel expenses.

Help us to make it to World Cup!

With your help, Mexico will be represented in quidditch world cup in an intercollegiate level for the first time!

Other Ways You Can Help

Plase share this campaign in your facebook, twitter or using the indiegogo share tools! Thank you so much for your help!

story:
THE PUNK ROPE STORY
Hi, my name is Tim Haft. I was born in Adrian, Michigan in 1960, but have lived most of my life in New York City. My professional life has focused on making the world a better place. I counseled inmates at Rikers Island in the 80s, advised college students in the 90s, and for the past 15 years I've coached people of all ages and abilities to get healthy and fit. 


In 2004, I created Punk Rope, which is like gym class for adults. Punk Rope is currently the most popular rope-jumping based fitness class in the world. While Punk Rope aims to help folks get fit, have fun, and burn off some steam, it's also about building community, celebrating the power of music, and giving back. 


Punk Rope has sponsored more than 200 events — most of them free — including clinics, classes, workshops, concerts, and the annual Punk Rope Games; organized fundraisers for numerous causes ranging from disaster relief to disease prevention; volunteered countless hours to promote health and fitness in collaboration with a wide array of non-profit organizations and government agencies; and created more than 100 free video tutorials, which have been viewed more than 850,000 times. In addition, we are completely transparent in sharing our methods, ideas, and knowledge with anybody interested in using our approach.

To continue offering the many free programs and services listed above, we need your help. And in return, the world will become a happier and healthier place. 

Specifically, we need financial assistance...

  1. To provide need-based scholarships to those unable to afford the Punk Rope Certification workshop. Such scholarships will help bringing rope jumping to economically disadvantaged neighborhoods. | $1000 per year
  2. To purchase 30 LED jump ropes, which will be used for multiple fundraisers and charitable events. | $600
  3. To purchase a high-quality camera in order to produce better stills and videos, which will allow us to reach an even wider audience. | $1000
  4. To cover the cost of travel to present Punk Rope and rope jumping workshops at physical education and fitness conferences. | $1000 per year
  5. To cover the expense of producing the Punk Rope Games. | $500 per year
  6. To cover the cost of organizing and producing the many free classes, clinics, and events we offer each year. | $1000 per year
If you're not able to contribute monetarily, you can still help us by mentioning what we do to folks you think would be interested. Feel free to spread the word about this campaign using the Indiegogo share tools.

Thank you for trusting us and for believing in what we do.
